Title: Ultra responsive
Review: The company were ultra responsive to my enquiry. The cover provided meets all my expectations (on paper).The representative was obviously having to cover all his legal obligations when dealing with my application but it seemed a little rushed & not quite 'As Personal' at it could have been. I was satisfied with the final outcome & everything was included in the 'Welcome' letter.

Title: If I could give this company 0 stars I…
Review: If I could give this company 0 stars I would. The service we have received is absolutely disgusting. I’ve rang 6/7 times today chasing an engineer to come out and fix our boiler. For the last three days now we’ve had no heating or hot water. They told us they have referred our job to the manufacturer which is a load of crap. I rang the manufacture and they have no record of the job! Absolutely disgusting customer service. Payed a call outout fee of £45 and the engineer didn’t even take the boiler apart. He just looked at it. Don’t go with these cowboys.

Title: Not only was our experience shameful, the company has attempted to have me silenced on Trustpilot and other review sites.
Review: Please read this review before placing your trust in this business. It would take me a week to detail all the areas where 247 let us down and behave in a manner which is beyond dodgy! Just a few are: 1. Abusing our personal details to repeatedly call, when you have expressly told them not to on several occasions. 2. Sending a racist engineer who told us ‘he only works for P****** because they pay him £15k a year more than his previous employer3. Supplying official paperwork telling us we needed essential safety work (not covered by our policy of course) despite never having carried out the necessary observation/ assessment of the area concerned. 4. Making critical errors in paperwork. Our boiler was serviced on 17/11/23; the date given for the next service required? 17/11/23. 5. Offering to quote for unnecessary work, which was described as a safety issue. 6. Their engineers will warn you that despite writing ‘customer not interested in new boiler’ you will get a call trying to sell you one, because that’s all they’re interested in. Taking your money! 7. Offering 3 months compensation for their poor service and engineer’s behaviour, then when you reiterate you want your contact details removed from their records, they cancel your policy completely, 3 months early, leaving you completely without cover over the winter. If you are considering this company for your boiler cover, be warned. Their customer service agents are ‘not allowed’ to escalate complaints to the managers. Apparently when their engineers tell you ‘they are all greedy (racist term!) who are only interested in taking your money’, they may indeed be speaking from experience.

Title: How's your crystal ball ?
Review: Don't know about you, but mine's often dim so I don't get to predict the future much. However, when it comes to the central heating boiler I know what could happen in the future if it isn't given a little TLC, which means an annual check at least. Here's where the people at 24/7 home rescue come into their own. For not a lot of wonga they provide the necessary, which doesn't have to include the entire heating system, but does cover everything boiler.  Fortunately I have the tools and experience to cope with the rest, so I only need the boiler taking care of with the afore mentioned TLC. Once found their website is easy to navigate and the form filling's a breeze, checkout's not at all complicated, and did I mention it's affordable ?All necessary documentation arrives via email PDF so no snail mail, and if like me you like to have a hard copy to hand it's done and dusted in minutes.Talking of which I need to go and give my crystal ball a polish.

Review: Polite and arrived within given time frameWas happy to answer questions

Title: Extremely disappointed
Review: Extremely disappointed! Very poor service. My boiler had issue on the 30th December 23. The engineer was quick to arrive but after spending 1 hour the engineer couldn't find out what was wrong with the boiler.  In the end he gave up and said he needs to order a new front panel which he will do today and will be back either same day or Wednesday 3rd January 24. I was very understanding as I know its holidays etc so I will have to survive with no heating and no hot water for next few days. Received call today on the 2nd January 24 and I was told they ordered the part today and it now now be delivered and fixed on the 9th. I am family of 4 with 2 young kids. One child is under 3 years. We have been left to die in this cold weather with no heating or hot water. We all are ill due to cold weather and using cold water. 4 days no one had a shower.i have been left with extreme disappointment as I paid the highest amount per month to this company from day 1. Never missed a payment and in return what I get? Lies, delays and no positive response or help.Would really like a manger to call me to resolve this issue ASAP otherwise I will take my complaint further to OMBUDSMAN.  If not resolvedLooking forward to quick response.

Title: This company is a poor excuse for "home…
Review: This company is a poor excuse for "home rescue" services. Have monthly cover with them and on 2 occasions we've called due to a leak from our upstairs water tank, water pouring through the ceiling downstairs for them to tell us they can get someone out tomorrow. I fail to see how this company is 24/7!! Absolutely useless, don't waste your money, use a company that will genuinely provide 24/7 help! And to top that of, said water tank had just been serviced with themselves a couple of weeks prior, we asked for several things to be checked as had noticed some unusual changes, but was told it's all working perfectly, would seem this was incorrect now we have a flood as now we have a flood due to these changes we asked to be looked at!

Title: My annually invoiced contract was massively increased.
Review: My annually invoiced contract was coming up for renewal at the end of January and I had an email advisory from this company saying that the monthly equivalent (but annually billed) rate was going up from just over 5 pounds per month to over 14 pounds per month! So an over 2.5 times increase in premium. I had no claims and the same items of equipment i.e. no changes at all. I informed them that I would not be renewing based on this. Within a couple of days, I had a further email now saying they could do it for just over 8 pounds per month. It's like dealing with a shady used car dealership. I don't want a negotiation- I want a rock-solid reliable provider. I declined their volatile offer and canceled the renewal direct debit due in a few weeks. I then received a further email saying that my account is immediately suspended even though I have a few weeks left. So they have declined to provide a full years cover purely because I don't agree to a massive price increase and a renewal for the next year. I will certainly not be using them again and thankfully never had to lodge a claim. Now, they will respond to this post by either saying: (a) they can't identify me (i.e. this is intended to convince you, new Customer, that this is a fake review- it's not) or (b) please call us to discuss (that is intended to show you, new customer, how customer focussed they are and is not intended to offer me anything different).I guess my rating and advice on this vendor is pretty clear.

Title: Fix completed quickly once the engineer arrived.
Review: This was a recall visit when our heating system stopped working shortly after a previous repair had been successfully completed. The recall was quickly accepted by the call centre, though I was a little disappointed that there would be a delay of 4 days before the engineer could come because it was reported on Friday and a weekend and New year's Day were upon us. On the Tuesday scheduled, the engineer rang first thing and arrived shortly after. The engineer checked the wiring and found a loose connection as the likely cause, tightened the connection and tested the system. The engineer was friendly and efficient and very helpful, which made the whole experience as pleasant as possible.

Title: Engineer visit
Review: I was phoned to put this review on and advised it was about my engineer visit. My Engineer was lovely very polite and very thorough on my boiler maintenance.  He noticed something that hadn't been done properly by last person and missed by previous maintenance from another company. Fantastic service from him! Regarding 24 /7 it takes a long time to get visit booked in and previous one got cancelled so waited another month but least worth it in the end and they did call before to try and sell me a product which I said no to.  Would also be good if you got a time slot nearer the time rather than having to be on standby for a full day.

Title: Good experience
Review: Good experience

Title: 247homerescue useless…
Review: I am disabled OAP and considered to be vulnerable so some things in life i need. Heating died, so Called 247 on Friday 29th due to no heating paid a 95.00 excess fee - engineer arrived 30th Dec 23 looked at system and said he had ordered new parts. not heard from again until pm 1st Jan 24 to say job is complete - NO ITS NOT STILL NO HEATING- 2nd engineer came out on 3rd Jan said he had ordered the parts, when he arrived I did have hot water but now NO LONGER HAVE HOT WATER - then on 4th Jan I am told I have to pay 108.00 for a drain down  for them to fit the parts,  so central heating is not really covered because if they need to fit parts they will charge you - day 7 tomorrow without heating and now no hot water - parts not ordered until i pay the £108.00 . They are supposed to supply 2 heaters if they cannot fix the heating they tell me I have to buy these and they will reimburse me  £30 - um no thanks decent heaters cost more than £30 each. the call system is a joke where the agents blame you for the delay in repairs. The complaints department if it exists seems to be unreachable. I feel like I am being SCAMMED by this company the contract is pretty much worthless.AVOID at all costs - the company name gives a feeling of immediate repairs  - pigs will fly firstUPDATE: they want me to pay the 108.00 and they will credit me 2 months premiums (about £26.00) as a gesture of good will.... its a joke shove the offer .... 7 days without heating and now 2 days with no hot water. Its costing me an extra 10 to 15 per day in additional cost for heating and hot water and they still wont resolve my heating. THE INSURANCE CONTRACT IS WORTHLESS.OMBUDSMAN, RIP OF BRITAIN AND COURTS  IN WAITING. OH AND THE CALL CENTRE IS IN KARACHI AND THEY HAVE NO UNDERSTANDING OF HEATING ISSUES ONLY WANTING WANTING PAYMENTS.UPDATE 5th Jan 24Took several calls to get the complaints department - don't believe it is the complaints department as the caller is in Karachi to call me. If I pay the scam money to get a drain down done they cannot say when it can be done 1 day, 2 days,  one week ??????.Have asked for a resolution letter but they are reluctant to provide this. day 8 tomorrow

Review: I switched 3 of my rented properties to this service from British Gas to save money.. big mistake!! I had so many problems with this company it was unbelievable!! The main problem being how this company establish when a boiler is beyond economical repair!!If your boiler is 6/7/8 year old don’t bother using this company as any call out will be beyond economical repair which is basically a con to try to sell you a much overpriced boiler! I ended up switching back to British Gas who repaired without any issues!Ref: WS580410After your reply this was the property Ref. above, but the same issues occurred at another property covered with you and that’s why I have cancelled all 3 contracts!

Title: If I could give less than 1 star I would. Terrible customer service!
Review: If I could give less than 1 star I would. I haven't had a single instance with these guys that was not a headache. The team on the phone is extremely unhelpful and not well trained on customer service. I have this insurance so I don't worry about home repairs but instead it's always a pain every time I call. They try to push back on claims! The latest one was an electrical issue in the circuit of the washing machine socket and they say they do not cover isolated circuits. Watch out as they pick and choose and push back like hell. All my experiences with them have been a headache. I have asked for my services to be cancelled and I paid an excess, that's how much I needed to get rid of these guys. Even though they were the ones that didn't fulfil the agreement. The good reviews here have to be fake because believe. me they are inflexible and I urge you not to get cheated like I was.

Please go home and take pictures and we will decide if we can deal with your emergency. Sitting room ceiling now has come down. Still leaking. Cancelled policy, rubbish service. Call centre handlers brilliant but have to stick with company policy. Policy number WS556366.

Title: Please DON’T take cover out with 24/7
Review: Please, please, please think very carefully before taking out a contract with this company. We have a Home Care policy which covers plumbing amongst other things and when I logged a claim regarding a leaking water pipe in the kitchen, I was initially told that an engineer would NOT be able to come out until the leak was clearly identifiable, visible and accessible. Forgive my confusion, but is this not part of a plumber’s remit?After taking advice from a plumber friend, my husband cleared the area around the pipe. The leak was now clearly visible and accessible.Great, we thought, 247 Home Rescue will now be able to help and I immediately logged the claim a second time. How wrong we were : (When the call handler phoned me I again explained the fault but I was told because I’d informed (wrongly - it’s not the main supply pipe at all. But hey, what do I know about plumbing?) him it was a main water supply pipe, this is not covered under the policy. I actually asked how can they provide plumbing services when they don’t do plumbing? Ludicrous?!?! I was then asked to email a photo over which I did straight away. It’s now 24 hours later and I’ve still not received any communication from them.Please be extremely cautious before you sign on the dotted line.Please also note that the majority of 5* reviews on here are for the low price of the cover or boiler services.

Review: Absolutely shocking service.  Called an Engineer out to look at flame out fault.  When examining the boiler I pointed out water leaking from the boiler which the engineer did not properly investigate.  Engineer left with water still leaking over our brand new kitchen.  Contacted customer service in relation to the leak not being addressed and denied they knew anything about a leak even when this was pointed out to the engineer.  Customer service spoke to the engineer who denied any knowledge of the leak.  Absolute liars.  When challenged they dismissed claim about the leak and basically called me a liar.  Customer is obviously not king with this shower of clowns.  Policy and renewal canceled with immediate effect.Update:After their token "investigation " not surprisingly they have dismissed my claim.  This underlines their engineers incompetence and their lack of customer service.  Asked to provide evidence of the water leak - why would I continue to let water leak over my brand new kitchen? And also not be believed by this bunch of clowns!!!

Title: '24/7 Home Rescue,' feels like a mockery
Review: I wish to express my total dissatisfaction with 24/7 Home Rescue following the incident yesterday. The company is an utter chaos. I lodged a claim for a boiler breakdown, expecting professionalism, only to be met with dubious practices. They assured us of an engineer's visit which never materialized, leading to a cold day in our home.I called them multiple times, and each instance was met with fabrications from their agents. They repeatedly stated that an engineer would arrive as late as 19:30 hrs yesterday, which is laughable. It's particularly distressing as we clearly communicated that we have children at home, and it's becoming a nightmare without hot water and heating.Calling them again today did no good as they still had no intel on their engineer's whereabouts. Their lack of responsibility in keeping customers apprised of the progress is alarming. Moreover, my request for a callback from a manager has been blatantly ignored thus far, and we're still left shivering in the cold.The company's name, '24/7 Home Rescue,' feels like a mockery given this undeserving experience. Their service is far from a rescue, and I find it necessary to caution others before they consider utilising their services.

Title: Very bad service from this company
Review: I experienced extremely poor service from this company. They conducted an inspection of my boiler, which was functioning perfectly. However, the engineer arbitrarily shut down the boiler and left. Consequently, my children and I have been enduring freezing temperatures without access to hot water and heating. Upon contacting the company, I was informed of an issue but was told to wait 24 hours for a team to check for necessary parts.After the stipulated time, I called again, only to be informed that they could obtain the required part for a fee of £90. However, an additional waiting period of 24 hours was necessary for the booking team to contact me and schedule an appointment. Despite paying for the repair, the technicians arrived days later and departed without resolving the issue. Subsequent calls revealed that another part was needed, and I was required to wait for authorization for the purchase of the new part. Upon calling after 24 hours, I was informed of a charge of £340 for the additional part. This seemed absurd, considering I had already paid £90.Expressing my dissatisfaction, I requested to cancel the service, but I was told that I needed to pay £99, even though I was within the cooling-off period. I argued that I had already paid £90 for their service, which was not provided free of charge. However, they insisted on the £99 payment. In light of this experience, I strongly advise against choosing this company, as they lack competence and seem more interested in promoting expensive new boilers or charging exorbitant amounts than providing genuine assistance. Additionally, navigating through different departments and enduring prolonged response times make the overall experience extremely unhelpful.

Title: If I could give zero stars I would
Review: If I could give zero stars I would! Totally not worth the experience, paid monthly membership and when I did a call out for boiler pressure keep dropping, paid a excess £93 and guess what they couldn’t fix the issue! So I still have the problem! was just given advice! Was told I NEED TO CHANGE THE VALVES, so they are unable to cover this!  When signing up to the company they will be extremely convincing and persuasive, however don’t care they just after monthly payments and excess and not give anything in return! Can’t fix problems like they say they can! Would not recommend and homeserve much cheaper! And definitely will be sharing my experiences with others! Oh and also I have a 93 year old living at the properly who they met and seen struggling because it’s so cold at the house! They do not care

Title: Quick and easy
Review: Quick, simple. Taking out a contract with 24/7 was really simple and quick. The person on the phone was super helpful and even provided some an additional small discount

Title: Change of mind!
Review: I changed from British Gas to 247 home rescue a couple of months ago.I was having problems with my boiler and had no hot water in the house. It has to be said that I was very excited when I first telephoned them because the call got answered in 30 seconds where with British Gas you generally have to wait 30 to 40 minutes.They telephoned me the following day and said that the first appointment they could give me was three days later… so much for 24/7 emergency! Also they gave me a time-slot between 8am and 6pm. At least British Gas give either a morning or afternoon slot.  I hope that I’m able to give you an update where I can give this service five stars.UPDATE!!They got back to me to tell me that somebody would come the following day and, allow me to be frank, the plumber, Ben, wasn’t just good, but he was absolutely fantastic. He had a lovely way with him rather than the British Gas engineers, who I am very sure must be picked for their lack of personality.I’m pleased to change my one star review into a five star review.

Title: The one thing I needed them for - they did not do.
Review: I made an appointment for boiler service months ago via a link on a text message. I did not receive any confirmation of the appointment and had to call to chase this up. I work full time and I had to book a day off work for this. Booking time off work in my line of work (healthcare) at this time of the year is difficult enough. On the afternoon of the day before the boiler service was due I received a call cancelling my appointment. The next available date offered to me was 2 months away. After speaking to a rather unhelpful customer service representative, I managed to bring this down to a month. Suffice to say that a routine boiler service is costing me two days off work in a time when my workplace is under such an enormous pressure. My boiler is working fine but I have noticed the dial on one of the controls being in the red. I was relying on this visit to get this back into the green. I have had a boiler broken before because I attempted to "fix" it and I am naturally apprehensive to endeavour to fix things myself.  Every time I had a boiler service in the past, it has not taken longer that 10 minutes, even on my old 15 years old boiler. I will most certainly not going to renew with them Frankly, if it was not going to cost me, I would have left mid contract. If this is the service I receive for a routine boiler service, I wonder what it will be like for a real issue.

Title: they are reliable.

Title: The boiler is finally mended
Review: The boiler is finally mended, after 5 visits and almost two weeks without heating or hot water.  Initial emergency visit and a misdiagnosis, before finally mending, and this is the reason for 3 stars.Shaun, the engineer for 4 visits, did all he could, kept me informed of progress, and let me know ahead of time when he would arrive. He couldn't have been more apologetic for the length of time the repair took, but it turned out to be an unusual fault, and difficulties sourcing parts. I would give Shaun himself 5 stars.

Review: Engineer was knowledgeable and kept me informed about how the boiler was performing. My only criticism is that we are given a very long frame for the visit (8am to 6pm) which ties you up for the whole day.

Title: Doesn’t stack up
Review: For me, 24/7 wasn’t worth the money. I had a policy for over 3 years and never claimed - when the time finally came, they weren’t able to get someone over quickly. Given I had no heating, and a small child at home, I called around to find someone locally. It cost me £150 to get a local plumber to come out on the same day, but given 24/7 Home Rescue costs £41 per month, you’re paying £492 per year. You need 3 breakdowns to make that stack up and you need to be confident that they can actually deliver quickly in an emergency situation (hence the name). They didn’t for me. Additionally, customer service is painful. I spent 28 minutes on the phone trying to cancel. They offered me a bunch of minor incentives to change my mind, like £40 credit, £30 towards a temporary electric heater and £5 off my monthly fee etc.They also told me I’d have to pay expensive fees if I cancelled - I had my terms to hand, so I could rebuff that easily, but for someone caught unprepared, they’d be forgiven for aborting the cancellation under the threat of fictitious fees. I guess you can’t fault them for trying.Just as I thought I had finally finished cancelling, I was transferred over to the team leader, who spent a good 10 minutes trying to explain to me that if I canceled 24/7 Home Rescue, I would have to pay somebody else money if ever my boiler broke, but with 24/7 Home Rescue, I wouldn’t… (except the £492 per year… right). She was also particularly forceful in telling me why I was wrong. Finally, about 5 mins after I reported my issue I got an unsolicited sales call, presumably from a different department - unbelievably they tried to sell me a new boiler. He started off by saying “I know you’ve had trouble with your boiler and we couldn’t get a someone over”… he asked my boiler age etc - I thought he was trying to resolve my issue and get someone over faster…. until he proceeded with his sales pitch - 🤦🏻Lordy Lordy

My impression is that I have chosen right people and right company to experience peaceful future.

Title: A pleasant surprise. Syed Ali.
Review: A well-informed chap,.Syed Ali, dealt with my telephone enquiry. From the get go, he was polite, attentive and courteous. He's product knowledge and customer awareness was impeccable. Nice to know that you have a direct customer service number to call. I cannot exude much higher an appreciation for the level of exemplary service I experienced. Well done to all at 24/7, especially Syed Ali.In a world that is so deeply entrenched in a mindset of bottom line stats and profits, that good service normally takes the back seat, it was a breath of fresh air to feel those good old values of being, well, valued as a customer and not just a stat. When people take a genuine interest in your needs as a customer and tailoring a package that is not superfluous and hiked, we customers are more willing to choose you and shake on business. And, after a lengthy call duration, due to the excellent service received, I indeed, did not hesitate to give 24/7 my business. Finally, a big well-done again to all at 24/7.!! I will review again to see if the service is endemic and not just a one off wonder.

Title: Rip off, upfront £95 excess
Review: I had a so called "free boiler check" as part of my package. Since then the boiler pressure has always fallen eventually registering zero and no matter how I tried to fill it, this never worked. I therefore had to ask for an engineer to come and rectify the problem. I then had to pay an upfront charge of £95 being the "excess". The engineer came and spent 10 mins messing with something - no spare parts needed etc and suddenly all is fine. I could probably have done whatever it was myself yet now am out of pocket by £95 which was probably more than if I'd asked a local heating expert to come out and sort for me! Not happy at all and feel that this "excess" on every single call out is far too high. Going to cancel this cover as it's really not worth it in my opinion.

He did a great job at diagnosing the issue and fixing it, all while being positive despite it being 6:30pm at night.I've had 247 Home Rescue for a few years now and can wholeheartedly recommend having it, it's saved me a lot of frustration and anxiety when I know my home issues can be fixed quickly and efficiently.

I did call them when it was getting close to midday and was advised that an engineer will definitely be there before 12pm. A fine example of a company overpromising and under delivering. Title: Rip off company
Review: Unfortunately the company picks and chooses what part it will replace which was not stated at the beginning of taking the insurance. The service was done stating no problem. Breakdown happens and I am to be charged for a part. How do you cover a boiler but not all of its parts? This is just a way of making customers pay extra. Be careful, even the parts when ordered through them takes weeks to arrive leaving you without heating or hot water. And ontop of it all, the premiums nearly doubled.PS: you just replied asking for my policy/ref no.  Do i send it here or want it over the phone? Not that I have any hope of anything getting done about it as your customer representative that we have been speaking to is not assisting but keeps repeating that the part isnt covered. As said, a boiler should be covered with all its components.

Title: Engineers was very helpful professional…
Review: Engineers was very helpful professional but the communication with 27/7 was poor needed a part didn't arrive with it so had to wait in again was told they'll do the service at same time when arrived couldn't do service wasn't on job sheet at to wait in again total of 5 days having to wait in because of communication

Title: Insurance ‘not worth the paper it’s written on!’

Title: Boiler repair

Title: These are indian call centre scammers
Review: These are indian call centre scammers, with suspect positive reviews, i just been scammed by them.You pay monthly then when you call they keep cancelling my appointment 3 times on fourth time they said no one was home, so i rebook and they want to charge me for cancelling. I am going to report to trading standards so many similar pattens of fraudulent business activities. They dont fulfil their part of the service, do some research on company on other review sites same common complaints. No different to email scams. Stick to locals

Title: Great first boiler visit by 247
Review: This was our first visit by 247 & it was all good. The engineer was excellent and even found and fixed a minor issue that BG had left in place for 5 visits (& BG installed the boiler). He added rust inhibitor too as I requested that.

Title: Proof is in the Pudding - AVOID
Review: Had been with 24/7 for many years, used them every year for boiler service. This was a pain each year as they subcontract all the work out so can't tell you when it will be or control it. This year's service was rearranged 3 times on me.This year was the first that I had to use them for a boiler breakdown, the experience was awful, they again subcontracted out the work, but the subcontractor didn't send the worksheet to them for ages, all 24/7 could tell me was "we will contact you within 24hrs" - nobody ever contacted me back, I had to call and each time was told "we need 24hrs" finally got to the end of my tether as the 24hr thing was a lie; Nobody in this company will ever contact you as promised.My family and I were without heating or hot water for 2 weeks due to the inefficiency of 24/7 and their subcontractors. I have then received my renewal quote - this time it's far more expensive than a new business quote. I advise them I don't want to renew due to cost and experience, and all I get is offers of reduced premium. I had to reiterate 3 times my clear intention to leave before the message got through.I will be more than happy to never deal with this company again. I cannot recommend these to anyone either, please go to a local company or a bigger company who control their own workers.

Title: Efficient service
Review: Guy was in and out fast.  Turned up on time and kept me informed.

Title: Very quick and easy to fill out forms…
Review: Very quick and easy to fill out forms helpfulCall handlers. Value for money.

Title: Excellent boiler service
Review: Very skill full, thourugh and professional engineer. He carried  very comprehensive service of my boiler

Title: Shocking!!
Review: Signed up a year ago for boiler cover, I asked them not to set it for auto renew as I was aware the price would increase. I received an email advising me that the policy has renewed for double the price! I spoke to them yesterday and was advised I received a renewal invite to say its on auto renew!! told them to cancel as it is fraud to take my money when I have clearly told them not to, they have now cancelled but will not refund a months premium, I am fuming and will definitely take this further.What a patronising reply !! just typical of a company such as yours.

Title: Quick and helpfull
Review: Quick and helpfull

Title: Engineer came to do service
Review: Engineer came to do service. Said didn’t feel too good when he arrived. Heard him running taps very fast. Then couldn’t get out of house fast enough. Wasn’t in long, so don’t even know if he did full service. Did quick wipe of sink, as had some muck on. A day later, realised, he had been sick in sink. I had missed some of mixer tap, when I cleaned. It smelt strong of sick. Too late for me, I picked up virus, he had. I was ill for 2 weeks. Lost 12lbs. If only he had told me he was sick, would have used a lot of bleach immediately. I was offered £20 as compensation, as had no evidence (really). Not impressed at all.

Title: Use this company with caution
Review: The engineer turned up to service our boiler, he declared it was “live” the casing, pipes and our bathroom taps. He then left leaving electricity and gas still on with a potentially very dangerous situation. 24/7 wouldn’t send an electrician out as they claimed this wasn’t covered under the policy which was only for breakdown and emergency, surely this situation with a “live” boiler and “live” gas was an emergency situation?Independent  electrician and heating engineer declared no issues and that the fuse would have tripped .I don’t know why we were told what we were, but we were left in a potentially dangerous situation and no paperwork to support the “live” claims.Please be cautious about using this company

Title: POOR SERVICE
Review: I have been with a contract paying £12.91 a month and an annual boiler service is included in this. Firstly I was booked for a service on 24th November 2023, and then the day before I had a text message saying “Appointment booked for tomorrow, engineer will contract you within the hour” and then on the SAME Day of that text message I have a voicemail and a text saying it has been cancelled by you, saying “unforeseen circumstances”. So I rang you up saying I need to rebook as you guys cancelled on me. So it was RESCHEDULED for 26th Jan 2024 (today of complaint) Yesterday (25th Jan 24)  I had the same text saying about the engineer coming tomorrow and YET AGAIN a few moments later you cancel on me for the second time! It is ridiculous, I rang you up yesterday and spoke to someone to tell me that you guys are not taking bookings at the moment. But my policy will end on the 31st January 2024.It is ridiculous how this company is. Poor service.

Title: Absolutely shocking service once again
Review: Absolutely shocking service once again! I should have learned first time around. They will not send anyone to view and assess anything. I have a leak in a wall, and I suggested it could be a leaky tap (within the wall) and they said I wasn't covered because they don't cover taps. I explained i wasn't a plumber and they still said i wasn't covered as it is a tap! I couldn't warn people off this company more. There is always an excuse to not come out. Avoid like the plague

Title: The engineer came promptly was polite…
Review: The engineer came promptly was polite and serviced the boiler promptly

Title: AVOID THIS COMPANY!!
Review: AVOID THIS COMPANY!!Had the boiler cover with my24/7 for 4 years and always booked the annual service which always amazed me that they could fully service in the time they was here! Booked for this year's service and engineer arrived not having a clue how to use the tado system which is one of the popular WiFi heating controllers so didn't have much confidence right from the off.  Within 5 minutes of him there the boiler had mysteriously packed up and wasn't working at all. Even tho the boiler had been working perfectly fine all year and was working as he managed to get a emissions reading from it. He then said he couldn't do no more and left! Leaving me with no heating with a family with children isn't very good at all.  Couple of days after I get a call saying that they will send out a service engineer only after I've paid £75! I begrudgingly paid up and waited a day for him to turn up. He turned up not happy that he had to work on Sunday and couldn't wait to get to the pub! Told me boiler was beyond economical repair and left again with no heating in the coldest spell we've had this year!! To say my house and kids was freezing is a understatement! Finally 9 days after it stopped working on a so called service and me having to chase them all the time they finally say they can't do anything and cancel my contract with them!! Now stuck with a dead boiler that I've now got to sort out.   Over the year they have bombarded me with phone calls trying to get me to upgrade my ageing boiler with the same response that if its working fine im leaving alone.  This company will only want to take all your money and help out the least they can !!! I would highly recommend using other company's for your heating system as these are a complete waste of money

Review: Engineer completed the job in a timely manner. Was also friendly. No complaints.

Review: boiler cover MS633997. I had boiler repair of gas valve and they refused to give claim saving they can only claim breakdown. Part is worth 60. They are asking 290. Rip offs. I'm raising complaint with FOS. Don't take any policy. They even charge you for service 😒

Title: Worst experience ever
Review: I moved from British Gas to 24/7 and this has been the worst experience ever. My living room spot lights started to drip water really badly and on my own not knowing what to do I was terrified. It took me ages to get through only to be told that if I could not identify where the leak was myself, my insurance would not cover this. All of the summary info and start of the policy did not mention this. Tucked away on page 10 under ‘trades and access’ there it was, they won’t find the problem? What- are you serious. Would never ever insure with this company again

Title: AVOID. They lied to me from the start.
Review: I was a brand new customer.  I was promised by the agent that once my 14 day cool-off period had lapsed I could book in for a boiler service (as I was now due one).  Once my period had lapsed I logged in to be informed that I could not have a service until August.Sorry - that is not what I was promised (check your telephone recording of our conversation).Called them.  Was told I could have on in 5 weeks but would need to pay an extra £30.Basically, I was lied to from the start.I have now cancelled and will go elsewhere.I cannot comment on their actually work, perhaps they are great, but for keeping to initial promises - AVOID.

He did not only repair the faults but also changed some parts and cleaned others, which I think will give my boiler and the heating system at least a couple years extra lease of life. Thank you!

Title: Good service and peace of mind
Review: Have been with 24/7 Home Rescue for a few years now. Excellent service - good to have the peace of mind that you're covered in the event of an issue. Just had the engineer out for the annual boiler service - he was very polite and friendly. Work was completed quickly and efficiently. The only downside is that it's not possible to book a service appointment - someone phones on the day when an engineer is in your area in case you can fit in a visit, which is a pain when you work full time. But overall happy with the service and would recommend.

Title: I strongly advice you to steer clear of…
Review: I strongly advice you to steer clear of this company.  I took out service for my combi boiler with them.  I paid monthly then when the boiler broke down on 14th January 2023 I had to pay a fee of £75 before they would agree to send an engineer.  I am 81 years old and was supposed to get priority treatment because of my age.  The engineer didn’t turn up for 2days.  This happened right at the beginning of that bitterly cold week we had mid January.  The engineer said the boiler needed a new fan and he would return later with that.  After 30 minutes I got a call from the company trying to sell me a new boiler. I quoted what the engineer had said about a new fan.  An hour later I got another call from them trying to sell me a boiler.  I stated quite categorically I didn’t want a new boiler because my current boiler only needed a new fan.  Later that day I got another call from said company stating the engineer would not be returning with a fan because the boiler didn’t warrant that expense (about £100).  They refused to refund my monthly payments or the £75 fee.  I got nothing at all for my money.  I subsequently purchased a new boiler - not from them of course.  I was without heat and water for a full week before the new boiler was installed.  Home Rescue couldn’t have cared less.  Do not under any circumstances give them your money.

Will not be using them again, imagine if as I am a woman by the side of the road needing assistance!.RA607873.

Title: 24/7 Home Care
Review: My call was answered quickly and professionally by Team member Mustaba. I found Mustaba to be extremely helpful ringing me back quickly after he needed to seek clarification on a query. This was good as I didn't have to wait on the phone like many other companies have you do. Mustaba answered all my queries in a timely manner and I was able to amend my contract and book in a service for my boiler on a date and time I required. Can't fault the company, would highly recommend 24/7 Home Care.

Title: Diabolical Service
Review: Complaint Reference: TF1087026Full Policy £26.99On the first November 2023 I called 24/7 as we had heavy rainfall and there was water leaking from the bottom of the boiler. An engineer came at 6pm in total darkness.  He was immediately rude stating this was his last job and he just wanted to get to the pub. I offered him tea or coffee and he was rude again stating he didn't drink that crap.  I offered him a torch as it was so dark but he didn't want one as he had his phone. I left him to it.  A few minutes later he came in and said he had cut a piece of pipe off and put it on my kitchen worktop.  He said the pipe was incorrectly installed and someone from the office would call me to sort out where we go from there.A couple of weeks later I saw that the drain the boiler pipe went into was overflowing.  I called the company and an engineer came and unblocked the drain. He stated that the pipe was blocked and that is why the water was coming out of the bottom of my boiler and if it hadn't of been dark the boiler engineer would have seen that.  I repeatedly called the company to find out what was being done about my pipework and was told three times that the job had been closed.  I was passed from one department to another and eventually in January 2024 I was told that nobody would be calling out as it was an "incorrect installation".I explained it was installed and maintained under the Worcester 7 year warranty and then has had the last two yearly maintenance certificates by a well known homecare company. So apparently there are 9 gas certified heating engineers that are not doing their jobs properly according to 24/7.  I asked to speak with a manager as I now have an independant quote for £140 bill to pay to repair the cut pipework, I spoke with four different people who appeared to just be reading from a script and not answering my direct questions  and they refused to pass me on to a manager.  I asked to terminate my contract and was told it was yet another department I needed to speak with.   Eventually I was told it would cost me £186 the chap then asked me to wait a moment and then came back saying I could terminate it for £135.  I said the £140 repair that I now had to pay because of their error  should be offset against the £135 to get me out of the contract.  He stated that this was not possible.  I asked once again to speak with a senior person.  I then received a telephone call offering me £30 compensation which obviously said I did not want as I no longer had any faith in the company.  I then received another telephone call the day after offering me £50 compensation, to which I declined.  I was then offered the £50 compensation as part of a reduction of the £186 contract exit fee.  I also received a letter offering the compensation with a detailed letter of my problem stating the dates November 2024 (REALLY).  The incompetencies within this company are outstanding.  Needless to say I have contacted the Worcester boiler company and am prepared to take this further.

Title: Engineer was professional and helpful
Review: Engineer was professional and helpful. Arrived on time and was prompt in servicing boiler. Given me advice on boiler maintenance for further potential issues   10/10 for service

Title: Property damage caused consecutively…
Review: Property damage caused consecutively twice by engineers one of the engineer tried to dispute he’d caused a flood and damage to property ended up with a very unsatisfactory experience with their claims team.Be aware they do not check for gas leaks with boiler service.There is a part of the boiler that requires replacing totally ignored by engineers, verified by 2 independent engineers and my last visit ended with an engineer causing a gas leak by untightening the unions cadent called out and cause identified by an independent.I also strongly advise 2 people are present as a vulnerable customer and a female alone, this has led to uncomfortable inappropriate behaviour from engineers, which was very disturbing and the company are dismissing the gas leak and unacceptable behaviours of their employees in the home of a vulnerable customer. An independent engineer has completed a riddor report about their concerns from what was found and cadent are in discussion about this as it’s the 2nd gas leak within 2 months since this company messed around with my boiler.They don’t do a tightness test so you’ll be unaware if you have a leak after the boiler is ‘serviced’ get a proper independent engineer who carries out all safety gas leak checks.

Title: FALSIFIED GAS LEAK TO SELL BOILER
Review: PLEASE  .... do not be bullied into getting a new boiler through them. I had an engineer come out for a service,  he claimed I had a gas leak and switched off my gas, I couldn't not have a boiler because if my 85 year old mom with me, I panicked,  they said they could fit one next day, made me pay in full only to discover they lied, there was nothing wrong with my gas or boiler and its still going strong!!! They charged me £250 to cancel it!!!!!!! Don't waste your money on insurance for your boiler,  rather get a gas engineer out to service it and if needed, repair... Will be a whole lot cheaper and sound!Reply: Your complaints team has already looked at it and deemed it ok... which is why I want everyone to know what you do!!!!

Title: Absolute cowboys
Review: Absolute cowboys. Engineer arrived to replace stopcock and fix boiler, I knew within 5 minutes he wasn't going to do either. Tried to blame stopcock for the reason the boiler wasn't working and said I wasn't covered for the stopcock so someone from the office would call. Complete fabrication as they tried to fix the stopcock before and obviously failed. Packed his tools up and left, big pool of water under the sink,  stopcock in bits and no working plumbing in the house whatsoever plus bits of the boiler on my worktop. What a bunch of jokers, cancelled cover and got proper Engineers put who fixed issue no problem. Avoid these losers.

Title: Terrible service from start to finish
Review: Terrible service from start to finish! Do not use!!Stared with a small leak… engineer was not interested in the leak and decided to say it was something else even though I had a video of the Leak that he didn’t want to see! Left the property to the small leak turning into a big leak and cause the boiler to stop working!! This then turned into having no hot water or heating in freezing cold conditions to them sending another engineer out who confirmed that the fault was due to the leak not being fixed the first time. He then made a phone call and was told to leave the property and not fix the problem because it was going to cost £250!! Customer service not interested leaving me without water or heating with a small child for days!! No options given just a straight no but they will sell me a new boiler sorry but I don’t think so!!! I got a second opinion and they also confirmed my boiler was now not working due to the leak not being fixed!!! 24/7 this is not the end!! You had no compassion, no apology and you just didn’t care or even try to help.  Basically they didn’t want to fix it because they wanted to sell a new boiler. AVOID THIS COMPANY IF ITS NOT A CHEAP FIX THEY WILL NOT DO IT!!

Title: Had a boiler breakdown leading to loss…
Review: Had a boiler breakdown leading to loss of hot water and heating. Called 247 homerescue as I had purchased their landlord boiler care package. Had to negotiate hard to get someone to visit the same day as they were giving next day appointment. The guy made matters worse by fixing the wrong thing and went back. Boiler was still not working and had to ask them to send back someone again. again 24 hour delay in sending someone and yet the issue isn't resolved. still waiting for a fix and my tenants are living without heat and hot water. the company said they would reimburse for portable heater but no sight of any reimbursement yet. terrible customer service and technical quality of people sent. Very unhappy with their service. Update as of 14th Feb, still having isssues with this company. they are now avoiding fixing my boiler and has picked up different clauses from the insurance document to deny any further claim. I will appeal now with ombudsman service.

Title: Broke our tap, offered to charge to fix it, and won't leave me alone after cancelling
Review: Outside tap wouldn't stop gushing water, so rang them for cover. Turned out that taps aren't covered by the policy, but we could pay for someone to come out, so we did.Plumber said that we needed a new outside tap so went away to get one. When he came to tighten it, he snapped the connection at the wall, so had to just cap the pipe and leave it. Their note says "Travelled to collect bib tap when fitting tap snapped at not even full tightness will need new tap and new wall plate, capped pipe to stop leak so water could go back on." Offered to repair the damage for £92.12, which I declined.Cancelled the account in November and now they keep texting and emailing me to say that I can come back. No way to stop the texts or the emails - only link in the email reactivated the account!

Title: Avoid ⛔️⛔️⛔️
Review: Avoid ⛔️⛔️⛔️it’s a cowboy company ⛔️ Purchased a full landlord boiler cover back in November, As I was with another company and they don’t offer a drainage cover with the policy anymore. So I chose this this company little that I know it’s the  worst out of all the other companies.  So I booked a gas safety check and a boiler service for the earliest appointment they could give me which was 10/1/24 which was cancelled  a day before. And was  reschedule for another day which was the 18/jan, I heard nothing from the company for about 10 days kept looking at their app and there’s no paperwork or cp12certificate or  a report from the engineer the only thing it shows job completed so I called the customer service and here where I I realised how bad is this company…. I was told the our engineer attended the job and he refused to carry out the work ⛔️⛔️…. (As he said that the gas meter is too close to the electric switch board) bear in mind this has been the case sines I bought the house (no one has touched the gas meter or moved it and so is the electric) and several  gas safety registered engineers including British Gas have been to service the boiler in the last 8-9 years never been an issue ….. so I asked for the failure report, which it should have been loaded to my account,  they refusing to give me any details for the engineer that attend the job not even his gas safety no . I have been in touch with gas safety themselves and I was advised that he shouldn’t have fail the check and should have flag it as advice. It’s been 3 weeks now since and the company failed to send paperwork. Been in touch with citizens advice and Trading standards to look in to this company and have been in touch with BBC so no one have to go through what I’m going through. So please avoid this company not sure if they use gas registered  engineers ⛔️⛔️⛔️. As I don’t see why they won’t give details.

Title: Be careful with this company
Review: Be very careful with this Company. I took out there top home care policy covering Boiler, plumbing and electrics. I had a problem which they discovered while doing my service, which was not an existing problem. They told me the  item which was a pressure valve and said it would be £450 to replace and told it was a maintenance problem. What’s the point of having there top of the range cover. When they do not replace the faulty part. They could apply this with any problem that occurs in the future. You have been warned

Title: The 5 stars are for the engineer
Review: The 5 stars are for the engineer - not for 247 Home Rescue. I had waited some time for a boiler service and when I rang 247 to ask if they could give me a time for the service call they gave me the service contractors number. I phoned the contractor and was told they had not been informed of the call and were unable to come on the arranged day, They gave me an appointment a couple of days later and the engineer arrived at the given time. He did a very good job and was very polite and respectful. So - the engineers are great but 247 not so much.

Title: Disgusting customer service
Review: Unfortunately we have had 3 issues in the house in the last month. On one of the issues it was dealt with quickly and effectively. However, with the next 2 issues they have given us nothing but difficulties.We have been loyal customers for 5 years and despite this have been told that as our dishwasher (that they are happy to insure) is broken and no longer available they will only give us a voucher that will not cover the entire cost of a new dishwasher.The people we speak to don't understand the policy enough to explain why and just say "that's what I've been told". Not good enough.To add to this the customer service with 24/7 (NOT the engineers who come out who are all lovely) is appalling. I've been put on hold then the call fail numerous times, having to call up multiple times a day as they cannot call me back when I've asked for it and a lot of the people not understanding what I am asking. (This has now been going on for 4 weeks).I would have hoped the company would have honoured their policy but they are trying to get out of giving us what we are owed.

Title: Avoid
Review: Increased from 1 to 3 stars following 'resolution'. I'd still suggest looking elsewhere if you want reliable customer service. We have a 'comprehensive' cover plan with them (appliances, plumbing etc etc) but in the event they cannot fix a fault, they'll eventually force you to accept a derisory Curry's voucher to put towards a replacement. But to make things even worse they won't process that voucher with any urgency, oh no, you have to wait 7-10 days and after repeatably chasing them you get fobbed off with the same stock answer that 'it's with the accounts team' who you cannot possibly speak to. So frustrating. Final Update: After spending a disproportionate amount of my time chasing with multiple calls etc over a 3 1/2 week period, I have finally been sent the £300 Curry's voucher for a £600 appliance. Whilst the time taken to resolve this is not acceptable, or the value you place on my appliance, at least you did send through the voucher so some credit to 247 for that. I tried to encourage a better response by tagging/messaging 24/7 the issue on social media, and their response is to block me. Pathetic.

Title: It's extremely stressful to deal with…
Review: It's extremely stressful to deal with this company. The first year they sent me a third party company's details for me to organise the appointment myself who not only never responded and was impossible to deal with but when eventually turned up run my hot water for over an hour as a part of the "servicing", and failed to carry out my boiler service eventually.  The 24/7 boiler service team who eventually had to come out to service my boiler was good, but unfortunately this year I am facing the same issues and it's impossible to get my boiler serviced because they are so incredibly understaffed. I had an appointment for January which was cancelled by them due to illness, then they couldn't provide me with an appointment for a long time saying they haven't got any slots in their calendar? Like for the whole year? I am speachless.I have asked many times to put me on a cancellation list, they called me 20 mins before arrival if I am home. I wasn't as I was at work, and this is frustrating. Not to mention that they have called me about 12 times to try to sell some cleaning solution - when the engineer never even reached my premises. This is my second year with this company definitely looking for a new company boiler insurance for next year.

Title: Check your cover
Review: They're called 247 Home Rescue but we logged a problem that had left us without heating or hot water on Friday night and didn't get a visit until late Monday. They were quick to collect our £95 excess/callout charge, but since the problem turned out to be a leaking hot water tank, we weren't covered and the £95 got us precisely nothing. We're looking at a bill of more than £1,000 for a repair which would have been covered if we hadn't tried to save money by switching away from British Gas's expensive but comprehensive policy a few months ago!I might add that 247's offshored call centre is infuriating, repeatedly asking you the same security questions, even when they're ringing you. They were much keener on taking our callout payment and repeatedly asking about parking than on helping.

Title: I can sell you a new boiler !!!!@24/7 recently purchased a boiler cover…
Review: I recently purchased a boiler cover from 24/7 and all information given was clear and I was happy to go ahead with my policy.  Unfortunately sometimes later I had an issue with my boiler which led to lack of heating and warm water. I contacted these guys and explained my difficult situation and promised to get me an engineer as soon as possible. Oh my God these people are clooks  they simply charged me the access fee and left with no heating and no warm water. Eventually this so called engineer walked in and no proper diagnostic carried out, opened my boiler and five minutes left and said that a message was forwarded to 24/7 . He said that he will come back once authorised to order the part.No contact from them there after and I made a complaint about their lack of customer service and inappropriate behaviour towards clients. I was then surprised to speak to this guy who explained that my boiler had been declared BER( Beyond economic repair) therefore it was my responsibility to pay for a full repair or replace with a new one.He then offered to sell me a new one with the price which I have never heard about ithe cost of a boiler and offered to use a finance to pay over time.I simply cancelled the policy and left them with my access cost and all monthly payments made before Please if any one is looking for a boiler cover never consider 24/7 . It is a joke company created with aim of ripping money from people. Please stay away from them .

Title: As a customer of 247 homerescue Gas…
Review: As a customer of 247 homerescue Gas Company, I've unfortunately encountered numerous issues that have left me deeply dissatisfied with their services. It's important to note that their offices and call center are located in Pakistan, which often leads to significant communication barriers and frustrating experiences.First and foremost, the technical support provided by 247 Gas Company is severely lacking. The representatives seem to have minimal understanding of technical issues, leading to prolonged wait times on the phone and an infuriating game of passing customers from one department to another. It's incredibly frustrating to deal with individuals who cannot provide meaningful assistance or resolve issues in a timely manner.Furthermore, the gas engineers employed by 247 Gas Company appear to be inexperienced and, in some cases, dishonest. Instead of providing genuine solutions, they often attempt to find faults that can be used as leverage to pressure landlords into expensive repairs. This unethical behavior not only damages trust but also creates unnecessary financial burdens for customers.The complaints department is equally disappointing, displaying a complete lack of understanding regarding the concept of "the customer is always right." Instead of addressing valid concerns, they seem more inclined to dismiss them, leaving tenants in the cold without proper resolution or compensation.Additionally, despite being marketed as a budget-friendly option, 247 Gas Company's premiums have increased substantially without any justifiable reason. In fact, their prices have surpassed even those of larger, more reputable companies like British Gas. This price hike, coupled with their abysmal service quality, makes them a poor choice for anyone seeking reliable gas services.In conclusion, I strongly advise avoiding 247 Gas Company at all costs. While they may offer cheaper rates initially, the subpar customer service, lack of technical expertise, and questionable business practices make them a truly regrettable choice. Save yourself the headache and invest in a more reputable gas provider that values its customers and delivers on its promises.

Title: Boiler service and now not working!
Review: Booked an annual boiler service only for the central heating system not to work after the engineer had left!  He came back later the same day and said we should have a power flush which would cost £599.  There was absolutely nothing wrong with the boiler (or radiators) prior to him undertaking a service so I find it very hard to understand why a power flush is needed  (and he could not guarantee it would solve the problem).  Surely it was something he did to the boiler that made it suddenly not work.  He was constantly on the phone asking more senior engineers what he should do.  Requested second opinion and engineer booked to attend tomorrow.  Got a call weeks before the service pushing for us to have this power flush and then got two further calls on the day of the service recommending this power flush. I wish I had never booked the annual service as there was nothing wrong with the central heating system! Hopefully the new engineer will be able to sort this out.Update: New engineer found that some valves under the sink area had not been turned back on - so problem solved thanks goodness and power flush not required.The response from the admin team was very good when he came to rebooking an engineer so from a communication and customer service point of view, 24/7 has been excellent.  Just wish they would keep pushing to sell you a power flush even though it is not necessary.

Title: Very thorough and efficient
Review: Very thorough and efficient. Every problem was dealt with and explained

Title: Expert engineer, boiler fixed in one visit!
Review: I logged my broken boiler online on Sunday 11th February, I then followed up with a phone call to 24/7 Home rescue on Monday 12th February to find out when I could be booked in.  Engineer visit was booked for Tuesday 13th February. On the morning of 13th February, I received a call 30 minutes prior to the engineer arriving. He arrived on time, was respectful of my white carpets by putting on shoe covers and then did a thorough job of finding the fault with the boiler, and fixing it all in one visit as he had the parts in his van.  I was only without heating and hot water for two days so I am really impressed with how quickly I was booked in and how knowledgeable and efficient the engineer was in fixing my boiler. Would recommend 24/7 Home Rescue, this is my second year signed up with them and the first time I have had to call them out so I am happy with the service and that everything went smoothly.

Title: Boiler wasn't Working
Review: Boiler wasn't working, called to have someone come. Took 2 days while my kids slept cold. Got refunded one month as compensation but empathy just eager to close the complaint. Sent engineer and said boiler is beyond economical repair. Pushed to go for a new boiler or a repair on my own expense which is bizarre because that's why iv got the insurance (total scam) had an independent company come check it out and they got the part and fitted within 15-20 mins and all done the same day calling them. Part is less than £100 online and I got told there cost would be £350 plus! For a 15 min fitting job? Absaloutly livid! Have asked to speak with cancellation. This is my second negative experience! It's not worth it they have lots of exclusions which ends up costing silly amounts! Avoid at all Costs. It was a simple job and fear mongering and extorting extortionate prices was just terrible! Read reviews on other sites and you will see the same thing over and over again! I gave the company benefit of the doubt but totally reckless and expensive! I hope my experience isn't replicated with other customers.NB reply : they have forceably cancelled my contract now. Despite giving me 2 options to go with due to boiler not working. I had a full cover not just boiler and they have emailed me that the contract is cancelled with "immediate effect" iv asked for T and Cs where there allowed to cancel it without any discussion despite having a full home cover (not just boiler). DO NOT GO WITH THIS COMPANY, READ OTHER RECENT REVIEWS THEY ARE THE SAME.

Title: Back Boiler Serviced Efficiently
Review: After a number of companies refusing to service our Back Boiler, this was no issue at all for 247 Homerescue.  Liam arrived and efficiently checked and serviced our Baxi.  All done within the hour, polite and friendly.

Title: Better off working with local tradesmen quicker response and more cost effective- will not be renewing!
Review: 10 days so far and no heating at a cost of £400 - not impressed!! And registered with 247 as a vulnerable person (age).I experienced a problem which caused the sockets fuse on the fusebox to trip, and not reset. I called 247 for help on morning of Friday 9 February and described the symptoms. 247 offered to send out an electrician to have a look at the problem for £95 call out fee. Before the engineer arrived on the Saturday I had worked out by elimination that the problem was in a circuit related to the heating system and so had turned off the related isolating switch, and the rest of the electrics worked again.When the electrician appeared, he said he could not find any faults and that I would need a heating engineer, and left. 10 minutes after he left, I could smell electrical burning around the area where the plumbing electrics were. So I isolated the heating circuit again and called 247 (on the Saturday after I semelled the burning) with more details of the problem, and that a heating engineer was needed, as well as an electrician who would review the problem properly...247 said they needed to collect a £95 call out fee before they would send a plumber, during the next week sometime. I paid again, and explained that I was still without heating... so a plumber and an electrician were booked to attend my property on the following Tuesday.The electrician arrived on Tuesday and identified the problem as a faulty Honeywell 2 port valve for the heating. This valve had been replaced by 247 less than 6 months ago. The heating engineer arrived within an hour later and agreed that the 2 port valve was faulty, and that he would need to report this back to 247 for them to decide what to do.I called 247 on Wednesday and Thursday (yesterday) to ask what was happening with getting the problem resolved and get my heating back on...and was told that they were waiting for engineers reports, and waiting for quotes for repairs.Got a call from 247 today saying that I would need to pay £200+ to get the system drained down to complete the repairs - and I have had to pay upfront before they try to source and engineer .... so 8 days without heat later, I am waiting on an appointment to get repairs completed ... so sometime next week....Spectactularly unimpressed... will not be renewing with 247!From 247..."...24-Hour AvailabilityOur claims helpline is always open. If you need us, just call us anytime.  "".... Unlimited Call OutsUnlike some providers, We let you make new claims on our policies as many times as you need because we are always happy to help you."

Title: Not very good for landlords
Review: Not very good for landlordsThey seem to hire very junior/amateur staff for boiler/gas safety checks. My gas cooker lid's safety feature stopped working, and so their gas man cut and capped the physical gas connection from behind, to an unreasonably low height. Any reasonable person would have simply disconnected the cooker and made it safe. Instead, their amateur work resulted in an extra £150 for me to get the cooker connection re-piped.When I cancelled this year, they also still took an annual payment out of my account despite having notice of cancellation for over 2 weeks. Will avoid going forwards.

I asked him for the name of the part and he gave me the wrong part name... he looked it up and told me to screen shot the part details. It was wrong... now have to return part at a cost of approximately £40 to me.... utterly useless and no support. It was a case of 'tough luck'.... ironically, I didn't even get my annual service!!

Title: Boiler broken immediately after service
Review: The engineer arrived at the house just prior to 12:15pm to service the boiler and was ‘finished’ around 12:45pm. We initially received no service record, or confirmation of the tasks carried out. We had asked for a system inhibitor to be installed, but again no record of if that task was carried out?Furthermore to this, and the main issue, since the engineer left the house was the boiler not in working condition. Thus, we were left with no heating or hot water, in the midst of winter and a 1 year old in the house also. The engineer was effectively just in a rush to leave the property and did not ensure the boiler was in a working order, which is absolutely scandalous. The boiler was in a working order beforehand and he had just ‘passed’ the service.They did sent another engineer out around 36 hours later and he said it was a loose connector and rectified the issue, however the same issue has returned 2 months later. This isn’t the type of experience you’d expect on the back of a service. Based on the initial service by 247 Home Rescue I have had with yourselves, I certainly will not be recommending yourselves to any family, friends or colleagues.

Title: Highly recommend 24/7 to anyone
Review: We have just had excellent service from 247.I was emailed a couple of weeks ago regarding booking our boiler service. I rang and gave them some dates. They told me that they unfortunately couldn't make any of these dates. I was a little disappointed at this point. However, they rang me Saturday morning telling me that an engineer was in the area and that he would be with us within a half hour. The engineer arrived promptly (ring ahead to let me know he was on his way). He was excellent. Very knowledgeable and thorough with his inspection, talking through what he was doing and why whilst also explaining that things would soon be changing with boilers etc.. Overall I've been very impressed with the service I received throughout, from the original contact to the follow up calls I've had recently. I would highly recommend 24/7 to anyone.

I sent pictures to confirm that the task was done , only for one of the Managers to call me to say that was a misinformation and that the regulations had changed between December 23  and Feb 24!!!!!!!!!! In other words , the information given by the first engineer was considered not necessary by the second engineer!!!!!!!!!!!!To break the Camel's back, I had to pay cancelation fee of £99 to get out of the contract and keep my sanity!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Review: New boiler installed by 247 with ease, clear information and a quick turnaround. After my old boiler had broken down, I had called 247 to report the fault.  The engineer was sent to my property that very same day but was unfortunately unable to fix my boiler. A call soon followed by Liam who was an ever so polite and helpful in his ways. He had gone through the different options with me and it was agreed to replace the boiler. Finance options were provided but in the end we paid in full for the boiler.2 days later, the engineer John arrived at my property on time, neat and tidy and had the new boiler up and running on no time.Overall an excellent and reassuring service by 247. Title: My previous 1 star review seems to have…
Review: My previous 1 star review seems to have 'disappeared' - nearly 2 weeks without heating. Am about to get 4th visit... which might repair the problem (failed component installed by 247 in October, £400 upfront costs so far...).Since my review last week. I have had a call from complaints team... suggesting that I buy 2 fan heaters and they would reimburse up to £30! ..... I might need to replace my TWO YEAR OLD Worcester Bosch boiler!!!Absolutely useless suggestions when all I wanted was the problem diagnosed and fixed promptly! The sequence..circuit in fusebox tripped..1st electrician didn't find any faults on 10 minute visit ...  2nd electrician found the problem was faulty 2 port valve controlling heating (not a plumber..), plumber arrived and confirmed issue but did not have parts/approval from 247.... that was a week later...now nearly 2 weeks with no heating later ... the repair MIGHT get completed .... and it would have been quicker and cheaper to get a local plumber directly...

Title: Be very careful with this company
Review: Be very careful with this company. My boiler had a leak, they sent someone out and charged me £75 call out. The engineer said there was nothing he could do as Head Office said it was beyond economical repair and left with no action. Then a few days later, Head Office rang back and said they could fix it, £250 parts and £60 labour. So it could have been fixed on the day, they just wanted to charge me again for the labour. Complained and they said this was standard practice. Offered to return my last (and final) subscription payment of £16 as compensation

Title: Boiler Repair

Title: Proceed with caution
Review: I don't normally leave reviews, but I feel compelled to share my recent appalling experience with 24/7 home rescue. After a routine boiler service, they flagged my boiler as "at risk," insisting that I needed an immediate replacement of the heat exchanger due to a broken part. This claim was particularly suspicious, considering they had been servicing my boiler for the past three years without any prior issues.They quoted a staggering £900 for the replacement, despite admitting that the fault would have occurred during their own service. Outraged, I contested their assessment, demanding further investigation. Eventually, after many telephone calls, they begrudgingly sent out the boiler manufacturer for a second opinion, only to discover that the supposedly defective part was perfectly fine.This ordeal exposed not only their incompetence but also their blatant disregard for customer satisfaction. I shudder to think about the vulnerable individuals, like the elderly or those unable to advocate for themselves. They would have needlessly forked out a substantial sum for a repair that wasn't even necessary.The lack of accountability and empathy exhibited by 24/7 boiler service is utterly unacceptable. I implore anyone considering their services to proceed with extreme caution. Trusting them with your boiler maintenance could lead to unnecessary expenses and undue stress. Avoid them at all costs, and spare yourself the headache of dealing with their shocking customer service.Complaint Reference Number: HR1088800
