Title: I am seeking guidance as I am…
Review: I am seeking guidance as I am experiencing high levels of stress and frustration. I’m not the person who complains but this is getting serious now.In August I have taken landlord home rescue insurance. I have  adviced that as A&e nurse, I may not always be available to promptly respond to phone calls for claims and approvals for my tenant. After the reassurance that  my tenant has been authorised, I have opted for the premium insurance coverage to ensure peace of mind and a smooth process.On January 29th , I had a boiler service. The gas engeneer informed me that he would be turning off the boiler and marking it as risky due to a flu that was not completely sealed on both sides , (there is a gap between the wall and the flue). He explained that this could potentially lead to a CO2 leak back into the property, causing issues. I asked the technician on site if he could repair the necessary work ( that he can issue me an invoice and I will pay for problem to be fixed) and he mentioned that he was not authorized to do so. He advised me to contact the call center, and they would send another engineer to address the issue.On January 30th, I contacted the 24/7 call center and was informed that even this is emergency, my emergency coverage does not cover this work and that a third-party engineer would need to be found, which could take up to two days. After calling again after 2 days I was being told they were still searching for an engineer, I became concerned about enduring three days without hot water and electricity in the cold weather. Consequently, I decided to seek out a private engineer for assistance hoping to fix problem quicker. The call center had no objection and advised me that once the work is completed, I should contact them again so that a qualified engineer can return to the property to service the boiler.Regrettably, I had to travel overseas and my phone's roaming  was not functioning. My tenant have been attempting to communicate with 24/7 , but he was saying that I must speak to them in order to obtain authorization. Consequently, I have sent four emails urgently requesting an emergency visit, as the property still lacks hot water and heating.On February 15th, upon my arrival, I placed a phone call which was subsequently transferred to three different departments. I was given assurance that within 24 hours, an engineer would contact me regarding the appointment details. No one contacted me.On February 16th, 34 hours later, I called again and obtained the job ID. Once more, I was assured that someone would reach out to me within 24 hours. Unfortunately, I wasn’t contacted.On February 17th I contacted the 24/7  and I was informed me  he needs to place it as a new request since there was no record of a previous one.!Additionally, after one week of my written request for portable heaters as outline in my premium policy, he advised me to purchase the heater myself and submit the receipt.Furthermore, I had made a request to be contacted regarding a complaint by either complaint  team or the supervisor.On Monday, February 19th 12:56, I missed a phone call. I called back after just two minutes, and followed the given voicemail instructions. This led me back to the call center and I was given a new date for engeneer appointment on the 22nd. Once again, I was informed that a new request had to be made for a callback.Consequently, on Wednesday, February 21st, I received a phone call, but due to work commitments, I was unable to answer.Therefore, on Thursday the 22nd, I called again and requested a new callback. On the 23rd, in the evening my tenant confirms that engeneer attended, and that he had to cut off the gas pipe to the boiler.So I call 24/7  trying to find out what happened  but I was informed that it was outside of working hours and there was nothing that could be done. I was advised to wait for the report to be reviewed and for a callback.I am growing increasingly desperate and unsure of what steps to take regarding my tenant's living conditions. It is concerning to see them relying on portable heaters and a kettle for their basic needs.I was unable to get my enquiries sorted via 24/7 mobile app as chat bot is automatic and I wasn’t offer to chat with live advisor ; neither I was able to log in new claim request.I acknowledge that I missed two phone calls and I appreciate text messages expressing apologies for the negative experience resulting from the phone calls feedback. Regrettably, this does not resolve the issue with the heating and hot water.Is there any regulatory bodies that could provide guidance in this matter?Thanking you in advance for any guidance

Title: Avoid this scam company
Review: Avoid this scam company! Go to other review sites and see the truth about them. I did a service and repair completed last year by this company. I could explain all issues that occurred last time but its pointless. Just be be aware of terms and conditions. This company gets you by delaying its service requirements till a few months into your policy. Then when an engineer is sent to service your boiler, it will not be completed because an issue will highlighted which will abort the service. Now you need to pay for the repair which will not be covered by the policy and worse if you cancel the policy you have to pay a big fee. So according to their terms a call out was made and thus you are liable to their huge cancellation fee. In effect your monthly fees paid so far and cancellation fee or repair cost depending upon your choice will be more than your annual policy cost. So its no loss to them either way. But for you there is no service certificate completed and you need to pay for any repairs before your policy is valid. My boiler is perfectly fine and i would rather cancel my policy than to continue with a company i cannot trust anymore. Will return to my previous company who were only a little more in monthly premiums but so much more professional.

Title: Avoid this company
Review: My partner took out boiler and central heating cover with this company. An actuator valve broke recently and needed replaced. The repair man came to take a look and said the part needed replaced. A couple of days later the call centre phoned to say the part was included in our cover but the system needed a full drain to install the part and that wasn't covered and would cost £180.We asked if the repair man could call us back to discuss this and the call centre told us to expect a call in a couple of days and we never heard anything from them.Thankfully I had a friend to ask for a second opinion and he said the system did not need draining at all and I ordered the part and he installed it in ten minutes. This company are clearly trying to charge for things not covered in their plans to make extra money from their customers. Promptly cancelled our cover and will be sticking to local tradesmen from now on.

Title: It’s incredible how bad the service is…
Review: It’s incredible how bad the service is becoming with 24/7… I am unfortunately forced to stay with 24/7 due to the 10 years contract with 24/7 when I took out the new policy and bought the new Navien boiler with 24/7 in 2019. At the beginning of this winter 2023 my central heating wasn’t coming on and it took me 2 weeks of battle with 24/7 operators to send an engineer in . when the engineer from the Navien boiler did come though his work was spot on and he fixed the problem and we have the heating working really well. However the Navien boiler engineer requested 24/7 for the annual service to be done and again after much struggle I got an appointment a month later in December for it to be cancelled 2 days before the appointment as 24/7 was short staffed. Service still not done February 2024.And now since last Wednesday I am struggling with no hot water from the boiler … I called 24/7 they asked me to call Navien boiler I called Navien boiler they say they won’t come until 24/7 shows them that the service is done.. between the companies internal departments I am still struggling as a customer to get my boiler fixed by 24/7 for hot water.  Appalling level of Customer service. I had to try out a diy of switching the boiler off for 2 days use my parents hot water facilities instead . I switched the boiler back on yesterday Sunday and just about getting lukewarm water to do the washing ups etc… today Monday , still struggling for hot water and still in numerous calls with 24/7 to get this sorted. It is indeed my bad experience . Hence sharing with others on trustpilot in hope that no other customers are experiencing such bad service and I hope new customers are treated better.

Title: Taking money even though not a customer
Review: Had the most infuriating call with a guy that was not understanding anything I was trying to say, but kept telling me I’m a customer. I had a contract with 24|7 home rescue probably 5 years ago maybe more, but I didn’t renew the contract and I joined British Gas instead. Now since 2018 to 2023 I have not paid a penny to this company, obviously because I am not a customer. However, a month or so ago I get a call from an engineer to say he is outside my house for my boiler service (very dodgy). I told my parents not to answer the door because we haven’t booked anything so my parents literally locked themselves in the house all day. They take a payment out of £39 in January (why do they still have my account details on their system is very dodgy as well). I went to the bank and cancelled the payment and told them it’s fraudulent activity. I received a message this morning saying they have reinstated my direct debit. I called them company, the guy asked me for my policy number ( i don’t have because i’m not a customer). I kept telling him I can provide him proof that no money has been taken out my account, he kept telling me i have been paying. He also said the engineer entered my property for a service, i told him i have camera’s around my house i can provide proof that no engineer entered my house. He kept telling me my contract has been renewed and I have been a customer since 2018. What clearly has seemed to have happened is whoever took my call however many years ago cancelled my payments but didn’t register on their system that i was not a customer anymore. But now reinstated a direct debit payment in January 2024. I asked the guy a simple question ‘if my contract was renewed in October 2023 should I have not be paying every month’ and he said yes. I said to him if he can give me a email address i can provide him with proof of nothing being paid to their account. I had to hang up the phone on him because the solution he gave me was a lower premium price of £22 a month. I have reported this to my bank and would be expecting my refund for January’s payment.

Title: WS564646  i claimed yesterday afternoon
Review: I claimed yesterday afternoon. The electrician should've turned up between 8am-6pm I'm still waiting! I am considered a vulnerable customer. I called customer service then to let them know.  I agreed to take the survey after the phone call. The question that was asked between 1 to 5 how good was our service. (5 being the highest). My 1 score wouldn't register. I believe they don't record the customer's rating if they give them a lower review. I tried several times.  When I gave a higher score it was recorded. That's one way of getting good reviews!PS Didn't turn up! Now it's the 1st March.Engineer came no sockets with him. So couldn't do the job. Luckily I had 1 socket but we needed 2 sockets so he said he'll comeback next week. I'm not at all happy!

Title: Came to my mother's broken boiler
Review: Came to my mother's broken boiler. Told to replace it, not worth repairing. Left her a fan heater. 81 yrs old. Been paying £16 per month for yrs never made claim, which didn't cover the diagnosis. Charged £75. Disgraceful. Update 5/3/2024. Having had the chance to review my mother's experience 247 HR have proven they are a profits before people company. They have taken £16 per month for 6 years (£1032) without a claim being made then had the cheek to charge £75 for a 1 hr call out, where no repairs were made and my mother left in a freezing house. The least I would expect is the offer to return the call out fee. Sadly due to the response from 247HR we're left no choice but take legal advice to pursue the matter.

Title: I was with this company for 5 years
Review: I was with this company for 5 years. They were good but are no longer competitive with rivals and tend to change term and condition without informing. I asked them not to renew my policies and found out they were still charging me for plumbing. Beware of their plumbing cover. Other companies charge less and cover everything but they only cover a leak they can physically see. In the UK all pipes are concealed so this not a genuine plumbing cover, they don’t even cover the unconcealed stuff like cisterns and taps or even the drainage or pipe work behind the plasterboard. They should call it the toilet blockage cover. I asked them for a refund but found out they renewed the contract when I asked them not to and this has been going on for sometime. Find cover elsewhere this company is not honest on what they cover and what they don’t. I was told they covered everything except for taps.

Title: I’ve been paying this company £34.99 247 home rescue
Review: I’ve been paying this company £34.99 since Nov 23 tried to put in a claim each time I get told I’m not covered. The policy covers boiler service, I pay for full cover boiler , drainage, electric. I use there app drop down box. Pipe behind sink leaking with easy access. Not covered, I ask to cancel with 14 days notice & they want £135. When I’ve called them out they don’t turn up & use the excuse I didn’t answer my phone. When I question that they told me the engineer had emergency?if I wasn’t home I would of been fined £30, I’ve waited in 2 times & been told I didn’t answer my phone? As all the other reviews says good job on boiler service that is all there good for & what you pay your money missleading £34.99 a month?

Title: I cancelled the policy as it was no…
Review: This company is shocking, I had an issue with a couple of clips being missing which I was unaware of till my service was done by them. I was assured by the engineer that I would receive a call when they were ordered and for him to come back to fix the boiler. Lo and behold I had waited 6 weeks and heard absolutely nothing. As it was coming up to the the renewal anyway it had made my mind up that I wasn’t going to renew with them. So I cancelled the policy as it was no longer needed and informed the company by calling them, with the renewal price being expensive also. 4 weeks before the renewal took place, I found better anyway, 5 months down the line this company is still constantly pestering and bombarding me with texts and emails to get me to renew. This is after being told I would no longer receive any correspondence from them. Terrible company.From now on until the pestering and bombarding of texts and emails stops I will keep giving a review on here every single time.

Title: Our engineer was very good

Title: An update on my previous post:
Review: An update on my previous post:I called to say that our heating was making a noise only to be told that they do not come out unless the system is not working.A week or so later the heating did not work and boiler was showing a fault code, so I called again.  The guy told me to turn off at the mains and this seemed to work but said someone would come out.  The system working and making the noise was intermittent and when the engineer came out it was working fine.  I told him the fault was intermittent and told him the fault codes that showed on the boiler.  He hardly looked at the boiler and the pump, said that as it’s working then he couldn’t do anything. This cost me £75 excess.However after he went it stopped again so I called out an independent engineer.  Straight away he diagnosed the fault (even though system was working again when he arrived).  He took off the pump and cleaned it out and the system is now working properly and no noise.Basically it’s cost me £75 excess for nothing.I put a note of complaint on your site and you also said on your reply here that you would get back to me.  I still haven’t heard anything.  Not impressed.Latest 18/3/2024As above I’m still waiting for the reply from your complaints department and a reply to the note I put on your web site More latest 2/4/2024You stated in your reply that you would refer to your complaints team and get back to me.  I’m still waiting.  I also put comments on your web site that you have ignored.I would avoid this company.

Title: Do not use
Review: Do not use. This company prefers to have new customers and gives better deals. I have had unpleasant experiences in the last few years. Difficult to get boiler service. When I called 2 months earlier before the boiler service was due, the staff said I had to call in the month before the due date. When I called 1 month before the due date, I could not get the service as they said they were very busy. And the slot they give is an open slot like the whole day, which means you have to stand by the whole day.  When I wanted to cancel my policy, they tried to convince me to stay and offer a break, but then I decided to cancel, I still had to pay another month to cancel. I accepted it but when the time they did direct debit, I was double charged. They promised to do a refund but did not. Be careful when its time to cancel your policy. They are cheater.

Title: Avoid this company at all cost.
Review: Avoid this company at all cost.absolute bunch on con merchant cowboys.My girlfriend has had them out twice recently at the cost of £95 each time.The issue isn't resolved, and they just say you have to book another appointment.You book another appointment and then you are slapped with another £95 bill.So not only do they not repair work, they charge you for going to try and fix it again. The problem still hasn't been fixed, and asked for £95 a third time. So today she's tried to cancel, and they now say, it's £40 to leave.The company is an absolute joke.They had her sit in all day for an engineer who didn't show up either.And didn't even apologise about the situation. When I get the time I will be going to Trading Standards and The FCA.You complain to them on the phone, and they do nothing about it. Just after money, and wasting your time. You would be a fool to use this crooked company.

Title: Let down twice so far!
Review: I reluctantly renewed my insurance last year after an attempted large price hike which 24/7 reversed. In October 2023 I received an email saying my boiler needed its annual service, I contacted them to book this only to be told 18th December 2023 was earliest date available, on 18th December they contacted me to say no one was available to carry out the boiler serviceand I would need to rebook. I was then told 5th March 2024 was the next available date, this was over 5 months since being told I needed a boiler service! On 4th March my appointment was confirmed by text, on 5th March we waited in all day but no one came to carry out the service, no one from 24/7 contacted us either.On 6th March I called 24/7 and after 3 calls being disconnected finally managed to talk with someone, we now have a 3rd appointment for 11th March, will wait and see!!

Title: Problem with 24/7 cover
Review: We have a fault on our Vaillant boiler that says there is a pressure problem (F.75). It will run for an unpredictable amount of time and then raise the fault again.  A reset will start it again. The boiler is pressurised in the correct range (1.7 bar) so I know that can be excluded, which leaves the pressure sensor or a boiler pump fault. Because the problem is not “persistent”, in other words, not technically fully broken down, it is not covered by the policy. I was told that if an engineer was to be sent and the boiler was working on arrival, the engineer would leave and my £75 excess would be forfeited. Understandably, I am not happy and wish I had stayed with Corgi, but they wanted 3x the monthly cost, albeit with no excess. I guess if it was to fail completely I would be covered, but I don’t know if that is going to happen, leaving me with having to reset the boiler at random intervals!!! Looks like I will be finding an engineer I can trust and deciding whether I want to cancel the policy.Update 11th March 2024I tried to trigger the fault while watching the boiler, but only succeeded in getting it into the pressure danger zone of 3.2 bar (the max recommended is 3), at which point I turned it off. Pressure release valve and/or expansion chamber problem? No sign of water being ejected to lower the pressure, which is worrying.After this review went live I had a phone call from the Complaints Resolution team. However, after being passed to the Claims Team yet again I still wasn’t sure if an engineer would come to investigate and fix what is an obvious problem.Now I have escalated the issue.It seems that I have to pay the excess to get an engineer out to investigate and pass on the details of the problem, if one is discovered, which will then be evaluated by the technical team to see if anything will be done under the contract or I pay to get it fixed.Update 12th MarchA local company engineer arrived and diagnosed the problem immediately. He replaced the pressure sensor and filled the empty expansion chamber. No external authorisation needed. Sorted.After all the hassle and days lost trying to get it fixed, I have lost all confidence in 24/7 being able to handle a problem effectively. I will continue to use the local company. So no more answering the same question multiple times on the same call and being told that I said something I hadn’t, and no more explaining why the questions I was being asked made no sense, eg “how many times in a day does the boiler exceed the maximum pressure?”. As I don’t watch the pressure gauge 24/7 how am I supposed to answer that question? As the Call Centre is in India is it that they don’t need or use central heating and really have no idea what they are supposedly supporting? No obvious local technical support backup either.I cancelled the contract.

Title: The Property had Pest infestation and…
Review: The Property had Pest infestation and it was not addressed at the appropriate time. This resulted in the damage to the property. I had to call the Emergency every single day for a follow-up and Eventually, I had to hire a private pest control company at my own expense. Unfortunately, the company subcontracted by 24/7 Home Rescue to handle the job in Kent proved to be highly ineffective in attending to the property.

Review: I had an issue with my toilet continually flushing. As I have another loo in the house it was not deemed an emergency but an engineer still arrived within 48hrs. The repair could not be completed on the first visit as my cistern needed to be removed and the engineer didn’t have the bolts to replace the rusty ones that needed to be hacksawed off. He returned 2 days later and replaced the flush system and the float valve. Communication via text was good throughout. Considering I only pay £6.99 a month I thought the service was good, even with a £45 excess

Title: Delayed services
Review: Message also sent to 247.Had a boiler check on 28 December.  The engineer James Hartland was brilliant.  He spent time checking, reviewing and servicing the boiler.  He found that there was a small leak which was effecting the water gauge on the boiler which leads to having to fill the boiler up every few weeks.  James called and ordered the part.   Partly my fault for not checking with 247 but realised that no one every came back to repair.  I spoke to the Habib in customer service who said the order was not placed and would have to start a new claim with me having to pay an excess fee.  With that in mind and the delayed timeframe I would cancel the policy.  Habib spent time communicating with his Manager which resolved in wavering the fee and arranging an appointment for this Thursday 14 March to rectify the problem.  If it was not for Habib being so helpful I would seriously have cancelled the policy.  So please be made aware that you have a fabulous customer service colleague who is professional, helpful and goes above and beyond.  I do  hope he receives some remuneration for his services.

Title: Two things wrong....
Review: Two things. Firstly, our Carbon Monoxide alarm sounded so we called the emergency (not 247) number. They came in 20 mins and confirmed no leak of Co2 but said they were required to cap the meter so the boiler could be checked for leaks.  Fine.  So we called 247 to come and check the boiler and uncap the meter.  They wanted £95 to come, despite our all singing, all dancing contract with them.  Their reason.....in case there was a problem with the gas hob which is not covered by them.  The kind man on the phone even read the small print buried in sub section, sub section, sub section etc. Just an opportunity for them to grab more money so I called a local heating engineer who came for £60.  He discovered issue number two.  On opening the boiler he found it stuffed with paper towels soaking up a tiny water leak.  The very same boiler that had been serviced by 247 in October.  So either their engineer saw and ignored the water leak and stuffed paper towels in or he didn't actually check the boiler. Either way, unacceptable.  There was no gas leak and the water leak is being fixed. Seems like the Co2 monitor was at fault. Clearly you get what you pay for in life. I will be going back to British Gas as soon as possible.Advice:  Have two Co2 monitors so you can verify if one is faulty/at the end of its expected life. Reference # WS533083

Title: Beware
Review: We called the company and asked for an engineer to call as the pilot light had gone out and would not reignite. He came as arranged and one of his first statements was to inform me that the boiler was very old and he would quote me for a replacement. As it happens I had already instigated arrangements to replace it. He then proceeded to attempt to light the Pilot light which was successful and said he’d wait for 15 minutes to see if it stayed on. After this time I returned to the room and found that he had removed the boiler from the casing and condemned the boiler as irreparable. For the next hour and a half he brought up the sales spiel on numerous occasions. My concern is was this representative a Salesperson or an Engineer!! and why he dismantled the boiler to find a fault ie a leaking seal. Interesting considering I have a carbon monoxide monitor in the room. I now know the price of a new boiler, interest free credit and when it can be installed ie 2 days. Now left with no C/H or hot water as the new boiler is on the free Government scheme and can’t be fitted for a few weeks.Be very careful of this Organisation.

Title: AVOID
Review: AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!I would say keep well away from this company.Been with them for approximately 2 years and never had to call them out. At the beginning of the year was sent message that my boiler was due a service/ inspection (tenanted property) which I knew ,so got in touch and they couldn't do it until March! Booked it in and asked if there was a cancellation to let the tenant know as this was really to long to wait!.Service booked in for today 15th March and received text message 4.50pm yesterday saying the appointment had been cancelled due to unforseen circumstances. My tenant contacted me to say the engineer had rang her and said that he had an emergency job to do tomorrow where there were people with no power and I wd have to make another appointment. My tenant outlined that she was moving out on Saturday and new tenants were moving in the next week. I contacted 24/7 and explained that I had been waiting weeks for this service/ inspection and needed a current gas certificate before tenants could move in which is next week.The agent apologised and said the reason for the cancellation was the engineer had gone sick! I outlined that he had told my tenant he had been called away so someone wasn't telling the truth!Silence on the other end of the phone  then I was offered an appointment but again explained that this had to be either tomorrow or Saturday as the tenant was moving in next week (had van booked and had to be out of thier current property)I was told that it would be sorted out and I would receive a call in the morning.No call!Rang back again went through the whole thing again and told someone would ring   back shortly  , yes you probably can guess no call!Rang back again explained whole thing again and told that it couldn't be done and offered a later appointment which didn't work.Went to cancel policy and told 30 days cancellation so would be charged in April   asked to speak to a manager to complain as I was paying for a service that they couldn't deliver and that not only had I been lied to but still no phone call back.Told a manager would ring back  guess what still waiting.Had to get another engineer   nothing to do with this dreadful company so job is getting sorted. They are nothing sort of a bunch of scammers who don't deliver the service they have charged me for for months.Ref.WS532351

As far as I am concerned this was not acceptable I had other commitments leaving that account that would not be fulfilled due to them taking over £200 from my account I asked would they pay the charges due to them taking the money and they said no. Be aware to cancel your DD if you are leaving this company. Luckily my bank sorted it within minutes. Details have now been supplied.

Title: Avoid at all cost.
Review: Avoid at all cost.About a month after I had my cover with 24/7; I had a boiler breakdown. Engineer has been sent and with the findings, I was requested to pay for the part and my boiler was deemed to be beyond economical repair. The part I was requested to purchase wasn’t even the root cause of the problem. The issue I had was intermittent. I have opted in for British Gas repair and problem was shorted without any statement that my boiler is “BER”. I don’t recommend this company to anyone who would like to have a form of protection in case of the breakdown. Go for British Gas instead, you will save yourself money, stress and time of sending your ping-pong emails.RE: there is no need to investigate, as there was sufficient time to do this. By the end of day, you have made your decision. I have previously reported this.

Title: Had no hot water or heating
Review: Had no hot water or heating. Engineer came fixed it but said it needed a new heat exchanger and couple other parts that he would order. Later phone call from company claiming my boiler was beyond economic repair either buy a new boiler or pay £920 for the repairs myself although policy stated I was covered for £1000. They could have sent the manufacturer out for £300 to check if the boiler was BER and if so I would get 200 back but lose 100. I said no and soon recieved an email to say my cover was cancelled. Since then the boiler had broken down again so I got a friend who is a gas engineer who told me there was nothing wrong with the parts they stated and it was the control panel and a pump. He advised me to get in touch with worcester as they do a one off payment of £355 so engineer came out and fixed it no problem. Needless to say it's back to British gas. Wouldn't advise anybody to use this company.

Title: Terrible company
Review: Terrible company. We paid for the full package. Had them out once to unblock a drain which was fine. The second time we called they refused to come and do it unless we found a private company to first put a cctv camera down the drains-  all at our own expense. We never had a problem like this with our previous more well known company. Basically refusing to do the service we are paying for.Also refused to fix our door lock as the door was on a conservatory not attached to the house, even though we pay to cover doors and locks! Policy can't even be cancelled as that will be another £134! Don't be fooled into thinking all is good after the first visit, after that, all they care about is taking your money. Complete Con!! Avoid at all costs!! Both of your replies to this complaint are not in any way helpful. You have not contacted me directly, despite me sending you my contact details. You are more concerned with your reputation then good customer service. Shocking.

Title: This is follow-up review of bad service…
Review: This is follow-up review to my review on 08/03/24 to make people aware if you are stuck in critical situation 247 does not support. We were loosing Boiler pressure was told Boiler is faulty , we replaced the boiler , the problem of pressure loss has not gone. Since 16th March I have been trying to ask 247 rescue team to send engineer and after almost few days no one has been assigned. Imagine to be without hot water and heating for 3 weeks. Even after advising emergency no one has bothered to come out. It’s better to pay a company which does not leave you out in emergency situations.

Title: Great service
Review: Great service, fully repaired, thank you

Title: !!!DO NOT USE 24/7
Review: i believe sent a check a trader i paid out £96 for a call out to replace my heating pump in the airing cupboard 6 weeks later my ceiling in the hall collapsed through the constant drip of a failed connection, 24/7 would not get any one to stop the leak for 24 hours, i paid for a plumber who repaired it on a sunday afternoon and 24/7 reimbursed me a month later but refuse to pay for all the damage to my stair way and hall ceiling even after i offered to pay half the cost, their technical team decided it could not have been their been their fault after admitting and paying for it to be corrected by a professional firm, who said that even an apprentice would not make a mistake like that, DO NOT TOUCH THIS COMPANY!!!   i am contacting the mail and express you tube tiktok face book to warn people, they have even said sorry for the distress  and anxiety that they caused two 80+ disabled people i am contacting my solicitor to sue for that and damages STAY CLEAR OF 24/7 calling themselves we care, it means once we have you money we could not CARE LESS!!!

Title: Avoid at all costs
Review: I have always been one to ensure that I have cover in place. I paid them for 3 years previously being with homeserve n AA. They only ever came to do a boiler service once a year.. at the cost of £20 to £25 most recently every year. The boiler was making a rumbling sound which the service guy ignored n did not tell me this was potentially dangerous. I lived with this sound for 1 year until recently another guy came to service boiler.. he immediately shut off boiler saying the gas valve was faulty n to contact home rescue to fix. Now comes the joke home rescue do not cover replacement of the valve.. they will change it for me at the cost of £400!! Reason being it is at risk job. Seriously why did I have cover in place I dont no.. their website shows cost to repair valve is £180 to £220.. where does a £400 cost come in.. advisor spoke to manager n cost was brought down within half hour to £304. I am disgusted with this company avoid at all cost as no repair is covered when u need it. People pay u for peace of mind.. I found a company outside who changed the valve in 1 hour for half the price quoted. I will be cancelling my policy with uRef:WS485924 here is my policy number for you to investigate... I am positive you will not do anything and will give me the same 'its in my policy terms n conditions'. However my response to this is u r a home emergency response which I have been paying 25 pounds a month for 3 years. Emergency response should mean just that! Cover is cover why should I pay extra when you offer the service.

Title: scandal
Review: Again I write a review .  After all the stress resulting  in me having dangerously high blood pressure this company has put myself at 82 and my partner at 85Through so much stress starting  after having a brand new boiler bought and installed by them and then through their electrician making so many problems resulting in having no heating for Five days and told lies that they would come and fix and it took 5 days for it to be done. After the first 12 hours I was offered £30/35 compensation without asking for it. So after five days during the cold month of January I asked for more after a long time they decided I could have £40 compensation. I wasn’t happy.  With the way they dealt with this.  So approx 2 months later I asked to cancel the £15.39 per month I was paying for the cover , taking into account that the boiler had a guarantee of 10 years anyway.  I was told that I had unknowingly signed electronically a 10 year contract, bearing in mind I am 82 and I don’t consider that I could have possibly been explained that this contract was for 10  years.  All the people I have told of this say 10 years. Is so unacceptable and find it hard to believe.I have no paperwork at home to show me this agreement. I have had to get the prove of this signatureThrough on line and as I say at my age I don’t always find on line easy. So when I asked to cancel the agreement They say I need to pay £70.00 per year resulting in £630. In my case . So please beware any new customers of this ridiculous 10 YEAR contract. Especially if you are in your 80s.

Title: Had a problem with hot water supply
Review: Had a problem with hot water supply. Engineer visited and stated our pipe work was all wrong and a valve fitted was the wrong type. Took some pics and left. Later had a call from 24/7 stating ‘the field engineer has reviewed the pics and confirms what the visiting engineer has said. We will not cover it’.We got our own plumber in. He laughed, changed the valve, tested the system and left. He stated on his invoice that the valve and the pipe work were completely unremarkable. The only reason I’ve given 2 not 1 stars is that 24/7 reimbursed me immediately on receipt of my plumbers invoice and report. Like all insurance companies, it seems 24/7’s first reaction is NOT to cover if they can get away with it. Don’t give up, stand your ground, and do NOT renew your policy with this company. And no doubt they will cut and paste some piecemeal apology to this post. Just disregard that sincerity. (And btw if you were hoping to deal with a UK based call centre to understand and address your issue, think again.)

Title: Great Service - annoying calls
Review: I have absolutely no complaints about the annual boiler service I get from 247 Home rescue or the lovely engineers that come to do the aforementioned service or to be fair the cost of our cover.  But, and this is why I’m only giving 4 stars, In the last couple of weeks I have had 7 phone calls, twice they rang said who they were and then hung up, then after I’d finally booked my service date, I get another trying to sell me various products. Then straight after my service, when my boiler was in perfect working order and excellent condition especially considering its age and should keep going a good few more years ( engineers words), I get another call trying to sell me a new boiler claiming the engineer suggested it,  They eventually said it because of the age nothing else, in other words lying to me.  Then I get another call asking if everything with my service was ok and asking for feedback. I say I can’t talk as I am about to goInto a meeting.  So they say they’ll send me an email for feedback.  Then I get two more missed calls from them before they eventually send me the email.So great service, very irritating constant phone calls.

Title: Ombudsman complaint being prepared
Review: Sadly, my experience with this company doesn’t deserve a rating. I have been trying to help an elderly relative deal with this company, without much success unfortunately. The reason for them approaching me to assist them, is that I used to be an Area Manager for a High Street bank, and fortunately my close friend is the former Director for General Insurance at the FCA, so we have a good understanding of both General Insurance regulation and Contract Law, which is relevant to this grievance. To give the reader some background to this case, my relative had a boiler on a rented property that was insured through 247 Home Rescue, the boiler being approximately 19 years old. I believe they had been insured with 24/7 Home Rescue for several years, and had called them out previously to the boiler, so the company were well aware of its age. However, on this occasion (despite the policy document being the same as previous years, and their schedule stating zero excess) they refused to go out to the boiler unless my relative paid £75 up front. Being desperate to have the boiler repaired so the Tennant wasn’t without heat and hot water, she begrudgingly paid the £75, and their engineer appeared. However, he was unable to repair the boiler, pushed for her to have a new boiler, and reported back that the boiler was blocked and required a system flush before a repair could be made etc… It was at this point I was asked to intervene. My relative rang 24/7 Home rescue and authorised them to deal with me going forward. On the 3rd October 2024 after a great deal of discussion a, manager agreed that my relative had been misled, as her policy document incorrectly stated zero excess on the policy schedule (There fault, not the customers). Despite my explaining that this invalidated the policy, and as no works had been completed, they should cancel the policy and fully refund the customer, as the policy was set up incorrectly (their words not mine), therefore under a regulated policy rules invalidating the policy as the customer was misled. However, all they offered was a £75.00 refund, or £75.00 to be deducted from the repair should she wish to proceed down that route. They advised that they would put these two offers in writing to her by email, and she would need to advise them what she wished to proceed with. Sadly, she never received an email with these offers on (Spam box also checked!!). Despite not having received any email, she contacted them again to advise them that she would like to accept the £75 reimbursement as a minimum. Unfortunately, they claimed they had no record of their conversation with myself, and refused to reimburse her anything. Knowing how much time I had spent trying to resolve this for her, she was too embarrassed to tell my that she hadn’t received the £75.00 reimbursement. It wasn’t until I met with her again yesterday, that I asked her if she had been refunded the £75.00 from this company, that she advised me that they denied all knowledge of my call, and was never refunded - Even worse, she was still paying the monthly premium for a product she was mid-sold! To add insult to injury, it would appear she had to get her own heating engineer out to repair the boiler.Upon hearing this, I rang the company yesterday. At first the representative at their call centre denied that they had any of my details in connection with this policy. It wasn’t until I mentioned a GDPR breach that I was transferred to a different person, who miraculously found the authority on file. They initially didn’t find the notes relating to my call from the 3rd October, but after approximately 40 Minutes they did, and kept apologising, as it became clear to them that a manager had previously admitted the policy schedule was wrong, and that manager had agreed to at least reimburse the £75.00 that she was wrongly charged. He then offered to reduce the next two premiums by a further £10.00 per month which I accepted on her behalf (but he now corrected the policy to include a £75.00 excess, which I presume is how this company tries to cover its tracks?) - Won’t work for a pre-existing contract I’m afraid!!This representative (while continuously apologising), said he needed to put me through to yet another department who will process the £75.00 refund. Sadly, this is where the call went further south. The representative didn’t want to simply refund the amount, but wanted proof that she’d repaired the old boiler (Not sure what this has to do with wrongly charging a customer a fee?). After 1 hour, I was cut off 🤷‍♂️  This case is now going to the ombudsman if they don’t fully refund her premiums paid to date, and her £75.00 they agreed. This will now cost them a further £750.00 in a case fee with the FOS, which is what happens when your staff don’t understand the law!

Title: Wrong engineer sent poorly trained call centre staff
Review: We had an electrical fault which stopped the breaker resetting and consequently stopped the boiler working which I explained in detail to the call centre operative. It took 2 days for an engineers appointment and to my dismay they had sent a boiler engineer who confirmed only confirmed our problem. The engineer was pleasant and efficient and managed to rewire the boiler plug so we could use the boiler on another circuit. However my gripe is that the engineer stated that 24 7 would contact us to send an electrician to fix the breaker and restore the boiler plug. After 24 hours I had no contact other than a call from 247 to say the job was fixed and complete and was I happy with the work. On me phoning the claims line again, even though we had the right cover I was informed that our problem was no longer an emergency and that I had to find an electrician myself to repair the fault ! Even when I explained that initially I informed them that we needed an electrician they would not back down.

Title: I used this company for my boiler…
Review: I used this company for my boiler service ,my boiler was working perfectly fine before I opened my door for my service. The chap who came said we had a lovely boiler. He told me it was all done and everything was ok. 2 days later we had to put our heating on just to warm the house through,as it had been lovely weather the two previous days. We turned the thermostat on as we alway do ,heating didn’t WORK ,I was fuming. I phoned the heating company they told me they could come out but it would cost £95!! I explained it was working perfectly fine before the service they said they would not beable to come out until I paid £95 ,I told them I no longer wanted anything to do with them and I didn’t want them touching my boiler again. Please please if I can give you a word of advice MAKE SURE YOU CHECK YOUR HEATING IS WORKING before you let the engineer leave. Me myself I would never use this company again.

Title: 24/7  to my rescue
Review: 24/7  to my rescue. Having fitted a new valve in my second bedroom, I had to contact 24/7 as main bedroom radiator was working fine unfortunately to hot to touch.. Contacted company and could not have asked for a better outcome. The fact it was Easter weekend this not an issue with 24/7 giving me a time slot on a Saturday between 4pm and 6pm plus engineer would message me 30 minutes on route to job. Sultan arrived and again was very professional and respectful of my house. A new valve was required and no charge applied as I reported issue within time slot. Again Sultan covered his shoes and focused on task in hand. A job very well done. I would highly recommend 24/7 as not only dud they respond to my request they acted upon it swiftly and professionally. I also received a call to see if I was satisfied with work carried out, absolutely 💯 Incomparision to other companies that would complete job, 24/7 stands out completely. If I could award more than 5 🌟 I would. A very happy customer who will remain with 24/7 indefinitely. A huge thank you to Sultan and his work, you are a shining star. Thank you  once again 24/7 and please recognise you have an employee dedicated to his work.

Title: They declined the annual boiler service!
Review: Policy number: WS 588832I purchased this policy for my rented property. I did not make a single claim in 12 months. Called to book the boiler service. The first appointment was aborted as the tenant misplaced the gas prepayment card. The second appointment on 12/03/2024 was aborted as the engineer was unable to reach the property as the road was closed by police. They rebooked the appointment for the 3rd time on 02/04/2024.When the engineer did not arrive on 02/04/2024, I contacted them and to my surprise, they cancelled the appointment as the policy had expired. They did not even bother to let me know!Rather than rebooking the appointment, customer service pushed me to speak to the retention department.I insisted on speaking to the manager, they promised me to get a call in 24 hours This never happened.This is not the first time for me to leave a poor rating for this company, but this would be the last one as I moved all my properties to other companies.Update 10.04.2024Promised a callback from a manager within 24 hours on 02/04/2024Still waiting for this call!

Title: Unprofessional & Poor Service!!
Review: I have Landlord Home Care cover with 247HomeRescue and what a terrible experience I have faced recently.I had a major water leak at the boiler which was reported to 247HomeRescue, the team advised that an engineer would only attend after 24 hours. I made it clear to them that this required urgent repair as I had no heating or hot water and water had to be closed off at the mains. And we had elderly in the house with medical condition, this urgency was completely ignored by the team who dealt with my request in a very unprofessional manner. I had to pay an excess of £75 on top of the monthly £26 I was paying them for nearly 9 months. My experience with this company has made me rethink about renewing the policy at next renewal date. Such a disappointing service by 247HomeRescue. I normally would not write a negative review for any company, however this company has given such a poor service and without care for the customer so to let others know about my experience.

Title: Utterly appalling - Scammers!
Review: Utterly appalling - avoid at all costs!  CO2 alarm went off so we called our local Gas Network.  Engineer shut off gas and advised we get a boiler check done.  Called at 3pm and was told to expect a call back  'very soon'.  Called again just after 4pm and was asked to send engineers report and that, once received, soemone would call back 'almost immediately'.  Called again around 6pm to be told the report was being reviewed but an engineer would 'certainly be with us that evening'We then endured an awful and cold Scottish night with young children.  i called on the way to work around 6am to be fobbed off with the same excuses.  I was then told as it was 'an overseas call centre' they had no authority to do anything.  This operative couldnt tell me the out of hours hours but advised that my query the day before came 'out of hours'......remember I called at 3pm, 4pm and 6pm?I was 'promised' a call back at 9am.  I received a call (again on a very bad line from overseas) after 9am to be advised that it was not covered by my policy and it would be £95 plus labour!  I have read the T&CS and it clearly states 'Boiler Emergency'.  The SGN engingeer has advised we get the boiler checked in case it has a fault but a boiler policy doesn't cover that?  They said its a 'risk' but if I pay almost £100 plus a few hundred labour that risk apparently doesn't apply?I asked a more senior person to call me back and never got a response. I shall be contacting the Obudsman and urge you to PLEASE avoid this outfit if you have any sense! *They have since contacted me to discuss the situation and it';s went from bad to worse - standard 'copy and paste' emails as responses.  I cant beleive companies like this can exist in this day and age.  Utter scam!  Don't take the gamble

Title: Called for an engineer to visit for a…
Review: Called for an engineer to visit for a boiler breakdown. Requested an urgent appointment as no hot water or heating.Advised an engineer would arrive in 2 days time. I purchased the product on the basis of emergency same day appointments.After much arguing I’m told an engineer will arrive today. Received a text to confirm and say if I’m not in then I might be liable for a £30 charge. No engineer turned up, no call to advise me. Called them back to be told that the engineer is probably not coming. When I asked why the agent said it might be traffic, a job might of run late as they are busy because of winter. It is Mid April.Clearly didn’t know and not able to speak with the engineer directly. That is the domain of the scheduling team. They will call me back. No timeframe to call me back given. I tried to call back to be told they have now all gone home and back tomorrow at 9:00. Called the next day at 9:30 and they have not arrived. Not to worry though, I am on a priority list. When I ask when they will call me they cannot give a timeframe let alone tell me when I can get an engineer.I asked about escalation and complaints and told to go online.Just left wondering how long this is going to take. Sold a policy on the basis of emergency help when you need it and in this case it certainly is not.

Title: OLDER BOILER - DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY
Review: OLDER BOILER? BE VERY WARY OF THIS COMPANY! I have been paying premiums for 5 years to 247 Home Rescue. No claims.  In recent years I got an email to say as my boiler was now over 10 years old, the excess was going up to £75 and premiums were going up 40%.  As I am 65 years old with no family, I thought it was still worth it to be covered in case of emergency.   First claim ever, happened last month.  I had to pay the £75 excess up front, then they sent an engineer out.  He advised it was the pump and would let the office know.  The cost to supply and fit a new pump was £405. I was glad I had insurance.  247 Home Rescue called me later that day and advised my boiler was beyond economic repair and they wouldn't be fixing it.  I asked how they worked this out as it isnt explained in their policy wording.  They said 15 years ago ( the age of my boiler), my boiler would have cost £766 (I have no way to verify this, but possibly?) they don't count installation cost.  With 10% depreciation each year they said it is now worth £156. The repair cost is more than the boiler is worth so they won't pay, or even contribute to the repair.  They won't even send the engineer back to repair it if I pay the £405 in full. Beyond Economic Repair Limit £250? No they won't pay that either.  Value of my boiler £156? No not a chance, theyre not paying anything.They initially refused to pay back the excess charge and simply cancelled my policy! I'm listed as vulnerable on their data base. Goodness knows how they treat people who aren't vulnerable! So 5 years of premiums, £75 excess fee, and they simply said we're not paying anything and your policy is now cancelled.  Oh, but we can sell you a new shiny boiler for £7000 from our sister company.  Conflict of interest, or what?I worked out that even 5 years ago, by their reckoning my boiler was only worth £268.  So inflated premiums and an increased excess charge, really meant they were never going to cover pretty much anything that would require to be supplied and fitted. After 5 escalations (I may be vulnerable, but not stupid), and pointing out wording on their key facts sheet, I eventually got my excess back plus £30 for a small fan heater.  Useless at my property, and I will now have pay for another engineer to come out and do the same tests. This feels very much like a boiler insurance scam to me. So it's off to the Financial Ombudsman to see what they make of these very shady practices.

The company is a CON. I raised a claim that my sink is blocked and shower is blocked. Their Engineer came and said I dont have the parts to fix we will have to come out again to fix. Then it took over 5 days for 24/7 to come back to me on phone and say its not in terms and conditions. Your pipe work is not correct. It was correct when it was working fine but now when it needs fixing its not correct.The Engineer on site also said your boiler drain is not connected and it leaking in the property which needs fixing. I pay preminum price to 24/7 to fix the issues but its a CON. The guy necr fixed the problem and the kitchen sink and shower is still blocked. Boiler pipe is leaking. I want to take 24/7 to court. I would need the reports from your professioanl (unprofessional) engineer who came to the property with out informing.When i raised a complainet 24/7 have the guts to call me and say we will give you compensation for £30 and our engineer has said the job is complete.Utter lie. The job is incomplete. The Engineer did not unblock the shower. he did try unblocking the sink by exerting pressure in the sink waste which eventually knocked the bioler pipe out of the "T" and now that is also drainging in the house. How unprofessioanl the Engineer also left his tools at my house.They are CON and know they are worng and hence trying to fob off by giving compensation. I need my full money to be returned which is in couple of hundreds and not £30.I will for sure cancel with 24/7. British Gas I have had over 15 years at my second house with out any issue or terms and conditions issue like 24/7 has. They just want easy money and not willing to fix the problem.My previous review on 5th April has more details. I would recomend all to think carefully about this company if its easy job they will fix it as its quick in and out which most people can do themselves but if it requires investigation and implmentation they will fob you off and refer you to terms on conditions.BE VERY CAREFUL. THIS IS A CON COMPANY

Title: How on earth can anyone give this…
Review: How on earth can anyone give this company a 5 star review. I only gave 1 star because there is no zero. Absolutely shocking and not fit for purpose. All they want to do is get you to book extra visits or try and sell you a new boiler. Call out charge both times I used them first for electrics said they could only stop so long, didn't fix problem just got electrics back on in kitchen but nothing for the rest of the house said we would need to book an appointment for them to stay longer to find the fault which would obviously cost. Got a proper electrician in who found the fault and sorted everything on 20 minute charged me £30. Second occassion upped my excess for call out as came up with some story about the boiler being over 12 years old. I built the house its only been built 10 years ago. Came out fixed it and said it was the board that was playing up but said it was only  a temporary fix but it was beyond economical repair and we needed a new boiler. Got the office to give me a call suprise they have an offer on £3000 for a new boiler. Got another gas engineer genuine bloke out didn't charge me a penny said there was nothing wrong with the boiler or the system just get a flush at the next service and call him if we have any further problems but for now it was working fine. Gave me a price.  Would charge me £350 to replace with a brand new board sourced one on the internet in seconds, but he recommended we get a reconditioned one and he would do it for  £120 parts and labour. Neither of the above to me is beyond economical repair.

Title: Total scam
Review: We were contacted by company to arrange annual boiler service, and the was able to complete same day.Their technician was very polite and appeared competent in his work. UPATE. I initially was pleased and entered a 5 star review.However I have now lowered to 1 star.10 days after the service I noticed that the boiler was over pressurising and expelling loads of water out of the overflow. (Pressure showing at over 4 bar when heating on).I contacted the company to ask for the boiler to be checked again, as it worked fine before being serviced. However I was told I has to now submit a claim for repair as over 7 days has expired. I reluctantly did this and paid the £95 excess.When the second engineer attended he stated we required a new expansion vessel and pressure relief valve. He said he would order the parts and we would be contacted by head office.I later received a call where they stated they would NOT undertake the repair because the cost was £425 and uneconomical due to the age of the boiler, and the only option was to buy a new boiler. I asked them to advise the parts and labour costs, and it was clear they had been over-inflated the repair cost. I have now arranged for a repair by another company at a much lower cost of only £160.This company is clearly selling boiler cover under false pretences, and know they would not honor any claims if the cost exceeds £250. In view of their inflated estimates I bet they don't undertake many repair at all !!!Their conyract small print also states we cannot now cancel the policy without paying fees of £135 for the call out and £85 for the service. So I am left paying for a policy that cannot be used. TOTAL SCAM.

Title: Been a customer for 3 years - poor service
Review: Been a customer for 3 years - service has got worse. Used to be a UK call centre with attentive staff. Now I booked in a boiler service recently and they only offered 2 dates which didn't match what I could do. I asked for alternatives and they placed me on hold for 10 minutes to find alternative dates. They could not offer any day other than a Wednesday for a service and that was over a month.I had a family member come and stay in at my house for the boiler service on the date they gave me as they could not offer any day other than a Wednesday! After they had stayed in all day without an accurate time given for the boiler service they eventually cancelled the appointment at 15:22.  When I tried to rearrange, I was placed on hold for 10 minutes by the call centre worker who was trying to find another date! I hung up as this is unacceptable and this kind of data should be at the operator's fingertips. When I emailed to rearrange a new service, I was offered an alternative date in 6 weeks. Would absolutely not recommend this company.========UPDATE - 1 week later =======Company tried to call me to discuss.  I called back and the person who answered had no record of me calling the company since over a year ago! In spite of the fact the company had been calling me most days since I wrote this TrusPilot review.After explaining what had happened the operator then requested to put me on hold.  After saying I wouldn't be put on hold as every time they did that I was on hold for 10 minutes he agreed very kindly to investigate and call me back.  1 days has passed since and I have received no call back.In my experience, the company has not kept up-to-date records of my account or my personal data. I requested to cancel my contract with them a week ago and still have not had a reply to that email. Just a deluge of phonecalls during the working day when I am unable to answer.   ======= Update 1.5 weeks later =====Company emailed to ask for a convenient time to call. I said after 4pm and gave the number they already have on the system. The company attempted to call me twice before 4pm then sent an email asking me to call them as they were unable to contact me. Have you even read my emails. I would advise people to avoid this company at all costs. They still have not cancelled my contract despite me putting this in writing twice.

Title: Former Prospective Customer
Review: Hi, I am looking for home cover and reviewing a number of options. As such, I have looked at yourselves and some competitors (such as YourRepair, Hometree and more). I have a scheduled call tomorrow with one of your colleagues to discuss whether to go-ahead and use 24/7. I wanted to find out a little more about your company, service and reputation. As many prospective customers would. I looked on Trustpilot and Google reviews then Facebook.So I had reviewed some '24/7' Facebook posts. In doing so I found a number of posts that had comments on that I could not see. I asked in a couple of these posts why the comments might be hidden (at that point I was assuming they must be negative). I have had another look today and you have either completely removed your presence from Facebook OR you have blocked me. This explains a lot.Needless to say, I won't be using you now.I'd like to think that you have a) an employee who is not representing your values OR b) is doing this with your full company approval. Either way, this is pretty poor.It's not the good reviews that win peoples trust - it's the bad ones (and everyone has bad ones), the ones that show the reader how you treat people when things go wrong.Some of us ALWAYS start with the 1* reviews and work upwards.

Title: Absolutely appalling experience with…
Review: Absolutely appalling experience with 247 Home Care. Currently, I have a complaint being handled by the Ombudsman service due to their incompetence.A couple of years ago, I had an engineer service my boiler. Despite mentioning that the boiler pressure dropped every few days, the engineer didn't bother checking any of the radiators and simply dismissed it. As expected, the issue persisted and worsened over time, eventually dropping daily. After paying a £95 excess fee, another engineer replaced the expansion valve, claiming it was the problem. Yet, the very next day, the issue recurred. Shockingly, no radiators were inspected for leaks during either visit.Upon contacting them again, I was informed that they couldn't check anything else as per their terms and conditions, leaving me stranded. Days later, my living room radiator pipe burst, causing a major water leak that flooded one side of the room. This resulted in additional expenses of £160 to an independent plumber to secure and replace the damaged valve, not to mention the water damage to my laminating flooring, which is now uneven.Following my complaint to 247, they callously requested all invoices and pictures of damage, only to then wash their hands of any responsibility, claiming it wasn't their fault.To add insult to injury, amidst this chaos, they went ahead and renewed my policy despite my cancelling my auto renewal, then blamed it on me saying their system showed I renewed it. In summary, opting for 247 Home Care is nothing short of a waste of money. Spare yourself the headache, hassle, and stress by choosing a more reliable company. A few extra pounds spent elsewhere could save you from endless frustration.

Title: Richard is a 10*, 24/7 Home Rescue is a 0*. One good engineer in a very poor customer experience.
Review: Before going into the specifics, I want to say that Richard (the senior engineer who managed to fix the issue with my boiler) was brilliant. Very good, thorough, and managed to sort everything in no time, and if I could rate him personally, I would rate him 5/5Having said that, I am rating 24/7 Home Rescue a 1/5 because I cannot choose 0 stars. The whole management process of my claim was appalling. I opened a claim for leaky (1 yo) boiler with loss of pressure on 8th March. The whole situation was resolved (thanks to Richard, again) on 25th April! 7 weeks in total!In those 7 weeks I had:* 4 different engineers attending my property * Each one had a different diagnosis requiring new spare parts to replace* The lowest point was when I had to live without hot water and heating for a whole week (and partly without electricity/internet for 2 days) because one of the engineers who attempted to fix the boiler ended up completely messing things up AND rip some wires off the walls, hence the no electricity* After being very vocal on the phone, Richard was sent to my property on a Saturday and immediately identified the issue. He also fixed the broken electrics straight away and made sure he ordered the (actual!) spare parts needed to fix my boiler once and for all and came as soon as the parts were available. Not a single time was I taken seriously (would anyone live without hot water and heating, especially when it is effectively cold outside?). In short, I would definitely avoid 24/7 Home Rescue as a company but would 100% recommend Richard as a senior engineer. EDIT: Now that the review is live on TrustPilot, I can also say that I was lied to on the phone earlier. I was told that the review (i.e. the rating) would be exclusively about the engineer who fixed my issue, not 24/7 Home Rescue. I argued on the phone that it didn't seem like it would be the case, if the review were to be published. I was assured multiple times that the review would only be about Richard, who was brilliant (as said above). I am quite glad I didn't trust the person on the phone and maintain my 1 (well, 0) star rating for 24/7 Home Rescue. Now on top of a poor customer experience I can add lies to the long list of unprofessional behaviour. EDIT2: As per the response below, it seems that this has been passed onto the complaints team. Very "funny" as when I was asked about raising a complaint, I was told I would be called back. I, of course, never was.

Title: This is my second negative experience…
Review: This is my second negative experience with this company. I reported a leaking tap on their online page. A couple of days later I received an email saying they’d tried to phone me and had no answer so if I still required assistance to phone them. They hadn’t tried to phone me as I had no missed calls on my phone, so that wasn’t true.I phoned them only to be told my leaking tap wasn’t covered. I was a bit baffled as it’s on their drop down menu and isn’t mentioned in the one page of what’s covered and what’s not covered. The operator then without hesitation said it’s in page 7 of the T&Cs. Obviously a page all their operators are familiar with so they have no need to scour the lengthy documentation to find the clause.I’ve now looked at all the documentation I received and there is no mention anywhere that they will not repair a leaking tap. So I would like the company to tell me where that clause is buried?My homecare agreement has a big green tick for all plumbing.Last time they refused to fix a lock on my back door as my conservatory door was considered my back door. I could only see a mention of a porch. I left the operator a 1 out of 5 although it’s not his fault. I later received an email asking why I was unhappy?? Really. No reply yet but I’m not expecting one. Ridiculous that companies say they cover plumbing etc.They’ve even removed my claim from my account so it’s no longer there. I’ll leave my service contract number so the company can show me the clause on page 6 as I can’t find it in anything I have.Well, after telling me they’d look into their policies to make sure my experience with them doesn’t happen again, I have heard nothing whatsoever. No explanation of where this get out of jail clause they quoted is. That’s because I’ve scoured the documents and it’s not there. So they don’t have it.I final bit. I did get my service and on my boiler last time with these guys. I asked the engineer to fill the readings in on my Valliant service book. He didn’t know them as he hadn’t done them, so he made them up!Also, I have a filter attached to the return pipe to the boiler. He hadn’t cleaned that as I had a bit of paint in the seal which wasn’t broken. He’d never touched it.Can I have a reply about all that ?

Title: Six weeks and boiler still not working…
Review: Six weeks and boiler still not working properly after numerous visits from engineer(s). Only intermittent hot water and heating until the boiler issues an error code and shuts down. If an engineer orders parts, there is typically a two day wait for the parts to be authorised and arrive and then two or three days before an engineer is booked in, meaning any repair that needs ordered parts is going to take about 5 days even if they manage to guess what the problem is first time. If it needs a second visit that’s another 5 days and so on. Call centre staff are not able to answer any technical questions or complaints, so you have to wait another day for a call back, so the whole process drags on and on. I will update my review if they manage to get the boiler working again. Update: Now trying to cancel the policy and get someone else to look at the boiler but of course 247 are saying I cant end the policy before the 12 months is up and they will charge me if I leave early. Adding insult to injury is the only way I can describe this. I would recommend anyone avoid this company at all costs. Update: After 9 phone calls 247 have agreed to cancel the policy and take no further payments. I still have water leaking from the boiler on to the kitchen worksurface but at least I’m not paying for the privilege.

Title: Engineer was polite and knowledgeable…

Title: There was Intermittent hot water but…
Review: There was Intermittent hot water but at-least heating was working. Engineer was called in and he managed to break the boiler completely on his first visit and said more parts are required. During the second visit he changed some parts and realized something else is required and left the home with no heating and hot water after troubleshooting and looking for videos on youtube on how to fix.. 1 week later waiting for an update and upon calling 24/7 they said that they are waiting on the cost for gas valve. Absolutely horrible service as the person that I spoke to had no empathy to the fact that they had left the house with no heating or hot-water for an entire week for a person with health condition at the property. Everything they promise at the time of signing up is nothing but a lie as when it comes to delivering the service they care the least.After calling to get an update, I am told that the cost of repair is £500 so they won't repair it and want me to pay approx 2700 to get a new boiler installed through them. I can understand the reason for repair if parts are not available but denying to repair the boiler because it will cost them £500 and expecting me to pay for new boiler is a joke. Everything they promise at the time of selling insurance seems a lie and when it comes to delivering the service they find excuses to not deliver. This company is a joke

Title: Boiler was working fine before service
Review: Boiler was working fine before service, took forever to service as water got into a pipe and kept tripping the electric and he couldn't get rid of it. He had to use my hairdryer on it solidly for 30 minutes or so, using up my electricity money...then laid it on thick saying I needed a new boiler as mine was so old and I'm obviously ill and vulnerable so need a working boiler.Within a few hours of the service, boiler stopped working and took 4 days for an engineer to come out. Phone customer service was terrible and unhelpful. In the meantime I had 2 calls trying to sell me a new boiler. When the engineer came to fix it second time he was helpful and friendly, said I didn't need a new boiler, and the problem was a simple thing the first engineer had forgot to do as he left.Very regretful I'd already signed up to another year of their boiler cover as I would have definitely not continued had I known their service, inefficiency, slowness and priority to upsell.

Title: Do not use if a Landlord/Landlady
Review: Dreadful customer service. I have had HUGE problems both times I have tried to use them despite having a Landlord complete house policy including boiler, plumbing and electrics. The first time I had HUGE problems trying to book my boiler service in time for compliance with legislation. Initially they told me that I was calling too early so to try again nearer the time. When I tried nearer the time they tried to give me an appointment which was too late to be compliant. Recently I had problems with booking an emergency plumber. They could not immediately get through to the managing agents so tried to leave a message on an unrelated mobile. They eventually managed to get through to my tenant but then failed to book an appointment and left a potentially problematic water leak for a whole bank holiday weekend. I was eventually informed via my Managing Agent that the supplier had failed to go ahead as they needed to speak to the policy holder- however the supplier had not at any time tried to contact the policy holder and I ended up having to call them. This was due to the excess on my policy which needed to be paid first/upfront. If the policy holder had not been contactable (e.g. abroad etc) then the plumbing fix would not have proceeded as the supplier refuses to invoice for this excess fee and wants immediate payment before any job takes place. This is even despite the problems I explained to their customer service team regarding booking any appointment.Further Update (8/5/24) Despite having reported all the problems that I am having messages that should go to tenant regarding timing of plumbers visit still being sent to landlord's mobile when this is not appropriate/required as these should be sent to the tenant instead. Also as the landlady after the plumber's visit I phoned up 24/7 to obtain a report as to how the plumbers visit had gone and whether the issue was now fixed. Unfortunately 24/7 customer service were unable to advise me. It was important for me to know quite quickly as I am having a new washing machine delivered. I did explain this to the representative but they did not seem at all interested in my dilemma.

Title: Service is personnel-dependent
Review: Varying levels of service provided, depending upon the skills and knowledge of the individual technician allocated to the job.This has ranged from just a boiler clean, fan bearing lubrication and CO monitor test, to those plus... pressure testing, testing of the volume of inhibitor in the water, external and internal check of flues, testing of controls and 3-way valve operation, and checking for air in radiators and the level of warmth, rectifying any imbalance in those radiators.Whilst the former level of service was provided at the same cost as the latter and may be sufficient, the latter service gave immeasurably more confidence and satisfaction in the annual boiler service.
