Title: Fillow on to my previous review
Review: Fillow on to my previous review, I forgot to add the following.The package I have for central heating and boiler care came with a Boiler Service.  The engineer didn't Service the boiler, only checked the gas emissions.  He was here for 20 minutes at the most.  The boiler broke down and they told me they wanted ove £360 to repair as the gas control valve needed replacing.  This was even though it was under contract and they had been taking money off me every month (boiler was 11 years old) I refused and got a reputable company in who cheked it over and it wasn't the gas control valve. It was broken because they hadn't Serviced it properly. Servicing should take at lease an hour. Because of this I've had to get the boiler replaced.I van only say AVOID AVOID AVOID THEM.

Title: Another update from the company that…
Review: Another update from the company that rescues you from nothing… apparently their engineers can fix your central heating system without going anywhere near the plumbing. When they claimed to have fixed it through some form of telepathic plumbing and your water pressure crashes, then that’s not linked and they want an additional £90 call out fee, then when the original fault recurs 4 weeks later, that’s another £90 call out. When you complain and refuse to pay the £40 cancellation fee, you get Stanley. Stanley is head of complaints for the company so he must be extremely busy. He did take time out of his hectic schedule to answer my complaint and offered to reduce the fee from £40 to £30, Stanley said this was his final offer, Stanley is currently singing for his £30. 😂

Title: Please be very careful when this…
Review: Please be very careful when this company call you and quote for an appliance insurance policy. They do not give all the facts. If you buy a plan the first 30 days you are unable to claim, this I would expect to be normal practice, if your appliances have a breakdown after that 30 day waiting period and the engineer orders your parts and then the parts are on back order with no idea when they will come in , this company will not do anything until you have paid your plan for over 6 months ( never told this when brought) Why 6 months, nearly every other warranty company only have and I believe should have a 30 day waiting period for anything wrong with that appliance, up to a certain limit if a replacement is needed. Not value for money at all, I have realised better plans out there for the same cost .

Title: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY
Review: During 2023 an engineer attended at my property to service the boiler.  This engineer broke a clip holding the inside boiler cover to the boiler itself.  The engineer confirmed to me that he had broken the clip at the time (0.27p each).  24/7 then tried to charge me for this breakage at £109.00 for the engineer to attend back at the property to fix it.  When I queried this 24/7 contacted the engineer who initially admitted to me that he had broken the clip and he also admitted to 24/7 that he had broken the clip.  The clip was replaced free of charge and in this engineer's report it was confirmed that both clips were intact - 24/7 confirmed this to me during my complaint.  Then in 2024 a different engineer attended at the property, admitted he too had broken a clip, the black plastic remnants were on the floor and he told me he had ordered a new clip.  After he left my property, the control panel of the boiler dropped down as this engineer had not screwed it in properly (he told me he could not find his blue screwdriver).  I heard nothing from 24/7 so phoned up and explained what had happened and made a complaint when I was told again, I would have to pay £109.00 to replace the clip (which costs 0.27p) which held the internal boiler cover in place which 24/7 said had caused the control panel to slip and as the clip was not covered in the policy, as the engineer had confirmed that he had not broken it but confirmed to them that it was missing when he arrived at my property on his report, I would need to pay £109.00.  I confirmed that the engineer had indeed broken the clip as I had swept up the evidence.  The complaint was looked into but as the 24/7 engineer had reported that the clip had been missing, which was untrue, the complaint was not upheld so I asked for a manager call back.  This was received and I explained that if the clip had been missing previously, then the boiler cover would have shown signs of this as the cover would not have been on.  The complaint manager refused to accept this or accept that the engineer's report from 2023 confirmed both clips were on the boiler.  I confirmed that no-one had been in the boiler since the last engineer serviced it during 2023 and if the clip had dropped down from the boiler then it would still be within the boxed-in boiler compartment, and it was not.  The complaint was not upheld again and the complaints manager, who totally refused to give me his manager's name etc, told me I would have to pay for a further engineer visit of £109.00. I explained that if the clip was not on the boiler from 2023 then the engineer who attended the property at that time would not have been able to attach the internal boiler cover at that time.  When the boiler was serviced in 2023 there were no signs on the boiler that a clip was missing and no signs that the clip was missing when the engineer attended during 2024.  WOMEN WHO ARE ON THEIR OWN - DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY - the engineer during 2024 said 'I hope I am going to get a thank you when I have finished' - creepy or what!   DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY AS IT WILL COST YOU IN THE LONG RUN AND IT COSTS YOU TO GET OUT OF THE CONTRACT.  BE VERY WISE AND GIVE THIS COMPANY A TOTAL MISS. TOTALLY UNSCRUPULOUS COMPANY AND UNSAFE FOR WOMEN TO USE. 247 replied to this complaint very weakly, stating the 2024 engineer's report said the 'clip was missing", however, the engineer's report from 2023 confirmed that '2 clips were present at that time on the internal boiler cover. So which engineer lied?  No one but the engineer ever goes in the boiler built in cupboard.  Martin Lewis' website has a dossier on 247 and the reviews are dire.  As I said previously, DO NOT USE 247, you will end up paying the price.  Martin Lewis' website is full of complaints about 247 with many dissatisfied customers.

Title: I highly recommend 24|7 Home Rescue services to everyone!
Review: I recently had the pleasure of receiving outstanding service from Steven, an engineer from 24|7 Home Rescue, during my annual boiler service. From the moment Steven arrived, his politeness and professionalism were evident. He greeted me warmly and took the time to explain the service process, which immediately put me at ease.Steven's extensive knowledge was apparent as he meticulously inspected and serviced the boiler. His diligence ensured that every aspect of the service was thoroughly completed, and he was more than happy to answer any questions I had, providing detailed explanations and useful tips for maintaining the boiler's efficiency.What truly stood out was Steven's efficiency. He worked swiftly yet meticulously, ensuring that the job was done to the highest standard without cutting any corners. The service was completed in a timely manner, leaving me confident in the reliability of my boiler for the upcoming year.Overall, Steven's exceptional politeness, deep expertise, and diligent efficiency made this boiler service experience with 24|7 Home Rescue truly outstanding. I highly recommend their services and commend Steven for his exemplary work.

Title: Age discrimination?
Review: 24/7 have been accepting a premium from me to repair and service my boiler for years in the full knowledge that it is over 20 years old. The first time I actually need a repair I'm told that they won't do it because it's ' beyond economical repair ' The  cost of the repair is just over £300( inc vat ) and apparently my boiler is only worth £250. If I had been told that they wouldn't carry out a repair above this amount this before I took out the policy I wouldn't have wasted my money. It seems that although I pay the same premium as for a new boiler, for which they would have carried out the repair, they won't repair mine because of it's age '. I can't really see the relevance of this ' beyond economical repair ' defence - we aren't talking about a written off car( to use thier analogy ) just a boiler which is getting older. I can't seem to get this point across to them as they just  keep spouting ' beyond economical repair' like some invisible shield

Title: AVOID !!! I don’t even think they deserve 1star…

Once they realised I could not afford this I got another call saying I could pay nearly £300 for glow worm to fix my boiler . I was with British Gas before and never had a problem with there break down cover . This morning they cancelled my boiler cover for me !!! Avoid they rob people blind . Title: Waiting Months for a service

I had to wait months for a service call and the guy that turned up created a problem, couldn’t fix it (he doesn’t do repairs) and now I have to wait another three months. They clearly are trying to service customer base with insufficient engineers.

Title: Terrible boiler care...
Review: Terrible boiler care.... been with them around 7 yrs  all through covid kept calling and pestering us to buy a new boiler.  Had to keep chasing them to carry out an annual service which we were supposedly paying for. To cut a long story short we called them out in May 2024 because hot water kept going and coming back. We were told boiler irrepairable , or under their policy they were claiming would cost more than £250 to repair so not worth it. I also had to pay a fee for call out as boiler was over 10 yrs old. Something like £75. Very very quick to get out a very overpriced quote for a new boiler. Cancelled our cover and went elsewhere calling in an independent gas fitter. Came today carried out a full service drained off so much gunk commented that boiler hadn't been serviced properly for many years. Got it working now its been cleaned properly should last about another 10 yrs..... i mean what the heck. What were we paying for if services havent been done properly for years... Avoid for boiler care anyone reading this. Save yourself the money and stress.

Title: Boiler service, NO appointment

Title: Horrible Experience.
Review: Horrible Experience.I transferred four insurances to 24/7 home rescue. (Fridge Freezer, Boiler, Washing Machine & Tumble Dryer.) However I was disappointed with the service.The Boiler was due for a annual service in Dec 2023. The appointments had to be made and before anyone came (Constantly cancelled by 24/7). Finally when they arrived they broke the boiler and then needed parts (another booking). We spent a long time without  heating & hot water.Six months later the Fridge Freezer broke down and a similar thing happened. Two weeks without refrigeration and no sense of urgency from the company. I eventually had to buy a new Fridge Freezer. Please read SMALL PRINT on the policy

Engineers were sent to tell me what I already knew and had been told by their engineer. I spoke to four people in India, two people in the UK who all assured me that the DD had been cancelled but it kept being reinstated. I asked my bank to block it but they continued to reinstate it. I have threatened them with the FCA to get them to 'back off'. FIrst one star review I have ever given - frustration doesn't touch it!!!In their reply they say they cannot identify my "details in our system" yet they have phoned me twice since the posting of this review. I'm puzzled.

Title: Not a 24/7 Home Emergency…
Review: Ref: PC511520This is not a 24/7 Home Emergency Breakdown company! Be careful! If you have a electrical fault at 6:30pm you will be able to make a claim but YOU WILL NOT get assistance on the same day. Two days later I am STILL waiting for an electrician to attend to my emergency.I have one electric socket in my home after a power cut and that was on a Wednesday. I raised a claim that day, it was processed on Thursday morning. I am now sat in my house at 1:00 pm on Friday and I STILL have not received attendance from an electrician.I have had no communication today to let me know when the electrician will arrive - in fact I have had no communication today from 247 Home Rescue. I have been a customer for almost two years and had my premium increased this year. Despite this I have had no help.

Review: Hi,I had an issue with my boiler the engineer came and fixed it but the next day the same problem was showing so I called them again I had an appointment for after 4 days they gave me a appointment from 8-6 with out pay I took a off from work and waited all day for the engineer and he did not come after I had called them asking and they had lied saying that they had came at 2:55 when I have CCTV of him not being outside the house then they agreed that the engineer had not came so I had to pay 150£ and fix the problem with a private engineer and all I got was compensation 30£ I will never use your service and don't recommend anyone else too as well.Also when I had phoned in the staff were speaking very impolitely.Thanks Alex Joseph

Title: Extremely Poor Service
Review: Actually don’t even want to give this company 1 star but lowest available.Reported fault on 23/05/24 to be told Engineer booked between 8-6 24/05/24.  Engineer arrived confirmed he was unable to do job and had no equipment.  Put warning notice on system and reported to his manager.  Received text to say Engineer would come 25/05/24 again between 8-6.  Engineer arrived, again could not fix and no equipment.  He phoned his manager who confirmed 24/7 were aware of this job and a sub contractor with equipment would be sent.  Received another text to say they would come between 12-6.  Stayed in, cancelled our plans.  Phoned 24/7 at 4pm to be told that contractor would not be coming until 27/05/24.   I have waited in all day and after 5 phone calls to 24/7 have again been told contractor is not coming and they cannot contact them.  The saga continues, I am at a loss how to resolve this issue.  I have had to continually chase 24/7 as obviously we are not important.  They have continued to over promise and under delivered customer service.

Title: Outstanding Boiler Service by Wayne from 24x7 Home Rescue
Review: I recently had the pleasure of using 24x7 Home Rescue for a boiler service, and I am thoroughly impressed with the experience. The service was carried out by Wayne, an exceptionally skilled and professional service engineer.From the moment Wayne arrived, his friendly demeanor and punctuality set a positive tone for the entire service. He demonstrated an impressive depth of knowledge about boiler systems, patiently answering all my questions and explaining the process in clear terms.Wayne's meticulous attention to detail was evident as he conducted a thorough inspection and maintenance of the boiler. He ensured that every component was functioning optimally, and he even went the extra mile to provide helpful tips for maintaining the boiler's efficiency.What stood out most was Wayne's commitment to safety and quality. He performed all the necessary checks with precision and ensured that everything was left clean and tidy after the service. His professionalism and dedication to his work gave me great confidence in the reliability of 24x7 Home Rescue.Overall, the boiler service provided by Wayne was top-notch, and I highly recommend 24x7 Home Rescue for their excellent service and expertise. Thank you, Wayne, for your outstanding work!

Title: I have a landlord policy with Home Rescue
Review: I have a landlord policy with Home Rescue.  As such, they are meant to provide a service on my boiler each year.  They haven't provided one yet.  I phoned up last week to book in a service and they said that they wouldn't be able to provide one for a month.  I need one now.  I have a policy with Homeserve on another property and the level of service is much better.  I went with Home Rescue because I wanted to see what other providers are like.  From what I have seen so far, I am not impressed.  If my gas boiler service is not conducted within the next week I will be taking my custom elsewhere.ThanksSo, when is my boiler going to get serviced then?  You haven't got back to me. My boiler service and certificate were finally done on Friday, two weeks after my initial call.  I don't understand why the person I spoke to first said that it would take a month to organise when it was finally arranged within a matter of days.

Title: Unacceptable Delay and Lack of Prompt Service from 247
Review: I am deeply disappointed with the service provided by 247. Yesterday evening (29/5), I discovered that my boiler was not functioning, leaving my entire home without hot water. I immediately called the 24/7 helpline at 10 PM, and the customer service representative assured me that they would notify me as soon as an engineer was assigned to address the issue today (30/5).However, by 11:30 AM today, I had still not received any update. I called the helpline again, and the customer service representative kindly followed up on the status of the repair. Regrettably, I was informed that the earliest available timeslot to fix my boiler was on Monday (3/6) - a full 5 days after the initial breakdown.I am shocked and dismayed by this unacceptable delay. I should not have to wait nearly a week to have my boiler repaired, especially given that my whole family left without hot water for the entire duration. This is a wholly unsatisfactory level of service, and I had expected a much more prompt and efficient response from 247.I sincerely hope that the company will review its procedures and resource allocation to ensure that customers experiencing urgent issues can have their problems resolved in a timely manner. This experience has left me deeply dissatisfied, and I would strongly caution others against relying on this company's services based on my disappointing encounter.

Title: Nearly 3 weeks and issue remains
Review: It's now 1st June 2024 I been without hot water nearly 3 weeks and I've just received a phone call asking me to wait till the 6th June 2024 for the parts to arrive. I'm frustrated because I've been stressing an F28/29 code that keeps appearing on the boiler but for some reason the engineer cannot sort the problem out. When taking the policy out the agent reassure you that the engineer carry the parts with them in their van but this is not true they don't have parts they always have to order and by the time they get to you it takes 4 days+. Vulnerable people like myself have no other choice but to suffer like this. I have been neglected don't know how long I will have to cope with this.

Review: Pity I have to even give this company 1 star to write a review. Boiler service and CP12 certificate check booked 2 months ago for today, only to called this morning and informed that it has been cancelled. Day taken off work to be available for engineer as no specific time was given when they would arrive to carry out the checks. Total waste of time and money. If you would like a stress and hassle free experience please avoid this company.!! Since posting this review the company are now sending an engineer between the times of 1pm and 6pm today.! Further update, engineer arrived at 13.30.  Inspection carried out by competent engineer who was helpfull and considerate with tenant. Thank you to customer services for resolving this issue, but only after multiple phone calls.

Title: I took out a contract in December 2023…
Review: I took out a contract in December 2023 and when I contacted them to organise a boiler inspection in February I was offered a date in April. I had to cancel this (my husband actually died on that date) and I was offered a new date of 11th June 8am to 12noon. I phoned at 11am to advise no one had arrived and I had to go out at 12. I have now spent more than 20 minutes on the phones, talking to someone apparently in India, trying to organise a service before August and for a morning slot. Things have to drastically improve before I renew my contract. ( I now have an appointment 8 - 12 on 1st July - I wait with interest. )

Title: I tried booking an engineer on line…
Review: I tried booking an engineer on line first but I was just going round in circles on the site, so instead I used the phone number and got through very quickly to the call centre. The job was done within the hour and he told me and showed me the part he had to replace. However I need another visit as the problem has not been solved fully. So on a follow-up call I'm going to receive another appointment. I'm happy with the service as the operators are very helpful and will sort everything out for me.

Title: What a nightmare! Please be wary of the positives…
Review: Please be wary of the positives reviews. This is LONG! Unfortunately I fall under the “should be no star” reviews. I called today - 14.06.24 at 11:03. This was after trying to use the App which is rubbish, but now rather telling of this company as they are the same.  I tried to use the chat - luckily I got the number I needed from them of whom to contact. So… I put my heating on last night and on switching it off -E1 code came up. I topped up the pressure. Now the boiler is 11 years old but is still functioning. Today when I woke up at 6 am, I noticed the boiler pressure had dropped again to E1 and has since done x3 times in the space of 3 hours (after being topped up each time). My partner noticed the carpet in the hall was soaked and we noticed a leak from the radiator. We have made an attempt to turn off but there is water is dripping out and it is next to an electrical point. We have pulled back the carpet and underlay and the floor was soaked. We dried it off and have a dehumidifier set up.  This is relevant because once I managed to get through to someone at 24/7 I explained all this to them. They advised they could arrange a call out and that it would be a £95 call out fee. I accepted, paid and then got told that someone would be out tomorrow on 15.06.24 between 10-18:00 with a 30min call beforehand. I advised this was not suitable and what I was told,  as I would class this an an emergency - it’s an uncontainable leak!!! Plus the employee on the phone never indicated that it would be the next day on the call. The phone went silent and then there was a dead tone. I called back and got advised that 24/7 had no engineers available. Sorry - they do have engineers in the area but they are full. The also advised their policy is 24hours! So I explained they have until 11:03 on the 15.06.24 then! They couldn’t care less. I wouldn’t trust them to empty a bath let alone run one. I advised I would have to call a plumber as this is an emergency. They just kept sticking to to the “24 hour policy” jargon. I told them this pointless conversation was cutting into my time to get a plumber so they should cancel the call out and refund the payment. I was told this refund would be between 5-7 days. I ended the call and I found an emergency plumber which is now going to cost me over £200 for a call out but they will be here before 4pm today. During that call I noticed I had three voicemails from 247 - all very difficult to understand due to the background noice, but I did make out they wanted me to call back and confirm if I wanted the call to be cancelled and refunded. I called back and the person I spoke with said it had been cancelled and the refund would be 7-10 days! 3 people at 24/7 and it wasn’t sorted.  At this point - I wouldn’t trust them with being able to tell the difference between a bath and a shower! I pay £14.95 a month for this and now I am out of pocket and I have had zero service provided for.  24/7 rescue????? More like “how do you spell rescue”! Shocking company. And I better get refunded! I can’t want to not have to be with this company anymore. I may add that my per month amount went from £6.95 per month to £14.95 the next year and I didn’t get a service in my first year as they have no availability so the they didn’t provide the boiler check in the first year. And a little nod to 24/7 - no, before you ask… i won’t provide my policy number here as it goes against GDPR as I’m pretty sure you “won’t be able to find my details”…. Your gold standard response.

Title: 24/7 Home Rescue provided a terrible…
Review: 24/7 Home Rescue provided a terrible service. I had an electrical fault in my apartment where the lights and electrics were constantly tripping. I called out an electrician and paid a £75 callout fee. The electrician who arrived was not employed directly by 24/7 Home Rescue but was contracted by them. He did no work, claiming that the issue was not classified as an emergency, despite the fact that my apartment had no electricity. I complained to 24/7 Home Rescue, but they have not contacted me and have refused to refund my money. I had to pay £150 to another electrician who ultimately resolved the issue. Overall, it was an appalling job done by 24/7 Home Rescue. I would strongly advise against using their services.

Title: Terrible Cancellation Process
Review: I'm moving house so needed to cancel the policy. And low and behold there was no way to do this online. So I had to call up and sit on hold and wait for someone answer. The gentlemen on the other end of the phone proceeded to give me the hard sell about transfering my policy. When I told him I wasn't interested he then tried to get me to give him the contact details of the people moving in after we leave! After I rejected that as well he put me on hold to check "my cancellation process". Then after a long wait he then tried to say I needed to pay another month's cover for  "30 days notice" for a house I won't be living in. Super scummy process to cancel a boiler cover that was not very good to begin with. If you are considering getting cover from 247 Home Rescue I would STRONGLY advise against it. Terrible company.

Title: Booked a annual service through the…
Review: Booked a annual service through the insurance cover, engineer attended the appointment called me whilst he was at the property no notice given. Failed the emission test and stated the burner had gone and it needed a new burner my Ideal boiler which is just 10 years old. Was quoted to pay an extra £325 to fix a problem to which you think it would be covered by the breakdown cover I pay for monthly. Shocking customer service I was told to either pay or find someone else to fix the problem. I will not be renewing. Spread the word, these people are scamming customers and refusing to pay out on a broken boiler. I was told I couldn't use the boiler yet they wouldn't fix it.

Title: Peace of mind or lottery with a middleman?
Review: I was hesitant to post this review initially, but eventually posted as you might find some thoughts in here useful. I’m letting a few properties and have had an emergency cover contract with 247 for around 5 years, covering all let and my own property. During these5 years there have been 3 emergency cases altogether and 247 didn’t provide any emergency support with either: Saniflo systems aren’t covered (even in case of emergency), leaks must be visible and accessible (now I know track and trace excluded, but why don’t you state this in bold when advertising your peace of mind?), toilet blockages aren’t emergencies as long as there is another toilet in the building (regardless of the number of inhabitants), etc. The small print takes care of minimizing 247’s headache. Ultimately, now having gone through all of this – buying the emergency cover won’t provide you with so heavily promoted “peace of mind” whatsoever, instead, you acquire a lottery ticket with limited chances of getting help, ending up with even more hassle. Last case: electrics tripping across the ground floor, no domestic hot water, no shower, no fridge, food went off, plus the risk of fire (which was subsequently confirmed upon examination of one of the sockets). 247 couldn’t bring an electrician the day of logging the request, advised the tenant to expect an electrician next day 9am-7pm. Despite minors staying in the house. By 2 pm next day still no electrician and no updates. Long story short, given the risk of fire, the tenant arranged an electrician through myBuilder platform who turned up 30 mins after the call and did the job within 2 hours.Conclusion: 247 are just a middleman happily taking your money. No peace of mind, good looking on paper but in reality - very limited support with extremely poor turnaround time. I will not prolong my contracts with 247, or any other emergency company, instead, all the money saved will go into a savings bank account forming an “emergency fund”. If anything - myBuilder guys are always there and don’t hide behind the small print. This is the real peace of mind.PS: just read a nearly identical Trustpilot post, where a customer complained of 247's electrician not considering their electrics tripping as emergency. In their polite response 247 reassured this wouldn't happen again, what an irony 247. Very sad...

Title: No one could help me
Review: No one could help me with the beeps my new CM alarm had made when I walked in the house after a few days away. They kept tranferring me to another department and each time I had to repeat my name, email, and home address! They told me to phone the emergancy gas number who eventually turned boiler off, just to be on the safe side, but believed I had a faulty alarm! I spent ages getting through to the correct department again, for them to send out engineer to test and turn boiler on. I was asked 3 times to send the Transco report which I had sent on the first request, so that had been sitting somewhere with no progress while I (a priority customer was without heating and hot water for 3 days). They kept telling me it was a service (I had the service on the 4/6) I kept saying it was a test, check and turn on! The engineerarrived (thinking it was a service) but immediatly said it was a faulty alarm!!! Which had been sold to me on the 4/6 at the service! Everything was fine with the boiler and I now have a new Alarm.

Title: Here we go again DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY
Review: Here we go again. NEVER EVER USE THIS COMPANYMy previous review of 24|7 Home Rescue dated March 2024 is below. I have received a second further uninvited invitation in by email in 2 weeks to reactivate my account with them. I have unsubscribed from emails to no avail and I am extremely angry. I DO NOT WANT TO REACTIVATE MY ACCOUNT AND I DO NOT WANT TO RECEIVE ANY MORE EMAILS FROM THEM. Should I receive any further communication from this company I will immediately take the matter with the financial ombudsman. ARE YOU LISTENING 24|7. These people are a disgrace and I would urge anyone seeking boiler cover to seriously consider NOT USING 24|7. 7 Mar 2024DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES USE THIS COMPANYI am a cancelled boiler breakdown customer with 247 Home Rescue and recently ended the policy. DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES USE THIS COMPANY. After cancellation, they have regularly sent reactivation texts and emails which at first I ignored but then forwarded one such email to a scam email agency. After which 247 somehow managed to reactivate my account and set up a direct debit with my bank without authorisation. I have contacted 247 and they assured me the contacts will stop. It has not stopped. If it continues I will take the matter further starting with the Financial Ombudsman.Date of experience: 04 March 2024

Title: Buyer beware!
Review: Having taken out a contract for boiler servicing and repair almost a year ago, we tried with some difficulty to book our first service. We had provided details of our oil fuelled boiler at the outset, so were shocked to learn that this company will only service and repair gas boilers.  This is not made clear in any of their documentation, or at the time of purchase.  When we complained we were advised to check the small print on page seven, bullet point 3  where it states 'We aren’t able to cover any non-natural gas boiler'.The company sold us this policy despite being fully informed of our boiler type.The lack of clarity is misleading.  The consumer Rights Act 2015 states that 'key terms must be prominent and transparent'.We feel that this policy was mid sold as it was not suitable for our needs.

Title: Boiler Care plan with 247 - unreliable
Review: My experience with 247 has been bad. We have a "Boiler Care" plan with 247. We had run into water heating problems so booked an Engineer visit from 247HR with a call charge of 99.00.  We were informed that the Boiler ( 11yrs old ) was Beyond Economic Repair. Therefore offered us to1) Accept the quote for the required repairs ( 545.76) or2) New boiler installation or3) Approach 3rd party technicianWe booked a Bosch Engineer to also inspect the Boiler and he has reported that there are no problems with the Boiler and it is working as it should but there are external problems. It appears to me that 247 just want make us pay for repairs that are not genuine. I have spoken to their Customer care and have sent the Bosch Engineer report but they wouldn't respond.I wouldn't recommend anyone to 247 as they don't seem trustworthy and misleading.

Title: Cancelled my cover after 2 1/2 weeks

They refused to help me said that this was not covered in my policy, even though they could not point out where in the policy this was written. According to them, this was a maintenance issue. Was very unhappy with the service and ended up cancelling Even though I had already paid for a month of cover. The call centre seems to be based in India Where the staff constantly put you on hold to check with managers. Now I realise why the cover was so much cheaper than HomeServe and British Gas. It may be cheaper, but it’s not worth it. Stay Well clear.In response to their reply- they never gave me a reference number for the issue I had. I am happy for them to look at it further but I have now cancelled my policy with them but my policy number was WS659264. I’m not surprised they don’t have it on their system 🥱

Title: 24-Jul
Review: 24/7. Terrible. High excess fees, which would be the usual callout and charge for anyone else to do the required job. Their small print often excludes covering the job that you expect to be completed, but they will try their best to complete the job. Just disappointing customer service. Not good value for money and will try to force excessive price increases year-on-year with worse customer service each year. Renewal cost for year was £336!!! Wowser! And then you have to pay an excess on any call-outs of £75, really excessive excess! However, at the smallest sniff of leaving them, they’ll try and keep you by offering a price which is “apparently” competitive; it truly isn’t! Would NOT recommend. Additionally, when I cancelled my final DD, they attempted to cancel my contract, even though it still had over 2 weeks to run, which was in breach of the contract which had been setup. Not trustworthy. Definitely wouldn’t recommend.

Title: Brilliant Customer Care from 24/7 Home Rescue & Competitive Price Offer.
Review: I spent weeks looking for boiler home care provider that would be conducive to my Mother & myself, as we both have disabilities. I was with SES but, their services were taken over by Home Serve. I had a few issues with Home Serve customer services which I felt couldn’t be resolved & mainly, because the renewal contract price, which was extremely unaffordable for my Mother. I did take out a contract with a company called Your Repair but, I cancelled within a few days. They were not able to provide a service that would accommodate the disability needs for my Mother & myself. I then came across 24/7 Home Rescue & I had seen some excellent recommendations from Moneycheck & Heatingforce.I had also read about 24/7 Home Rescue & various reviews on Trust Pilot. I felt quite confident that I had found the right boiler home care provider. Whilst I was applying online to signup to 24/7 Home Rescue, I got a phone call from one of their customer service representatives, whose name is Ajmal. He had seen my online application & that I had used a promotional discount code. He said he could offer me a better offer.Ajmal was very polite & friendly & listened attentively to the problems that I had experienced with other providers. He was very empathetic towards the disability needs of my Mother & myself but, more concerned about by my Mother’s chronic multiple health issues. She is currently 87 years old & I am also her carer.Ajmal was so courteous & professional at his job & explained everything to me very clearly. He was so kind & patient & I felt that he understood my circumstances & what I was looking for. He provided me with an excellent monthly payment, saving me over £30 compared to my previous providers. After I had setup a new boiler contract with 24/7 Home Rescue, I received another phonecall from call from Ajmal, confirming that he had received all the necessary documents that he needed & confirming that a hard copy of my boiler care contract, would be sent by post, which I have received.I like to thank other customer care representatives who had also called me a few days ago, just to make sure that my Mother & I were happy with everything & I said that we were extremely happy. I can truly recommend 24/7 Home Rescue as a boiler care service provider & for the outstanding customer care that they had provided me.   Thank you

Title: Avoid this company at all costs! hidden charges
Review: I had protection through one of there policies. When I made a claim they always came out with charges in the fine print that were more than the actual repairs. I got a service done on my boiler at the very start and they then tried to charge me for repairs. When I showed this to the gas engineer as it was the same person who came back out to do a "repair" he couldn't understand the charges they were trying to bill me. They also threatened to cancel my policy if I didn't get them done. When I made a claim for a repair they then told me I would need to wait a week at least. I live in a city so found this unacceptable. Wasn't like I lived rural. They were constantly trying to charge me for repairs under my policy and didn't want to acknowledge some repairs. Their customer service is also a shambles. To avoid doing repairs they tried to offer me pennies to refund my policy to avoid doing repairs. I have calls which I made to the company on record of them trying to charge me hundreds of £ before a repair can be carried out. As insult, because I didn't auto renew I have been bombarded with emails and calls trying to get me to renew. Clearly just forgetting how they have treated a customer. PLEASE AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!! Happy to send on calls as a example of what people can expect from this company & emails that show what they tried to charge me during there annual service to help customers avoid paying ludicrous fees.

Title: Do not use this company - Boiler not working for 3 days!!!
Review: Do not use this company! 3 Days without hot water and we are still being told to wait as the case is being reviewed. We got insurance for our boiler just to make sure we were covered incase it stopped working or we had any issues. Our boiler started playing up and the hot water wasn't working so we reached out to them.When you contact them they tell you it can take 48 hours to find an engineer to visit the property so all you can do is wait. An engineer visited the property the next day and found the problem in 10 minutes but could not fix it (even though it was a small and easy job) because he needed to go back to the company to get permission for the work. Another 24 hours have passed and we still haven't had the work approved and its still being reviewed. It's now been 3 days without hot water and we are simply told to wait even though this is classed as an emergency not having hot water. We pay £20 a month for this cover but its a complete waste of money! Do not even consider using this company because they are completely USELESS. We will be cancelling our contract ASAP and finding another provider even if we have to pay more.  After complaining about this terrible experience I get a reply saying they don't have my details in the system when both my partner and I are on the policy. This proves exactly why you should stay away from this company! Complete rubbish.

Title: The engineer was quick and efficient.
Review: The engineer was quick, clean and tied up after himself. He gave clear explanation of what the problem was and what he had done to repair it. He also arranged a follow call by an advisor on an enquiry I made regarding new boilers. I was very pleased with the overall efficiency of the whole process.

Title: 4.5 weeks with no boiler,  hot water or central heating.
Review: I will never  ever recommend to anyone that they take out an insurance policy with 24/7 Home and Rescue. This company is utterly clueless and could not care less about its customers. 24/7 could not be a more inappropriate name.I took my complaint to the Financial Ombudsman Service on Jan. 2 and their service has been exemplary and a far cry from what we received from 24/7.On Wed. July 3 the FOS emailed me to tell me that they had completed their investigation and upheld my complaint. They instructed 24/7 to refund my excess and pay me an additional goodwill payment for all the inconvenience. On Thursday July 4 24/7 emailed me asking for my bank details. I replied the same day and the £ was in my account first thing Monday morning. 24/7 never did anything so quickly before.What pleases me as much as the settlement is the fact that 24/7’s handling of my complaint and the appalling way they handled it is all on the FOS records as well as Trust Pilot’s.The only reason I have rated 24/7 as 1 star  is solely because there is no star that is lower. I would have rated 24/7 as ZERO if that had been possible. Their customer service and care it non-existent.On Nov. 27 last year our 6 year old boiler broke down and it took until Dec. 27 before the problems were fixed. We were without hot water and central heating for 4.5 weeks and Christmas and Boxing Day were cancelled.In those 4.5 weeks we received 4 visits from 24/7’s appointed boiler engineering company and 3 from the boiler manufacturer. The latter  had to come 3 times due to the incompetence of the former and their last 2 visits I had to organise myself as 24/7 did nothing about it.1 	I hate to think how much time I wasted on phone calls and emails to 24/7 in those 4.5 weeks with endless hours waiting to speak to someone.2	It was impossible to speak to the same member of 24/7’s staff each time I phoned and that meant going through all the details every time I rang.3 	7 visits by engineers to fix a boiler only 6 years old is ludicrous and it was only due to the boiler manufacturer's engineers that the boiler was finally fixed on Dec. 27.4 	On Jan. 2 I sent a comprehensive diary on a day by day basis of everything that had happened in those 4.5 weeks to the FOS and the FOS never had to ask me for any more information.5	Prior to 4 above 24/7 had offered to reimburse my excess. I countered that saying that I would accept that if they paid for the new pump as a gesture of goodwill. They refused - hence my approach to the FOS.6 	24/7’s Ts and Cs indicate that they will offer customers in our situation portable heaters. The offer was never ever  forthcoming.The paragraph below is taken from reviews on TP  and is another 1 star only. It very aptly sums up their utter incompetence and "could not care less attitude". This is a “bog standard “ 24/7 reply to more than one 1 star only dissatisfied customer. 24/7 could not have summed up its busines acumen more accuraletly if it had tried. Talk about “shooting yourself in the foot”. What a bullseye that 24/7 cannot find the detailsl on their system!Reply from 247 Home Rescue4 days agoHi,We are sorry for this poor experience. We aim to deliver a great customer experience and, on this occasion, can see that we have let you down.We’ve tried to find your details in our system; unfortunately, we cannot find that information.Could you please share your reference number with us? This will enable us to investigate this further.Kind Regards,24/7 Home Rescue

Title: I am giving a 5/5 for the engineer who…
Review: I am giving a 5/5 for the engineer who recently serviced my boiler but reducing my score for the company itself.Firstly it’s 2024 and only offering people “between 8am and 6pm” is not acceptable any more.Secondly I’m sick of getting phone calls and emails all year.I can’t understand them from their call centre.In fact my boiler service was Monday afternoon and I’ve a ready had a phone call and two emails asking me for reviews.Please stop pestering me

Title: Very disappointed first experience
Review: I reported a blocked pipe in the kitchen and they sent a drainage engineer who couldn't handle it as the pipe was indoors, despite me telling them beforehand that it was inside. I was then charged £93 for a plumber to attend with "special" equipment and told I could have a refund if it wasn't used. Two days later a plumber arrived, but could not correct the problem saying the pipework was installed incorrectly when in fact a clip had simply come loose. He did not use any equipment. The company point blank refused to refund me, effectively calling me a liar, and apparently refusing to investigate further. i had the plumber's phone number so got him  to  contact 247 to confirm what I had told them. They offered a refund but no apology. I made a formal complaint and also obtained copies of my phone calls which their investigators showed no signs of having listened to. I was offered £30 compensation. In disgust I asked to cancel my policy, due to run for the rest of the year. They eventually agreed.

Title: Extremely disappointing Experience with…
Review: Extremely disappointing Experience with 24/7 Boiler CareI recently had an unfortunate encounter with 24/7 Boiler Care, and I feel compelled to share my experience. Despite paying for their 24/7 call-out service for this year as a cheaper alternative to British Gas, I encountered significant issues when I needed urgent assistance, I guess you get what you pay for, lesson learnt. After an engineer did his annual service, he advised me the PCB had blown, although it was serviceable before his visit. With no heating or hot water, I tried reaching out to them through various channels, but to no avail. The lack of responsiveness and absence of an apology left me frustrated and disappointed.When my boiler was serviced, it was found to be faulty. I expected the repairs to be covered under my policy, but I was informed that certain parts were not included, and it was not economic to repair, which meant a new boiler. This misalignment between what was promised and the actual coverage was disheartening.I strongly advise potential customers to carefully consider their options before choosing 24/7 Boiler Care. While some positive reviews exist, my personal experience has left me questioning the value of their service.There communication is non existent and I feel completely ripped off. They have offered to install a new boiler for a price. I THINK NOT!

Title: Avoid
Review: Update - I have now found out how 247 were never going to repair the boiler by using the term beyond economical repair. They gave a well below price of my boiler brand new and then stated it reduces in value by 10% each year. The insurance policy was therefore pointless and they need to provide much clearer information. If you have to claim good luck. Made a recent claim. Fully relaxed that the 247 insurance policy would cover the boiler defect. How wrong was I? We ended up paying the full repair price to 247 of £329 as well as the £75 excess.If your boiler is not brand new then pay a bit more and go with an honest repair company that doesn't harass you with the new boiler team and try to charge you £3000+. Also don't listen to these salespeople that harass you - they will say anything to try and get you to buy the new boiler (I'm hoping my recent calls are all recorded for the follow up complaint).

Title: I would be careful with this company…
Review: I would be careful with this company and read their terms and conditions before being tempted by cheaper qoute. I have been with them for the last 2 yrs and had no problems until they done last service and identified a 'risk' which didn't exist before whilst I was with them and quoted £336 repair costs. They said I am not covered for this as per t&Cs but the fault occurred whist i was covered and I didn't exist a year ago when last service was carriedout. They said its at risk of breaking but not broken enough to fix it but they issued a service noticed to say not safe to use but safe enough not to repair.. I would say its all good to pay for 'cover' and think you are covered until something breaks down. I would afford and go with a reputible business instead. My Account reference is ms581022. You can't say its not accurate.

Title: Very possibly the worst company ever…
Review: Very possibly the worst company ever had a boiler service booked for 19/7 took a days unpaid leave to make sure that I was at home for this.service engineer failed to show not a phone call from him even when I called 24/7 at 2:30 I was advised that the engineer would be on his way and would phone me 30 minutes before getting here still no-show called at 9 am following day and after an hour of being told different stories and being placed on hold one of the representatives had the audacity to tell me that they had turned up and I wasn't here at 11 am despite the fact I have a ring doorbell and every movement/piece of activity is recorded, there was nothing and not only was I here why was I not advised this at 2:30 when I calleddisgraceful service I have been paying £15 a month since I renewed my contract in February for absolutely nothingas they do not know how to provide a service just how to tell lies I have now cancel my contract will be going with a competitor. - do yourselves a favour and go anywhere but here Edit update for 24/7 benefit on 20/7 @12:30Here's your complaint reference detailsYour Complaint Reference Number: HR1110909

Title: Don't waste your time or money

I signed up to pay the £95 excess on call outs, and it has usually been a lower cost to get a tradesperson direct, after wasting time talking to a totally inept call centre. Now I don't even bother calling them, and certainly won't be renewing our cover on our properties.

Title: Poor Service and Lack of…
Review: Poor Service and Lack of Accountability.I recently had my boiler serviced, and the technician made some changes to the settings. Since the service, the radiators now automatically turning on whenever I switch on the hot water. This issue went unnoticed for eight days, during which time it resulted in unnecessary heating and increased energy bills.When I contacted customer service to address this problem, I was met with confusion and a lack of understanding. They repeatedly questioned how servicing the boiler could affect the radiators, despite my clear explanation of the changes that occurred immediately after the service. Not only did they fail to provide a solution, but they also refused to acknowledge that the issue was caused by the recent servicing.Overall, I'm extremely disappointed with the service and the customer support provided. The lack of accountability and willingness to resolve the issue is unacceptable. I would not recommend this company to anyone looking for reliable and professional service.

No updates from the company before the cancellation at all.I emailed my complaint and they called me today offering a pathetic £10 good will gesture! £10 for one day's holiday lost for an all-day appointment They couldn't care less that I waited in all day and used a day's holiday, just wanted to re-book the appointment.Policy cancelled ❌ If you want good reliable service do not bother with this cowboy outfit

Review: I really liked the engineer they sent, he was very skilled and solved the problem quickly. What I did not like and that needs improving:-More transparency on the call out fee. I was not aware of any when I signed. It must be in the small print, not sure.-The app design. It is really badly designed. It is hard to log in, hard to track and everything. Please invest some time and money into user experience. I should not need to remember my reference number every time I log in. Why not user and pass? Or fingerprint? -The time range they send you for the appointment is too large to plan. It is basically the whole day you need to be at home. Can you not plan a bit better?

Title: Be aware they won't be there when you…
Review: Be aware they won't be there when you need them in an emergency. I am having a very bad experience with this company. Have 9 policies with them.My car tyre got flat called them they said we don't cover roadside it was parked in car park.Secondly I have full boiler cover which include free boiler service and safety certificate and full repair so called them for the boiler was dripping water. The engineer went there and said it was not fully serviced.Well it was free service was included no one called me to book service.So they refused to repair it.3rd time I called them for a tumble dryer they took £30 excess after that refused to repair it by saying it was a non-economic repair.4 times I called them for a mains water emergency there was no water in the house my garden water stopper was broken and not releasing water. And guess? They said we don't cover mains water. I'm so frustrated with them why they don't clear on websites we don't cover these. Now even though they are not cancelling my policies and keep charging me by saying im in contact.So please stay away from this company 24/7 Home Rescue.Still waiting

Title: So happy to have an alternative to British Gas …
Review: Having had enough of paying for expensive homecare insurance with British Gas that provided me with nothing (everything is excluded if you actually need something done), I did some looking around for alternatives on the internet. The reviews of 247 Home Rescue were good and I was delighted to find out when I called them for a quote that my home insurance would cost less than half of what my British Gas insurance costed (for years), with no excess and additional coverage. The person I spoke to was incredibly helpful. I am very glad I changed to 247 Home Rescue.

Title: Contacted me to say my free boiler…
Review: Contacted me to say my free boiler service was due.  Booked the next available slot - some 5 months later.  Two days before my appointment I received an email for m 24/7 Home Rescue to say that "Due to unforeseen circumstances the appointment was cancelled.  Please re-book".  The next available date was, again, 5 months later.  Ten months after the original service was due.  Ended up booking a private engineer.  On trying to cancel the policy a £40 admin fee is payable.

Title: Consistently good service.
Review: Consistently good service from all points of contact, from phone, to engineer, to follow up call. Never had an issue, engineers are prompt, polite, and care. Nigel in this case was the embodiment of this and he's a credit to your company.

Title: Boiler service
Review: Boiler service was meant to be 25th  July an all day slot. Was told with less than a hour to go of the time slot given I had phone call off 24/7 saying engineer he had emergency so was a no show. I made complaint and  was given £10 refund has they contacted me once I complained that's all they would offer me but it ok when your not in and boiler man show up they can charge you up to £30 so don't seem very fair at all. My Year is nearly up end august and paid £19.99 a month not even had boiler service done yet, it is rebooked in but not hopeful. not very good service at all. Will look to go elsewhere after this experience worse I have had .The boiler service did get but i cancelled the renewal but since doing that they keep persistently calling me and I'm ignoring.

Title: Boiler Service let down
Review: Have a boiler service and repair contract with this company which ends on 19th August 2024.  However, have been experiencing problems getting a date for my due boiler service. Today is last straw. Was confirmed a week ago service to be done today 2/8/24.  After two texts this morning confirming engineer would be with me today I received a call 30 mins after the last confirmation text saying service would have to be rescheduled offering me a date in September which is just not acceptable as I am not renewing current contract on 19th August 2024 and September is not in this current contract.  This leaves me having paid upfront for a service with them that they seem unable to fulfil.

Title: Boiler service and Gas safety certificate
Review: Gas engineer visited the property for service and gas safety certificate on 29/07/2024. But no communication from 24/7 till today. Came to know from tenant that the engineer switch off the boiler saying that the boiler need replacement. Then I asked another gas safe engineer to attend the property as the tenant asked me sort this out. The other gas safe engineer told me that the engineer from 24/7 did not flush the system and thus he was not able to start the boiler. The boiler is running fine now and being serviced by other engineer with a gas safety certificate. Now I want 24/7 to pay the charges I paid to the other engineer to sort the issue for me.

Title: STAY WELL AWAY FROM THESE COWBOYS!!!
Review: Called you on the 25th July and you said on the call that after the service that you did 3 days prior that you were waiting for a part!! You told me that you have booked an appointment for the 6th August for the boiler and no one knows a thing about it!! The manager was supposed to call me today and no call just a disrespectful message again saying you called and actually nothing from you!!I will be chasing the Financial conduct Authority regarding your poor excuse to look after a customer and will getting a local real plumber to fix what you have broke and charge you for this!!You have no clue how to look after paying customers that put up with this even though your calls are recorded and NO ONE knows anything.Hard to believe that you constantly brush me aside even though we PAY you money every month for a service that you are NOT providing!! We will NOT be renewing our cover with you as this has happened WAY TO MANY times!!Sorry is a habit now and you guys can’t even book my faulty boiler in that you broke!!What are you going to do to rectify this?? Oh another pretend call from an imaginary manager or again IGNORE my requests and cause UPSET again!!!Your reply is pathetic!!Why lie?? You called me last night and said the manager called me twice yesterday and he or she did not!!

Title: 247 rescue a misnomer
Review: Leaking upstairs toilet. Was asked to expose the pipe myself and send them evidence as I have to diagnose where the leak is and expose it before they can fix it! I am not a plumber and have a recent slipped disc but apparently I will find that in the small print on the penultimate paragraph of page 16 of terms and conditions.After I did what they asked and sent pictures they said sorry it is past 6pm will have to be tomorrow. Tomorrow came went and 6 phone calls later they said we did not receive my email. That is after they had confirmed they had. Two days later I am still chasing them as after locating my email they said the leak is not too visible on the pictures. Shocking company. False promises based on made up excuses.Will report to regulator as even trying to file a complaint with their manager the line got "disconnected" and did not call back.

Title: I’ve been without hot water for over a…
Review: I’ve been without hot water for over a week they came 3 days ago checked boiler they told me they needed to order a part to be fitted today waited all day to receive a phone call at 4 telling me they had no engineer available and to rebook for next week. As a disabled person what am I supposed to do. don’t trust home emergency 24/7 !!! Please bear in mind that the majority of the good reviews are for a boiler service I’ve had no problem with the boiler service but wait until you actually need them in a emergency then you will see the real service I’ve been with them for 4 yrs and it’s only now when I actually need help that I find them useless they have offered me £30 compensation I don’t want the money I need hot water.Update from 24/7 they want schedule an engineer for next week problem is I’m in hospital having surgery then I’ll probably be stuck in hospital because there is no hot water in the house making it uninhabitable but they are very sorry 😂oh and they offer to refund my £95 call out fee and he’s escalating my case I’ll get a response to that in 24 to 48hrs he’s going to make a note that I may not be able to answer due to anaesthetic 😂

Title: Terrible service
Review: An engineer was sent to my property, who diagnosed that the boiler required a replacement pump motor and pump housing kit. I have been without hot water for nearly a week now because they keep dragging the days on , Additionally, I was sent an email with a quote for the repair, stating I would have to pay £250 out of pocket, despite my policy having a £0 excess. Title: Avoid this company
Review: I hope someone is fortunate enough to read this review. I’ve been a long-time customer of British Gas and HomeServe, and there's simply no comparison between them and this company. Trustpilot reviews may not reflect the true experience. This company asks for 5-star feedback after a pleasant conversation, but that’s before you actually need to make a claim or request a repair.Compared to industry standards set by companies like British Gas, this company falls short. While I’ve had my frustrations with British Gas, 24/7 Home Rescue is an outright nightmare. My tenant experienced a leak, and while British Gas had no issues with handling repairs directly, 24/7 Home Rescue created endless obstacles. They don't allow tenants to arrange repairs directly, dragging out the process to the point where my tenant was left stranded while I was on holiday.In contrast, British Gas once promptly repaired a leak under the bath without any fuss. But with 24/7 Home Rescue, they insisted we identify the source of the leak ourselves, asking us to open panels and send them videos. How are tenants or students supposed to do that, especially when the landlord lives two hours away? After endless discussions and phone calls, they never even showed up.When I requested a refund for the 10-11 months we had already paid, they flatly refused. Consider yourself lucky if you see this review and avoid this company at all costs. This nightmare happened 10 months ago, and I’m still appalled by their service.

Title: Watch out "Unlimited Call Outs" but they are not
Review: I had a home care policy from 247 Home Rescue with an excess claim of £95 and “Unlimited Call Outs.” When I experienced a water leak, I contacted customer service and was asked to pay £95 for an engineer visit. Additionally, the engineer was not available immediately, with a wait time of 2-3 days and no guarantee of availability. This policy is misleading; it is not truly “Unlimited Call Outs” as it depends on the specific policy. The company, “Home Rescue,” did not provide the help I needed. They seem more focused on making money than on customer care. I wouldn’t recommend them as they play around with words and provide poor customer service.

Title: Terrible customer service, aweful company
Review: Terrible customer service. They broke my boiler during a routine service. Didn't arrange a return visit and after 8 weeks I tried to cancel my contract. They contacted my bank to reinstate my direct debit.  Transferred me to 5 different people, wanted to charge £75 to revisit to put their mistake right and hidden clauses meant I had to pay a huge cancellation fee.Don't believe it when they say it's a rolling contract. They are con artists hiding behind " terms and conditions "Further update following your response. I have spent hours on the phone over the last few days to managers in your complaints teams. No resolution was found you insist on me paying a cancellation fee following you breaking my boiler during a routine service. Your comment here has no value. I have given you hours of my time and you have not budged on a cancellation charge after having been a customer for over 6 years. I will be referring this matter to the insurance ombudsman once I receive your email confirming you won't cancel my policy without a hidden terms and conditions charge.

Title: This company needs to rethink EVERYTHING…
Review: This company needs to rethink its whole philosophy and what they stand for, and have stated they can do for customers. It's all a complete fabrication. No great customer services. Can't understand most of them as they have staff not in UK!! cheap staff payroll I guess!.. and if you complain they don't listen, and have pre written decisions which tell you that you'll never win or get your money's worth, OR A FAIR DECISION, and then they want to charge you large amounts of money for the whole year worth if you ask to leave because you are not impressed or happy with their poor shoddy treatment. I wish I'd stayed with British Gas Home Care. Guys!... cheaper is not always better. Lesson!They say they cannot move a 'close to the wall' toilet in order to stop the water from constantly flushing. They sent 3 different 'engineers' to my house - and then each time they state that you have to wait in ALL DAY 8-6pm for them to visit (Even British Gas have sorted themselves out and will give you a window of when they will call... who has time to wait in all day for a silly engineer, when we are all so busy?) and if you miss the appointment they will charge you £30 for the pleasure!!. The 1st man just came and wandered around my house and didn't even attempt to flush the toilet to see why it was leaking. He reported the job was 'COMPLETE'! The 2nd man was much better and he said in his report that the TOILET NEEDS TO BE MOVED FORWARD to get to the rubber washer behind to sort out the issue.... SO THE COMPANY KNEW THIS .. so why did they then insist on sending another man a few days later to 'LOOK' at my toilet... He then said that the toilet needs to be moved forward to get the washer... 24/7 said he shouldn't do this - even though he was a qualified plumber and had all the tools and replacement parts in his van and the experience to do this. THEN  THEY WANTED TO CHARGE ME £93 so they could move the toilet forwards. TALK ABOUT A SCAMMMMMM!!! THEY 'UPSELL' their services and things that should have been inclusive in getting the job done in such a shocking barefaced manner.BUYER BEWARE. I am a real life customer and I am tied into this company for the next 10 months and I won't be using them ... but they will still get my money by direct debit MONTHLY.Hey 24/7 NOT SO home care. I am really disappointed in your sales and your customer services. You sold me a damp squib. I need to be allowed to leave your company with NO false charges as you are not going to do my work, and will probably blacklist me as I have spoken out. But the truth needs to be told - so other vulnerable customers don't lose their hard earned cash coming to you. I've been a British Gas Home Care customer for many years, but thought cheaper was better. DON'T DO IT. its not better. Go direct to British Gas Homecare .. all the other startups are simply fakes and cant even live up to their standards with better staff and better customer services as BGH. I need the truth to be told. They have trumped up that i said this and that just to validate their refusal to let me leave and to refuse my complaint. So I have used my voice here to warn other customers of the issues Ive been left to deal with at the hands of this company. I BET IM NOT THE ONLY ONE TO SPEAK OUT WITH THIS COMPANY. But we know we can get 'great' reviews!!!Your response that the complaints dept. will get back to me... They already did. That's why I had to voice my honest and open review on here...This is what they said... 'We therefore are unable to waive your cancellation fee of £140 and maintain our position to repair your toilet if you are happy to pay for your toilet removal in the sum of £96.Please note that, under terms of our Complaints Procedure, this is our final response.'Its your final response... So this is my evidence for people to see.

Title: Our experience with 247 Home Rescue was…
Review: Our experience with 247 Home Rescue was great. Our boiler of 21 years stopped working. We called 247 who, after checking there wasn't any very young, elderly or vulnerable people at the address organised for an engineer to call. He rang when he was half an hour away and he tried to repair the boiler without success.  He told me the options and we decided to have a new boiler fitted by 247. The engineer came prompt at 8.a.m. a day later. He was very friendly, respectful and professional . He explained what he was needing to do and made sure I knew when the water was being turned off and on. He completed the work, cleaned up checked the boiler worked correctly and talked me through the controls. A very positive experience using 247 from first contact. Would highly recommend.

Title: Review.
Review: Yeah, they seem to know what they're doing. Which is nice.

Title: Great service from the engineer
Review: I’ve had the plan since December, I’ve not needed an emergency call out but recently booked my annual service. The engineer kept me informed of his estimated arrival and was very friendly when he arrived. he serviced the boiler and gave me feedback about how good condition my boiler was in for its age (11 years). He did say that I’d receive a report of the service that I haven’t received yet (2 days later) so not sure what’s happened to that?? One thing I wasn’t happy with is a call I got the week before my service trying to upsell a central heating inhibitor (at a cost of £40!),  very hard sell on the phone, basically telling me that my system needed it otherwise my boiler could breakdown but I’ve never had to pay for it when British Gas serviced my boiler for the last decade so why do I need to pay for it now? I have a magnetic filter on my boiler which cleans the rubbish out and the engineer said when he finished how clean my system was so don’t feel pressured into paying extra for it if you also have a filter fitted. My response to the upsell call was if it’s needed as part of the service it should be included as part of the service so I’m not paying for it.. Other than the annoying upsell I couldn’t fault the service I received from the engineer and would highly recommend 247 for boiler cover…

Title: Great service but attempted upsell annoying
Review: I’ve had the plan with 247 since December 2023, I’ve not had to call them out for an emergency but recently booked an annual service. The engineer called me giving me an update of his arrival which was helpful and when he arrived he was very chatty and friendly. He serviced my boiler well and remarked that for its age it’s in great condition (11 years old). He did say that I would receive my service report (I thought by email) but I haven’t received anything (2 days later) so not sure what’s happened to that??? One thing that annoyed me was the call I received a week before, I assume from some sales team, trying to upsell me some central heating inhibitor (at a cost of £40!). The caller tried to scare me into getting the inhibitor saying that the boiler needed it otherwise it could breakdown but British Gas had serviced my boiler for the last decade and have never charged me for this, nor was it listed on my service paperwork, so I told the caller that if it’s needed as part of the service it should be included as part of the service so I’m not paying for it. My boiler has a magnetic filter fitted to it which clears the rubbish out of the system and the engineer remarked that my system was very clean so I took that as confirmation that I didn’t need to spend the extra money for the added chemicals. Other than the annoying attempted upsell I had a great experience with the service of the boiler and I couldn’t fault the engineer…

This company may appear good value but leave at your peril, pressure selling at a new level. As my policy is cancelled I can’t access my account to unsubscribe from mailing and marketing list. Look at other reviews not just the 5* reviews written after a annual boiler service.

Title: Frustrating back office system
Review: The engineer was great although I was surprised at how short the visit was.  The three star rating is given to reflect the inflexible back office system which only allows the engineer to call to give an arrival time once the previous job had been finished.  The boiler belongs to a 91 year old and I live an hours drive away and cannot wait at his house from 8am to 6pm, although on the day this expected time was reduced to 12 to 6pm.  All I wanted was to be given an hour’s notice of anticipated arrival time.The other frustrating thing is being asked to give feedback for a third time, after already being asked for - and given - feedback by text and telephone.PC645025   Job ID:1215464

Title: Not worth the money you pay for this…
Review: Not worth the money you pay for this service. 247 hire a set of cowboy third party service providers and 4 of 5 times ensure they flag your boiler as risk. They would not honour your claim if an issue is identified at the time of boiler service even through your plan clearly mention all labour and parts covered. You are better off hiring a local gas engineer who would do a better job. I have remediation team who are happy to provide additional quotes by not render a proper service. I would strongly advise you stay away from this company. I have had a manager call me chewing her lunch in midst of being pre-occupied with another perhaps personal tasks to pay much attention to what I was saying. So much for customer service.

Title: Change of service provider
Review: 50 years plus as a customer of British Gas I was surprised on Sunday to receive my annual service renewal document which showed an increase of circa 30%. I phoned to see if there had been a mistake, but to no avail, apparently whilst I thought that I had not made use of the repair facility for 3 years, during the last routine service lubrication of a hive switch (less than a minute) constituted a callout. So sadly I cancelled the product.I searched the internet for a new provider at 77 years of age I was fearful that I had made a hasty decision however the price being asked left me no alternative. I need not of worried as I soon found Home Rescue, their site clearly set out a comparison with many other providers. Further documents clearly explained what was and what was not included in the package. So spoke over the telephone with a very friendly agent who was both knowledgeable, professional and above all humanistic. After answering some simple questions I signed up for home heating and kitchen appliance cover and was pleased to be offered a further 10% discount on the quoted price. (The welcome letter and terms and condition document arrived immediately by email as promised) So I end up paying less than currently let alone the 30% increase requested by BG. With the set up service offered by Home Rescue all my fears have been put to rest. So far seems a very professional organization, so as a pensioner (entered on their priority service schedule without any prompt from me) I have peace of mind for another year. Need not of worried should have changed supplier sooner.

Title: Incompetent, lies and misdirection DONT!
Review: Bought the policy a month ago and arranged the boiler service as per my policy. Their customer service told me to expect the engineer between 8-12. At 07:30 24/7 messaged to say the service was booked but they couldn't specify a time! I waited in hope that the engineer would arrive but at 11:30 24/7 messaged to say the service would now happen between 12-18:00 so again I wait and wait. At 16:00 I get a call from Rachel Vixen who works out of a call centre in Pakistan to tell me the service would now need to be rescheduled. I have told her I want to cancel my policy and have whatever has been paid refunded. If I had a home emergency and this was what I could expect in an emergency then it fall short of what is expected both as a customer and as a business. Someone is supposed to be calling me by the end of today but I strongly doubt they will. Do yourself a favour and DON'T choose 24/7 for anything you may depend or rely on. I've experienced nothing but incompetence, inefficiency and chaos. This isn't what anyone wants AVOID these as it's nothing more than a SCAM. I've been offered nothing but lies, misdirection and this whole thing is nothing but a waste of money!

Title: Cheap isn’t the best
Review: Avoid. Guy came to conduct annual service. Parked in private space outside wrong property- not a great start. Conducted service ruined my washing up bowl with a greasy black liquid he said came from draining boiler, however I have a cylinder also so draining should not be done how he did it. He shouted to say all done, I noticed the boiler was leaking water he said it was excess from his work ( no attempt to clean it ) he then left. My service record book was saturated in water and now ruined. The boiler was buzzing and smelt of burning. Within an hour the boiler was totally dead. Called to complain, call centre was awful and now Im told I have to wait another 24 hours for a call back. YOU WOULD NEVER have this awful service from British Gas you certainly get what you pay for. Uodate: you called me today to confirm my complaint and said someone would call to arrange a return visit of an engineer a a priority - no call received but had text to say to call you, I called on the number provided the person who took the call had no record of anything - I suggested they found out and called me back. STILL no call back from you it seems poor service runs throughout your business.
