Title: Incompetent service
Review: Incompetent service, liars and cheats. Customer care who arrange the visit and the service personnel are both incompetent and plain liars. I reported no hot water in my property. The pathetic service started there. Customer service keep you on phone for hours. There was a person called Hamza who is incompetent, takes very long to understand and respond to the most basic queries. Customer service is in some offshore location. He even called me at 7am in the morning. They should at least know to be mindful of the timezone of the country they work for. I asked them for a complaints process. They don't have a proper response to that. The technician said the valve for hot water is gone and needs replacement. He said he was putting that on his notes. As it turns out he lied to my face and his report apparently says he has fixed the problem. He did a manual override just as a temporary solution so we have hot water. That's no way to fix an issue. Now 247 want me to raise another request and charge me another call out fee. I have spent hours explaining to mindless people why it's not acceptable, but to no avail. And this has been ongoing for over a week now. In their policy they say they will deal with issues arising from visits withiin 14 days for free. This must be their tactic to stall so they charge callout fees again. I have been promised a call from someone in UK. I am hoping to get a call soon and to speak to someone sensible.

Title: 24/7 Home Rescue Boiler Fault
Review: On Sunday 25 August 2024, Following the use of our shower, we suffered a total loss of power in the house. An electrician attributed it to our Boiler.On Monday, we asked for help from 24/7, our insurer, paid £75 for a boiler engineer call-out. He was absolutely useless and confirmed there was a problem of “reverse polarity”and added this to his call sheet.He then said that we need another engineer! We paid another £45 for an engineer for a callout, but he opted to call us on FaceTime to view the Boiler. He then said he would call the Insurer to request a Plumber for us on Saturday but we have never received the call? A further call to company today, Saturday, confirmed no action before Monday, and another charge of £45. I am now arranging for a private Valiant technician to call. As far as 24/7 are concerned, a letter regarding a claim or legal action is my next .  I Would not recommend this company because some of their staff work from home/office and there is background noise. We are pensioners aged 82 and have had no hot water or shower facilities since Sunday 25 August, and have to carry a kettle of hot water upstairs, when needed! We are also both DISABLED!Today, Wednesday, we were asked to call you the claims line. The first person I spoke with could offer us a service in October and there would be another charge. We rejected this offer. Later we received another call and this time an engineer will be coming to our home for a service on Wednesday.Very pleased to say that 24/7 pulled out all the STOPS on Tuesday by sending us a professional engineer who quickly identified three problems requiring replacements. The boiler was then written off and we received vouchers for £495 towards a new boiler if  provided by 24/7. The company are also going to refund the £75 and £45 charges.

Title: Unfortunately I have to write a…
Review: Unfortunately I have to write a negative review. My boiler was working fine until the engineer came to do the annual service last week. I have been with 247 for a while now and they have always been really good up until this point. The following morning I woke up to all the radiators being on full blast upstairs even though the heating was turned off. I double checked the thermostat and my cosy system and hoped it was just a blip. The following morning the same thing happened. I called the service centre as I have a service plan. The same engineer came out and said I needed a diverter valve. I received a call from 247 to say that I needed to pay £95 excess plus £108 for a system drain down. As you can imagine I was not happy as everything had been fine before the service. I then asked my partner to have a quick look. The electric motor for the diverter valve had been removed and once this was put in place everything was working well again. I complained and said I wanted to cancel my policy as I have absolutely no faith in the company. They carried out a service and left it not working properly. They said if I wanted to cancel the policy I would have to pay £84!  I am not happy about this as their service, which caused the issue, could have cost me over £200 for something that did not need doing.

Title: I would avoid
Review: Until my renewal date I would have gave a higher rating but this is definitely the worse company I have had to deal with when it comes to a renewal. Firstly they tried to hike my monthly payment to £16.47 from £5.49, I know this is common practice but in the renewal email it stated "If you have an increase, this may be due to a claim you made or because your cover may include a boiler which is now older than the age thresholds of 6 or 11 years, when boilers often need more repairs" my problem is my boiler is 2 years old and I have never claimed, the only service i have used was a boiler service which is included.So because of this I ring them to cancel as I can get the same cover for around £6-£7. I speak to a man for a few mins and he tells me he can drop the cover to £12.99, I politely refuse and ask to cancel. He then puts me on hold to speak to his supervisor. When he comes back he tells me he can drop it to £10.99, I politely refuse and ask to cancel to which he puts me on hold again then comes back and says he can drop it to £8.99. at this point I'm getting a little annoyed and telling him I'm finding it hard to stay polite because you are not listening to me, I just wanted to cancel the damn thing. He says ok I will proceed with the cancellation and puts me on hold again. He comes back and says my supervisor has said I can drop the cover to £7.99 but the cover won't be as comprehensive. At this point I'm pretty annoyed and I get a bit more annoyed with him. I tell him to cancel it and he says ok I will proceed with the cancellation and puts me on hold again. He comes back and says that he's about to cancel but his supervisor has said he can drop it to £7.99 for the same cover. I told him that if he would have offered me this in the first place I probably would have said yes to save me having to switch covers but after all this Im definitely cancelling. I was pretty annoyed when I said this so he finally cancelled. This process to around 30mins when it should have took 5. My advise would be don't be drawn in by there low price for the first year as they will hike it more than 200% for the second year and make it really hard for you to leave. As you can see by my review they did not need to hike it that high but they do it hoping you will just take it. Just another Extortionate insurance company.

Title: Excellent service and well worth the…

Title: dont fall for their cheap deal
Review: My annual boiler service was today. The engineer who attended  actually sound more like a salesperson rather than an engineer. He failed   to  check the  Flue terminal inspection ,Gas pressure & flow setting ,and investigates  gas pressure and flow settings. he was on about what about a new boiler and he can do it privately if needed. I find out that very unprofessional and very uncharacter. since them I had  more that 3 call from your company  and a few email about  new quote for a boiler.On top of that they advice me that they  cant  help me and expect me to pay the monthly fee. what a rip off company... advice people not to fall  for their cheap  deal.

Title: If you have an oldish boiler or otherwise, do not use this company
Review: If you have an oldish boiler, or not, do not give this business your custom! Policy auto renewed, thinking I would be covered if anything went wrong. So, fault code showed on boiler requiring £95 call out which has to be paid immediately. After a week, usual sub contractor showed up late in the day, stating after 30 seconds of cover being off boiler that a new fan would be required. Thinking he would return after a couple of days with the part, a week elapsed. Contacting call centre, I was informed that owing to my boiler being 15 years old it was valued at £205.89 and therefore written off as the part and labour was in excess of £450.I was informed that boilers depreciate by 10% a year and everything is covered in the T&C’s. Obviously if I had been informed at the beginning of contract this year that my lovely boiler was effectively worthless, I would not have renewed as any job would be more than the boiler is worth. Very disappointed with customer service, monthly DD and £95 call out was money down the drain! Do not entertain 247 Home Rescue with your custom.

Title: Absolutely appalling service
Review: Absolutely appalling service; I had limited hot water before a boiler service. During the service I was told I needed parts replacing and that a job had been logged and to expect someone to be in touch to change the parts. Since the service I have no hot water, I have called everyday for the past 8 days and each time promised someone would call me back... they don’t. Each person I speak to I get a different story and telling me they will log or continue processing a claim. Not sure what I pay for monthly if they think 8 days+ is acceptable to be without hot water or any communication. Edit: The fact you can reply to your Trustpilot reviews straight away but still not have called me or sorted out my hot water says everything.

After the engineer had finished, he spent 2 hours on the phone outside, so they don't seem to be overloaded or overbooked.An independent engineer said that the boiler had not been serviced properly - no wonder as 247 people only run safety checks and clean the condenser. Their aim is to condemn your boiler and persuade you to buy a new one from them.

A few minute back I received the text that boiler service is cancelled again this year.Since I am within the 14 days of cooling period. I am not ready to go through rebooking hassle again. I am cancelling my contract with 247. Better to avoid 247.Not sure how they have 4+ rating on trust pilot?

Title: Awful experience avoid at all costs
Review: Awful experience and would avoid at all costs. Numerous phone calls to the hotline to try and arrange an appointment, missed visits asking tenants to wait in all day. Being lied to over the phone about the reported issues and when the engineers finally did arrive diagnosing the issue they didnt report it back to the office so the whole process started again. Save your money for when the break downs that do happen and arrange a trusted tradesman. First registered the issue at our property on the 14/05/2024 the matter was finally resolved on the 09/08/2024. Imagine the time spent over almost 3 months to try and resolve this issue. “24/7 home rescue” is nothing more than a brand name.When we cancelled the membership due to poor service we still had to pay a number of months to remove ourselves from the contract. Even then its not worth the hassle of trying to arrange an appointment and request a refund with this tragic company. Now we’ve finally managed to cancel we receive repeated emails with discount codes and recieved 15% off to re-join. You couldnt pay us enough to sign up.

Title: Poor Service
Review: I hve been a customer of this company for over 5 years but had not called them in an emergency. They are called 24/7 Home Rescue but what is not made clear is that it is the call centre and online logging that is 24/7 but they can take up to 48 hours to arrange an appointment. I had an electrical problem very early on a Sunday morning and I had no working electrical sockets in my house. I logged the call on line. Two hours later I called the company and was told they are trying to get an engineer to me. Two hours later I called again as by now my phone was losing charge, I had no means of cooking or boiling a kettle. I am an elderly widow who lives on her own. I was never asked if  I had means of heating, cooking etc. I was told 'it is a Sunday you know' and they would not be able to get an engineer out. I organised my own electrician that day who resolved the fault. I complained to the company about the service and received a very condescending email reply saying that they could have offered me an appointment for the Tuesday but I had already resolved the issue. I would have been without any electrical appliances for 2.5 days at that point. I was offered a refund of one months premium but this offer was withdrawn when I said I wanted to cancel my policy.  I can understand that emergencies have to be prioritised but I was left with no electrical appliances, no landline phone (as linked to the broadband) and a flat battery on my mobile phone. Very disappointed by their lack of any care for their vulnerable clients.

Title: This is a truly dreadful company
Review: This is a truly dreadful company. I have just spent an hour on the phone to ask why none of my emails have been answered and why they continue to reinstate and collect the direct debit after my wife and I cancelled the policy back in May. Two engineers came out to service our boiler, which was working fine, and condemned it, stating that the flu had been installed incorrectly. The boiler had been fitted by a Corgi registered heating engineer and serviced regularly for 6 years. As soon as the engineers left the boiler stopped working. I noticed that the water sensor had been removed and left on the washing machine. We were left without heating and water for two days and had to get another heating engineer out to fix the boiler that had been broken by 24/7 'engineers'. This engineer also stated that the flu was fine and installed correctly. My wife and I have sent numerous emails, none of which have been relied to and have just been told on the phone that it will cost us over £80.00 to cancel the policy. A more cynical person might think  this company condemns boilers to install new ones. A truly appalling experience. Do not use.

He can cut the back wire gas and not the main pipe on the wall which make it incredible unfair. After paying extra to the installer of curry's for my new cooker, he was unable to resolve the issue since he stated that cutting the pipe on the wall isn't right because it's already cut at the back connection..I rang the 24/7 to fix back what they've done oh they're not bothered because I immediately cancelled my insurance to them beginning 6th of October because they just took money from me this month. I think some engineers at 24/7 were just ungrateful and racist if your Asian.

Title: Do not ever use this company
Review: Do not ever use this company. We never had any issues with our previous boiler. A repair to the flue was recommended and as our boiler was getting on we were advised it would be best to put this towards a new boiler. Stupidly we listened to their advice.They did not inspect our pipe work properly and fit a boiler where we have consistently been left without heating and hot water over the last year. Forced us to spend £599 on a power flush we didn’t need; although later refunded when they admitted they were wrong. Won’t put the correct pipe work in place. Now state we have to be left without heating and hot water until our bathroom is completed despite the same error code occurring as before we started this work. They could not even tell us they wouldn’t be attending until I called them to chase this up. Still waiting for a call back from a manager to make a complaint. We have had 11 visits this year alone which has impacted our work as we had to take time off. We just want a working boiler but don’t think they will ever be able to supply this to us. We will be taking this complaint to the finance company and the Financial Ombudsman to try and get our money back so we can get a boiler fitted by someone who knows what they are doing.

Title: Better suppliers around
Review: Unlike other home cover companies you are required to pay the call out charge before the call centre will book your appointment. It then takes them up to 48 hours to book someone in. The only time slot you will be given is 8am- 6pm with the engineer giving you a 30 min eta, anytime during that window. With our last supplier you paid the call out fee when booking the engineer slot which was a 4 hr window rather than 10!The engineer was ok and fixed the issue but did leave a bit of mess. It seems worth paying a bit more for one of the other companies.

Title: Speedy efficient service
Review: After contacting 247 an engineer was scheduled for the following day. I received a call from him about 9.00am and he arrived 45 minutes later. After assessing the problem he duly arranged for an order to be placed for a replacement part with the local Wolseley plumber. Once done he collected the new part ,returned and fitted it. Couldn't ask for more

Title: Robotic, non-tailored processes
Review: I took out 2 policies with 24/7 because the prices were competitive and the sign-up process on-line quick and straightforward. However, since cancelling both policies after the tenants took over my insurance on one property, and the other property was sold, I have felt absolutely inundated with texts and emails urging me to reinstate the policies. Even when I rang up to explain the cancellations, I again had to listen to a standard script about “being left without boiler cover.” It just seems to be a robotic one size fits all process and I wouldn’t use this company again based on my experience. The cancellation costs were also high.

Title: This is a follow up to my last review of September 12
Review: This is a follow up to my last review which highlighted the appalling gas boiler service from this company. Having been promised an appointment for September 12 when the engineer failed to turn up - for the second time - I posted a critical review which drew the usual response apologising and saying they were looking into it.I also however got a promise that an engineer would be with me at some point during the day on September 13. Having waited in all day for this to happen, nothing did - there was no communication, no phone call nor e mail and 48 hours on still no contact.I have written to them today and assume they will respond at some point offering yet another date requiring us to stay in the whole of that day. I have no confidence in this company’s promises and strongly advise anyone thinking about using their services not to proceed as they clearly do not deliver for their customers even on the routine tasks such as boiler services so how on earth can they help in an emergency situation.

Title: home care cover trap, be aware

Don't buy their home care cover for electric , it is purely covering nothing unless everything is completely loss power ( by the way if that is the case, your main electric box is not covered as well). i had British gas cover before, their electric covers all switches and socket, not 247.

Title: Warning
Review: Warning: if you have a policy with this so called company, please please cancel it and run away because they will put you in an extremely dangerous situation like they did to me.i have a policy with them (POLICY NUMBER: WS639316).I have a nearly new boiler with no issues at all.i had a call from them saying they will send an engineer to do annual service to my boiler.they sent someone who looks like if he was drunk, he had a screw driver in his hand, he went to the boiler and pushed his screwdriver inside the isolating  valve and damaged it, suddenly the gas was all over the place, the guy was panicking and didnt know what to do stop the gas from causing an explosion . he then run to the gas supply outside the house and turned it of and he unscrewed the big pipe that supply the gas to the meter and removed the gasket and left everything like that and left the house.one of our Neighbours saw the box where the meter and gas supply was open and he told me and went out and i saw a wire disconnected, i called a local engineer and he came, checked the gas supply and found the pipe that pass the gas is disconnected and he told me: what the hell is happening, that could easily cause an explosion and destroy the whole street. he then put it back where it should be.and we called an other engineer to fix the valve that was damaged by the insurance engineer ( WE PAID £360),We called the insurance company more than 50 times and non of them was interested.we spoke to Diana, Tayyaba( technical manager), CAN YOU BELEIVE we spoke to someone called Rachel Fernands  (customer resolution) and she told us: I DONT CARE, GO TO HELLwe are now taking legal action and we informed BBC and the gas safety department.AND WE WILL NOT SLEEP UNTIL JUSTICE IS DONE AND THIS COMPANY SHUT DOWN AND RESPONSABLES GO BEHIND BARS

Title: Please please don't buy a policy from…
Review: Please please don't buy a policy from this company and if you have one, cancel it now if you want to be safe.Here is what they did to me:I have a policy with them for my boiler which is nearly new.They asked someone to do an annual service to my boiler. This person came to my house drunk and he went to my nearly new boiler and damaged it with his screwdriver. Then he came to me saying: iam so sorry I accidentally damaged your boiler and he disconnected the gas from the house and left our family without gas.When I spoke to this company, they told me that's your problem and there's nothing we can do.So they damaged my boiler and told me to go away. Now I have to find £4700 for a new boiler from British gasAnd the biggest joke is that they damaged my boiler that cost more than £4000 and they offered me £30 compensation

Title: This is the worst company to insure…
Review: This is the worst company to insure with. It seems like they use the insurance as a way to extort more money out of you. Telling you to make unnecessary and expensive repairs before they will come and fix any issue. The engineers they use appear to be incompetent as well, as they dont even fix the issue they were called for but claim they have. Then say in our terms and conditions if we identify any issues you need to pay for them before we repair anything as part of the insurance.Honestly you're better off going with another company. I've used others in the past who have just come and fixed the problem without making a fuss or causing a hassle.I wish i never went with them, what a waste of money and just a real headache.Also if you want to cancel they will charge you the full contract amount upfront. Absolutely ridiculous, I'm going to the financial ombudsman to help sort this issue as this company should not be allowed to sell insurance.

Title: Follow up from my previous review.
Review: Follow up from my previous review.The complaints department from 247 home rescue called me and have said they are changing my boiler age to 12 years now as it is according to the boiler manufacturer date and not the date of installation. I’m quite confused how is this possible. Surely the boiler age will go on when the boiler was installed and started working and not from the day it was born! My advice to all the people who are thinking of changing their boiler, do not go with this company. You will get shafted. If they sell you a so called ‘NEW’ boiler which was manufactured 10 years  ago. I am sure you will get a measly £195 if your boiler breaks down in 2 years. Question any company you go with on how the age of boiler criteria works before you buy a policy! I won’t be renewing my policy with this company again. Lesson learnt!

Title: They Are NOT 24/7 Emergency Responders
Review: This company is a scam. Do NOT be roped in by the low price.They offer an absolutely poor service. They are never available 24/7 to respond to an home emergency. Call them numerous times this year and every time it has taken a week to send someone. If you have a home emergency a one week response time is no good or use. You can source a local person in that time framework.They call themselves 24/7 as they answer your call 24/7 but can not respond to a home emergency.You are better off paying British Gas a few extra pounds and in exchange you will at least get home emergency cover.They have one Gas Safe / Plumber covering the whole of the Southwest from Cornwall up to Gloucester that is why they can not respond to your call out.All their call agents are from abroad (Pakistan) so it is hard to understand them. The company is based in Burnley and they may have many engineers up North but nothing South.Sign up to this company at your Peril. Unfortunately i have to give 1 star as the option of 0 stars is not available. Will be cancelling my contract with this awful company.All other reviews on this site are fake do not believe them

Title: Boiler engineer didn't show up for the second time
Review: Unfortunately, if there were 0 stars, this would be my score. This is the second time that I scheduled a boiler service and the engineer doesn't attend. I had to schedule my whole week of work to stay home and by 5 pm no one showed up. I called the customer service, who gave me the third party company's telephone number. They didn't pick up the phone. So, I called the customer service again to be informed that they didn't know what happened and would investigate. If I wasn't home, there would be a £30 pound fine, however, when they don't show up for the second time, I get nothing. The app doesn't work, the chat is an AI tool not helpful at all and the tracking my engineer button stated on the chat doesn't even exist.   I'm so frustrated and disappointed.

Title: Buyer Beware!
Review: Was with this company for 3 years. I gave a 5-star review last year mostly because of the amazing engineer the company sent to service my boiler. Fast forward a year later, boiler service due and carried out. Different calibre of engineer; not as personable or capable/competent as the young lad sent last year due to the fact that after the service, my boiler started making these awful, scary noises mostly when the heating was turned on. We didn’t catch on at first because we didn’t use the heating immediately after service so the first time I noticed was about 9-10 days after the service. I managed to contact them after it had occurred a handful of times (I am also a professional who works full-time, and travels a fair bit and it took another 3/4 days to get around to calling them -once the issue had occurred multiple times). I was told I was outside the 7-day window to report faults after a service. However, no one had reminded me of this at the point of booking said service, engineer hadn’t given me this information immediately after service and I didn’t receive my service paperwork after service (although even when I got it, there wasn’t a reminder on there to contact them if  any problems within a week) so they effectively had breached their own T&Cs. If any or all of these had happened, we’d have run the heating immediately a handful of times to make sure everything was fine after the service. Anyway, they refused to send an engineer out and their defence was that the contract (which I’d entered into some 6 months prior) gave that information about the 7-day window. Thus, their ridiculous expectation is for the customer to have a photographic memory and to have memorised every line of the policy (bearing in mind this wasn’t emphasized verbally at any point) so I was expected to have remembered or even been aware of the 7-day window from looking at pages of T&Cs 6 months prior to the service). I tried to argue that this was an unrealistic expectation and that the customer should get a reminder at the time of booking a service/engineer should mention after service, and then ppw received immediately after  should also highlight this. They refused to send an engineer back out, instead advising they’d give me a ‘discount’ and charge me £65 for a visit. My boiler had been working absolutely fine before service, no complaints throughout the life of the policy, and hadn’t expressed any concerns about it prior to service. We’re also a vulnerable household. But instead of coming out to check what their engineer had done to my boiler, they used the get-out-of-jail-free card of policy T&Cs. We also discovered that whatever he’d done or not done correctly, messed with the thermostats somehow.  I went to the Financial Ombudsman which is effectively now a toothless bulldog, and the outcome was that they couldn’t speak to what had happened with, and after the service, but the policy said blah blah blah. Needless to say, I have now cancelled my policy. Whilst I was going back and forth with 247, I had to get a qualified mate to check my boiler, to at least give me peace of mind that it wasn’t about to explode any minute, considering the awful racket it was making after the so-called service. So, buyer beware.

Title: Please don't buy a policy from this…
Review: Please don't buy a policy from this company.If you heard what happened to me I am sure you will cancel your policy with this company immediately.I bought a policy to cover my new boiler.I had an email from them stating that they will send someone to check my fully working boiler.The cowboy came to my house and for no reason he pushed a big metal thing inside my boiler causing a huge gas leak and big damage and stopping the boiler from working.We were scared to see the gas everywhere.The cowboy panicked and he went to the gas supply and turned it off and disconnected the big pipe suppling the gas to the meter and left it like that wich could have caused disaster.He then left the house.We felt lost and didn't know what to do.We made nearly 100 calls to the insurance company and they said:All we can do is to apologies about what happened and they said that we have to sort it out ourselves. And the jocke is they offered us £30 compensation.Now we have to take a loan to pay for an expensive new boiler to replace our boiler which was like new and (247 insurance engineer decided to damage it run away

Title: Avoid at all costs!
Review: They are getting 1 star as there is no option to give no stars.  They came out and did a first service and from the time the engineer attended and left, the boiler started to act up and the pressure would keep going up and my hot water cut out.  A few days after the engineer left, I called to say I was having issues with the boiler and that the settings weren't working and they said they would send someone out but this never happened.  I rang them twice about this and the first time they said they called and didn't get me (there was no missed calls on my phone). Second time they said it would be a new claim and I would have to pay a call out fee but finally agreed to send someone out after I told them this was still the claim after their engineer had come out.  To date no one came out for that concern.  My boiler subsequently started leaking and I called them and had to pay a £95 call out fee only to be told they needed to strip down the boiler to fix it and I had to pay another £150 as this was not covered in my plan with them.  I did this, they came after much back and forth.  I was out of the country and left someone at the property to give them access and called and provided them with the contact information for the individual, but I kept being called and messaged when I was away trying to bury my family member.  When they finally decided to come out, they were telling me between 8 and 6pm which was utterly unacceptable as some of us do work. They finally agreed to between 8 - 12pm, then on the day they should attend, twice on the day they cancelled the engineers, first saying the engineer was sick and then that the other engineer had an emergency.  Buckets of water were being emptied and they were telling me they couldn't send  anyone out for two further days. It was only after I asked for the matter to be escalated that I was able to get them to come out.....all of this whilst abroad, as they continued to ring me and message throughout, even though I kept telling them to ring the number for the person at the house.  The engineer who finally came out claimed he messaged me an hour before he was due to get to the property but I never got that text.  He looked at the boiler and decided it would cost £500 to repair (which they didn't cover of course) and recommended that I get a new boiler.  They then quoted for a new boiler but could only offer one brand which they were obviously working with.  I advised I would like a choice of brands, but was told they can offer nothing if not the brand they were touting.They are in my view dishonest and misrepresent what they offer, whilst trying to upsell you things when they come out to service your boiler. I now feel like they tampered with my boiler to get me to buy a new one. My boiler was being serviced every year since purchasing it and prior to them attending to do their service, I had never had any issues with it, having put it in new 8 years before.  I would never recommend 24/7 to even my worst enemy.

Title: Loyal Customer. RIPPED OFF! Avoid...
Review: I have been a loyal customer of 24/7 for over 7 years, paying a monthly premium for their Home Care Plus Package. Every year I got a boiler service as part of the package, but never called them out for anything else. However, last week my hot water wasn't working due to low pressure. An engineer attended my property, part of the package,  and fixed the issue within seconds. Miraculously when he looked at his next job, he surprisingly stated that its my house and due for an annual service. This is where it all cam tumbling down. He came out with a list of things that were needed service the boiler, at an additional cost of £328.00, not covered by my premium cover policy. He also stated that if they open up the boiler, there could be other issue and could cost an additional £800 on top (£1,228.00) in total. I was shocked, given I was paying a premium for their most prestigious package for years and they would not fix my boiler, as it doesn't cover the parts or labour cost. I then suggested, in that case I have new bolier cover with 24/7 which they put me to a tea of sales people, that stated the cover is not for a new boiler but £400 towards a new one. I asked for the cost an they were trying to push me into an unheard of model costing 4 times more, even with the £400 discount than any other company ( i received several quotes). With all this I asked to CANCEL the policy as I thought it was absurd they were ripping me off as a loyal customer. Im then told it will cost £289.00 to cancel the policy as I had a annual service, which was part of the policy. Ultimately, I paid a premium for years, to be ripped of and when I want to leave they continue to request more money. Their customer service team is based in India and they say many things that are not true to keep your business. REMEMBER, you are paying a monthly premium which is contractual under their T&Cs they don't tell you about, and practically everything that will go wrong with a boiler or heating is not covered. You will pay more! AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Title: Been with 24/7 Home Energy for 4 years…
Review: Been with 24/7 Home Energy for 4 years for boiler cover. This year the price increased by 47% on auto renew with little more than a small line hidden in one of the many emails they sent. This is the second time they have done this.Despite me being with them for 4 years, my premium was double what new customers are offered (and I got less service cover). I called to cancel, at which point they said they hike prices up and lower them back down for those who phone to cancel. Offered to do the same for me but I refused given how toxic this tactic was. They then charged me £30 for the "privilege" of cancelling the contract, which they had auto renewed.In terms of service. It always took months go get an engineers appointment, and then they gave whole day appointments, meaning a full day off work. Once a pressure meter was faulty, engineer said he would call back as a quick 5 mins to replace - never heard anything back. Keep clear!

Title: It was easy to set up cover but when it…
Review: It was easy to set up cover but when it came to booking an appointment to service my boiler, it was terrible experience, firstly when I phoned the number I was advised to book the service via the website, but the website asked me to ring the phone number this went on a bit but eventually someone said that they will get their sub-contractor will contact me, that didn't happen for a while and when they did it was tell me a date and time and not arrange a mutual date and time, eventually we came to an agreement and an engineer arrived as arranged, pleasant man who seemed to do a fairly detailed check of my boiler, no complaints there, 247 even sent a guy around later to Audit the work carried which is  ot a bad thing to do.But with the messing about arranging an appointment I decided not to continue with 247 for another year,now the problem I have is that I get text and email messages over a month later informing me that the direct debit has been cancelled, I know, I cancelled it, I phoned them to tell them, but i still get text and emails.

Title: Poor experience
Review: 1. They give a whole day appointment with only 30 minute advance notice of arrival. It means the tenant has to take the whole day off.2. It took 8 visits including the service to sort out two simple problems.3. I resorted to phoning after 8am each day to try to get a better idea of the schedule of the engineer to find out whether it would be a morning or afternoon visit. I kept being told that it was an all day appointment. On two occasions I was given an indication of expected arrival times.This meant the tenant had 8 days to wait in.4. The security questions were the same each time and exceptionally tedious.5. I found it difficult to understand the person answering my calls, their spoken English was very poor in most cases.6. They are NOT a '24/7' operation when they only answer calls between 8am to 6pm!!It would be much more economical and convenient to pay a local gas engineer  his call out charges in future. Which I will do.

Title: This a a total scam
Review: This a a total scam. Paying for boiler service and breakdown cover.Had a service and told there was a flue fault which isn’t covered and to pay £360 for repair. I wasn’t convinced and got a second opinion. Turns out smalll leak due to loose joint! They also called before engineer was due adding charges for a carbon detector and safety fluid for the radiators. The engineer who was there for 5 minutes [meant to be a service] did not do this. When I phoned to cancel the policy, surprise surprise wanted more money to cancel. Shocking company! Use a reputable company like British Gas.

Title: Since my last review of this company…
Review: Since my last review of this company 247 home rescue, I raised a complaint about the poor service I received. I got a call from the manager of the team and was offered a "goodwill gesture" this is for a referral to Baxi boiler repair to attend my property and assess whether they will fix my gas boiler with no cost to me.  I have accepted this offer and now waiting for Baxi to phone me. However I was advised that Baxi might refuse to repair the boiler and deem it to be unrepairable! So I anxiously await to see if I will get my heating and hot water back on after nearly a week without. I will update on Trust pilot as to the outcome and hopefully it will be a positive one 🤞🙏

Title: Just Don’t!
Review: Be careful. Hugely expensive and high pressure sales. You will be charged £100 for a call out even if it’s a relatively simple issue, and you will be charged if you try to cancel mid term. I ve learned my lesson - avoid!

Title: QUACK ENGEINEERS AND UNSKILLED TRADEMEN
Review: I had a one-year cover policy with 247 Home Rescue, that covered nothing. They were only interested in collecting monthly direct debits.1st call out for a shower tap problem was declined.2nd call out for kitchen drain blockage could not be fixed by an unskilled cowboy sent. I have to do this privately with a handyman. The annual boiler service request took the person sent three minutes only to dust the boiler with a brush.Thirdly, the call out for no hot water and heating again was misdiagnosed as a broken pump, so boiler replacement was recommended by another unskilled person sent by 247. I had to cancel my policy and called out the W/Bose engineer privately. The boiler was diagnosed as low pressure due to leakage hence no hot water and heating. The leaking spot was tightened and the boiler was repressurised. Heating and hot water are now restored. The engineer said nothing was wrong with the boiler. I WONDER THE NUMBER OF GOOD WORKING BOILERS 247 HOME RESCUE QUACK ENGINEERS HAVE CONDEMNED.Ref:MS620882 Job ID:1187733-1 and JobID:1Ref:MS620882 Job ID:1268657

Title: Great from start to Finnish
Review: Complete service from start to Finnish. Firstly not having to wait long periods of time for the phone to be answered secondly getting the appointment you want more or less on the day that you requested thirdly getting a text message to say your appointment has been booked also received phone call that engineer on he way and how long it would take to get to me .Fourly the engineer attending polite clean and tidy well aware of the problem that he needed to fix that's very helpful in also explaining to myself what the problem was left the house with the area that he was working in clean and tidy and was respectful and courteous at all times throughout the appointment I would recommend the engineer again.

Title: They let you down when you need them
Review: I had my emergency insurance with them for some time. I had an emergency in the kitchen, water was leaking everywhere and I could hear real loud hissing under the cabinet. I called them and they were reluctant to even understand the problem. Then they asked me to investigate the issue (knowing that I am not a plumber!) asking me to send them pictures which I did. I called again after I had to turn the main water supply to avoid more damages. After calling them continuously and me trying to explain the severity and the inconvenience of not having water in the house especially that I have a disabled child and we couldn’t use any water! It was disaster and after me calling few times they refused to send a plumber saying that they don’t cover repairing leak from a main pipe!!!! How is that even possible! I explained that it is a 15mm copper pipe and it is not the main water pipe! They didn’t even apologise or offer a solution. I had to hire a private plumber on an emergency basis and the leak was done in less than 10 minutes! I was fuming and will not renew or recommend this company to anyone. Be wary! There was a pinhole in the kitchen pipe and was refused help when they know that I was panicking and couldn’t have any water all day!!!

Title: Terrible experience with 247 home…
Review: Terrible experience with 247 home rescues. First issue the mobile application I’ve tried to access survives through this and it’s so glitchy it’s unusable meaning I have had to resort to calling the company. Upon calling the call centre instant realisation of it not being UK based meaning their a language barrier with the call handlers, this combined with the call centre using internet based calling resulted in them constantly dropping out add to the high levels of frustration already experienced. I’ve decided to stick with the call centre to cancel with the first handler deciding to deal with this by telling me they are super busy at 9:30 in the morning and they would call me back. No call back in 30 minutes. I’ve called back finally getting through to the correct department and once again the calls dropped out. Feels the ways the company wants to deal with you wanting to leave is but just ignoring you.

Title: Very quick and reliable service

Title: Very polite and respectful as I was…
Review: Very polite and respectful as I was unwell that day

Title: Thieves and false information
Review: Utter thieves and false reviews. Firstly, this company will get you to write a review as soon as you have signed up to their policies making most of the reviews on here false. Secondly, they use Indian call centres which have a poor grasp of the English language. I rang up to make a claim on some pipework which cost me £95 excess. The man on the phone whose English was poor at best, assured me that I was covered for the pipe work as I wanted to make sure that before paying a hefty excess. The engineer turned up for ten minutes and wrongly diagnosed a faulty pipe, it turned out to be the washing machine!! Then I was told I was not covered. 24/7 refused to issue me a refund for the policy. I have two policies and will be cancelling both due to the poor service.

Title: This company is a complete rip off
Review: This company is a complete rip off! I took out boiler insurance with them and during my annual boiler service they told me if my boiler broke down they would not be able to get parts for it so I should buy a new boiler. They scaremonger you into believing your boiler will break down during winter and they won't be able to fix it. I started the process of getting a new boiler and paid them a deposit. I then did some research and realised they were charging a lot more than other company's for a new boiler and the new boiler insurance was a 10 year direct debit which they did not tell me about. They also did not tell me that I was entitled to a £250 discount as I had a policy with them. I cancelled the new boiler but the company did not give me back my £700 deposit. I phoned them several times and they said the refund had been processed and it was my bank that was  keeping the funds from me. It was all lies, no refund was processed so I opened a dispute with my bank and got my money back. All the people that work for this company are in on the scam and are just trying to sell products. Don't waste your money go with another company!

Title: Scammers!!
Review: Had to put a claim in last week as no hot water. They were fast in getting in touch and got an engineer out same day... I had to pay £95 excess pay before the engineer even came out... they're saying it's a call out fee but it's not cos on my contract it says excess pay: £95 plus just seen a review last week saying they got charged £60 call out fee.. why is mine more?? Anyway engineer came out (lovely guy by the way) told me the issue and then said I'm not covered so he left and I ended up getting a local plumber in to fix it as I knew these company's would charge alot more... I then tried to get my 95 refunded as the work wasn't fixed.. I messaged and emailed 3 times no reply.. so rang today to be told it's none refundable!! Why??? I'm paying that to fix my boiler which wasn't fixed so that's my money! And not forgetting you have scammed me paying me £35 extra if it was supposedly a call out fee! I've never had any problems until now so that's me done with this company I'll be going else where. What a joke scamming a single mother of 3 kids!

Title: Lucky you that got an engineer when…
Review: Lucky you that got an engineer when 24/7 said they would send one !After 7 years they failed to send an engineer for a so-called service in July 2024, argued the issue then rescheduled for September, backed up by a  confirmatory E-Mail. Didn't attend, again.I wouldn't mind but as no time for the visit is given I have to be available from 08.00 to 19.00 - hanging around all day just waiting - infuriating. And still they argued.I attempted to cancel the policy but fell foul of the contract small print - you must give 30 days notice. So I have to pay an "administration fee " plus pay another month's premium to get out of the contract.My advice ? What do you think !I've signed up with British Gas - compare. JJARef WS0217424Had to use a GMAIL account to submit this.

Title: Appalling service and xare
Review: We signed up to have our boiler maintained in 2023. The engineer arrived and damaged our boiler. He then put a request for repair in but this was not carried out in 2023 or 24. We stayed patient despite them putting charges up significantly. They returned in 2024 and serviced the boiler and put in another job request to mend the boiler. We then received a quote for repair of over £100 despite us not doing anything. I disputed this and they then proceeded to slate the boiler manufacturer (Worcester Bosch) and advised it was either broken already or the boiler manufacturers fault. I had multiple conversations with them over a week and was then passed to their complaints dept. I wasted hours of my time calling them and responding to their pointless and sub-standard investigations. I was offered £20 of their repair as a final offer. Appalling customer service, a complete lack of empathy and care

Title: SCAM ARTISTS! Don't even turn up to appointments!
Review: TRULY SHOCKING SERVICE!!!! I took time off work to stay home for an engineer to arrive, I get no txt or call for 30min warning, or arrival ETA likethey advertise. Instead, you get 1 missed call from a random number, which when you immediately call back, no one answers! I then txt random no to ask who it is?! No reply! Also, no one has come to your door either, so you’re left thinking maybe the engineer is still on their way and that was the 30min warning?! 15mins go by, still no reply from txt’s, or now multiple phone messages to the random no! You also can’t get through to the main office! When you finally do get to speak with an agent, they won’t help me!! Even though, I, the tenant booked, and paid for this emergency appointment yesterday!!!.. They spoke to me with no issues then, when I was paying up!!!.. but they won’t speak to me now?!!! (convenient much?!), OBVIOUSLY A SCAM they do!!!Even when you explain that you believe a driver may be trying to contact you right now, at this moment! Or perhaps is lost, and can’t find your address?! NOPE, after 3 calls with different agents NO ONE would help me! Still no one has come to my front door either?! I end up having to get my internationally based Landlord to call this company, who was then told apparently the driver waited for 25mins then left?! WHEN?! WHERE?! Why didn’t they answer their phone, call meback, or the basic call out engineer method of ACTUALLY KNOCKING ON THE FRONT DOOR?!!!lMy landlord has now had to reschedule the appointment to the next day, and pay an another fee!! This is CRIMINAL!!! I have no heating! I took time of work to wait in for no one to arrive!The only explanation is that this company FEIGN ENGINEER ARRIVALS TO DOUBLE CHARGE THEIR CUSTOMERS, LYING ABOUT THEIR ARRIVAL!WHAT A SCAM AND HUGE WASTE OF MY TIME!!!

Review: Was very pleased with Liam he did a good job and was very efficient, polite and helpful.

Title: Damaged Boiler Hinges
Review: We have had cover with this company since 2020 without incident. In 2022 we had a new boiler installed by Bosch. The boiler was serviced the next Summer 2023 by this company.  The engineer that serviced the boiler was lovely and very chatty, at the end of the service she told that everything was fine and there were no issues. Last week the second boiler service was carried out, this time the engineer advised that the hinges on the front panel were broken, this was a shock as this panel had not been touched since the service the prior year during the boiler service.When he was done the bottom left side of the front panel had slipped and you could see a visible gap, he said that it needs to be repaired asap as this could compromise the function of the boiler. He also told me that if you're not familiar with this brand of boiler and don't take care when removing the panel, you will snap the hinges. I received a call from customer service the next day, they were providing a quote to repair the hinges it was going to cost us £129! I questioned this and was told that the previous engineer had noted the broken hinges in her report, funny she never mentioned this to me and I never received a follow up call to have this rectified, which is what I thought the boiler service was for;  find and fix any faults, otherwise what are we paying for? Outrageous! Because they use contractors any damage caused when servicing a boiler would be a chargeback to the engineer, which is why she didn't mention it to me and made it seem that this was the way she found it. In the end we contacted Bosch and they arranged to have the hinges replaced. Needless to say I've cancelled this cover as I can't tust the integrity of their contractors. We will be paying more for Bosch to carry out the annual service, but at least we will have peace of mind.

Title: Shocking company!!
Review: Shocking company! Avoid at all costs. My boiler kept dropping pressure, so rang and they sent an engineer out who changed a valve and on he went. This didn't resolve the problem. I rang home 24/7 again who sent out a different engineer. He was here for 5mins, told me he wasn't happy with the state of the new valve and ordered a completely new part and off he went. 6 hours later we noticed water on the outside of the house even though it was a dry sunny day. Went to check the boiler and water was leaking everywhere inside and through the outside pipes. 6 hours this had gone on for since the engineer visited! So within a 5 minute visit this said engineer had damaged my boiler causing a massive leak, and he decided to leave without saying anything other than he's ordered a new part! Rang home 24/7 who aren't 24/7 at all. Told me I had to just wait for the new part to come in! Couldn't care that an engineer had just damaged my boiler and water damaged my property. Now left without heating or hot water with young children and a baby in the house. Told I have to wait 24hours for the issue to be picked up and then I'll get a phone call back. So I have no heating, no hot water and a massive leak! But I've gotta wait 24 hours to for a call back to see if it can even be fixed? Had to ring around for a local company to come and fix a problem caused by this company!!! Avoid Avoid Avoid absolutely shocking and disgusting behaviour from all.

I therefore sent the investigation report and invoice to 24/7 ( Stanley Martin) as they have requested but they refused to pay telling me they cant find the said company online.   DONT TRUST THEM, though they cheap not the best. I have to cough extra cash to bring the professionals who carried out the job. policy reff- WS612982

Title: Ridiculous service 🙄 here again
Review: Ridiculous service same here I'm disabled need heating for health care!24/7 home rescue claim £45 access paid up front! 12 months payments £20:25p per month. And called 03 October engineer came out Saturday would not fix problem as 247 home rescue only allowed him to spend £50 to fix the problem. He left tell ing me this was a terrible service he could not even change the fuse for £50! He left still no heating or hot water! He said he would contact 24/7 and see if they would pay up as I have boiler and central heating parts and labour on my plan. But 24/7 have to then decide if they will honour the claim. Left at that waited Sunday nothing Monday nothing so I checked the app. It said" claim closed all done"This made my blood boil so I called hours of trying to get through to the right person. I asked why as my claim been closed you haven't done any repairs?"Your claim is open I just opened it again"Was the answer so they had closed it I asked"No I have opened it now for you"If it was not closed you wouldn't have to open it would you I replied nothing came back!I asked why £50 why did they not just do the job ?" The fitter allways comes out to assess the problem then we decide if we can fix it" Was the reply.So I have paid £20 odd a month for 12 months and you will think about fixing my boiler. What's 24-7 about that I asked. The fitter finished Saturday it's now Monday and if I had not chased this up I would of been waiting for a repair and gas fitter! That was never going to come because you closed my claim?Answer was even more bizarre 🙄 "We are not 24-7 our help line is"I asked did the fitter contact 24-7 on Saturday?"No our offices are close at evenings and weekends he couldn't "So your closed and didn't get contacted by the fitter then but you closed my claim"NO your claim isn't closed I just told you I have opened it again for you"If you just opened it again then it was shut by 24-7 then without doing any work or fixing problem this needs fixing ASAP I'm disabled and no heating or hot water the boiler fault code reads FD(No flow)And shuts down you know we have had two nights below freezing 🥶 and that's all you can do."I will escalate your claim we will contact you"Can I have a direct number to you to save waiting and going through India to get a answer. She put the phone down and cut me off.Monday is at a end now. I had a text from 24-7"24-7 we are still looking at your request for repair. Once the assessment as been completed we will contact you to discuss the repair. Than kyou for your patience 24-7 home rescue "The assessment was carried out by the fitter you sent out on Saturday! Or what was the point of his visit because he didn't do anything except confirm FD fault code ideal heat 15 boilerAnd alpha2 flow pump is knackered 😴 What more dose 24-7 need to assess!Your own engineering told us this and reported it to you (24-7 home rescue)Good job you 24-7 aren't an emergency service 🙄 I forgot you are well your advertising suggested you are.Still waiting!Ref:No WP551674

It feels like they are intentionally avoiding their responsibilities under the policy, leaving us frustrated and stressed.I would not recommend 24/7 Home Rescue to anyone looking for reliable home coverage. Title: Service issues
Review: Have been with this company for 18 months since I moved in to my home. I renewed my cover / service plan in February 2024. My annual boiler service was due in September 2024 which was booked with no issues with the company however when the day came around the engineer did not turn up. I was told by a customer service advisor this was down to the fact they do not cover my type of boiler. This is In spite of the fact they serviced it the previous year and also knew the make and model before letting me renew my policy and letting me book my service. Eventually this was resolved and rearranged for a date a week later only for the exact same thing to happen. Again I faced a lengthy phone call to get to the bottom of the issues for it to be booked for a 3rd time today 09/10/24 for again no engineer to turn up and for the customer service team to tell me the same story yet again.To make matters worse they have also charged me £40 for an inhibitor that they haven't even been on my property to use. Avoid at all costs.

Title: Unreliable, a joke...I don't recommend
Review: Today 9.10.2024 I was supposed to have my boiler serviced.This was booked a few weeks ago and for it I had to take an unpaid day off work.This morning I rushed to do the school run as I didn't want to be late and miss the engineer.Time frame was 9 AM - 6 PM so I waited patiently for the engineer's call or SMS.9:50 AM no text, call or engineer so called 24/7 and asked when and if the engineer will come. The answer was that the engineer has very urgent jobs in the city and can't make it. After explaining that I had to take an unpaid day off and that this is been booked ages ago and also it's not normal, I have been reassured that the engineer will come today after all.16:18 PM no text, call or engineer yet.17:04 PM still nothing. I feel like I spent my day on house arrest...17:35 there is no sign of my appointment being honoured today. The engineer has to call 30 min prior the appointment so it's a no for today...Shameful...Update 18:00 : called them a totally incompetent person answered my call, no apologies, no sorry, no nothing. All I could get from her was that a supervisor will call me back tomorrow...If I would've missed the appointment the company would have charged me a fee.So I think it's only fair that they would pay me my working day that I missed.Better than that this should actually be mandatory so that no service provider mocks their customers.

Title: Landlords avoid
Review: Landlords avoid, unless you want unhappy tenants complaining.  I booked a boiler service and Certificate. I made it clear that the tenants would be home any day after 2pm and was told that it was fine, a day was booked and I was told that the engineer's electronic diary was 'down' but she would add a note to say after 2pm. To double check it had been done I telephoned the day before the appointment. The Engineer turned up at 8.30am. I'm on my third phone call of today to chase it up with people promising to call me back but actually doing nothing, and I still can't tell tenants if the engineer is going to turn up after 2 and if they need to be there. They are fuming and so am I, 24/7 keep saying that if it is re-booked it will be an 'anytime between 8 and 6' and that somehow I have to make the tenants be there or get there myself to be at the property all day. Utterly useless to landlords, in fact worse than useless.

Title: 247 Home Scam should be the real name…
Review: 247 Home Scam should be the real name of the company. So this is how it works:1. You call boiler not working. Engineer (so called) turns up 5 minutes later without opening the cover tells the unspecting tenant major works needed company will be in touch.2. You get a call from the company new boiler sales team, very very concerned your boiler is beyond economic repair because thier engineer has condemmed the boiler due to extensive parts needed to be changed & the boiler being substandard and old. Its a Main(Baxi) boiler and 8 years old! so you ask how much is it well for you just around 2400 pounds.3. You refuse they cancel your cover, I asked for a copy of the engineers report which has this on it "premier sensor resistance was very low 3.5kom, also they advised that the PCB was faulty and required replacement. "4.Flumexed how he could have gaterd all this information without opening the panel & Baxi advised all this without any being on site I called Baxi! I am aure you can guess what they said... no call received regarding my boiler serial number and there is no way they could have diagosed this or nay one could have without being on site and no one knows what this premier sensor is on thier boiler.5. Stumped and out of options I ask them how much will they charge for a repair £443.00 is the figure that came back with! fair does to them the lady said you could pay this over 12 months and the boiler will be covered for the 12 months too, they wanted the last engineers report so they could make sure they had the parts on the van, so that is when I had called you the customer services and they said we can also het the manufacturer out for  a repair at he cost of some 265 pounds, never offered this before! only a boiler replacement! 6. Had already paid the Baxi guys and they had confirmed they will turn up the next day so kept them on. They did turn up the next day first thing in the morning and lo and behold there was nothing wrong with the boiler except the timer on the boiler was off no PCB no fictitious  premier sensor.... nothing at all. 7. Fuming that I had been had and almost fell prey to 24/7 high pressure sales tactics I wrote an email to their complaint team wanting to know how does a boiler with a timer switched off get diagnosed as beyond economic repair... and my policy terminated because I didn't accept their new boiler.. Their complaints department wouldn't take any names  on a public forum came back with a 20 pound compensation as a good will gesture and I am £443 down. Needless to state I will be filing a complaint with the financial ombudsman today. 8. They had done the same thing on another property of mine a week before as they filed its CP12 on routine seals which British Gas & Main both have confirmed are service items and must be changed on service inspection, lo and behold I get a call from their new boiler team stating your perfectly operational Valliant Boiler needs replacing as its too old and seals are failing!!!!! What worries me  how many people has fallen victim to these scamsters.... any one who has please speak out, so others especially the old  don't fall victim to the unscrupulous methods of this company.

Title: This is a scam
Review: This is a scam. What a joke. We woke up with no heating and hot water and have a 3 month old baby. Called them first thing in the morning. They wanted me to pay £90 (even though we pay the monthly cost) and then told us someone would come out two days later. Asked to speak to a manager but apparently they were all at home. Later found out there was a manager on shift.Had to find someone locally who came out and fixed the problem quickly. I have sent 247 home rescue the invoice and will not be continuing the contract. Update: their reply about not being able to find my details is nonsense. I rang them there times today! Update: they've updated their response now but this has still been an appalling experience. I can't wait to leave contract and find a company that actually cares.

Title: Knowledgeable engineer
Review: Knowledgeable engineer

Title: Unreliable
Review: We've been with 247 Home Rescue for two or three years.  Our policy includes an annual boiler service.  Previously there's been no problem, but this year . . . .I received a reminder that a service was due and went online to book it.  It said all appointments for this month were booked . . . and next month . . . and the month after.  I went a year forward in their calendar and it was still showing no appointments available.  So my husband rang up - because we thought there must be a fault on the website - and he was told that, yes, all appointments were booked for the next year.  Not much point in having a policy that includes a service if there's no one to carry it out.  The person on the helpdesk said they would 'phone us when an appointment became available.  After two weeks and no 'phone call, my husband 'phoned again and was told "We can send someone today."  Yes please!  Several hours later they rang to say "The engineer can't do today but he can come some time tomorrow."  We had made plans for the day but, since it's important to get the boiler serviced before the cold weather sets in, we stayed in all day, waiting for the engineer - who didn't come.  My husband tried ringing the company but, clearly, there's no one on the boiler service helpdesk at the weekend, because when he pressed the button suggested he just got a recorded message saying the engineer would ring half and hour before he arrived.  Neither of which things happened.We will ring again on Monday but I'm not holding out much hope.  And when our policy is up for renewal we shall be looking elsewhere for cover.

Title: Helpful & efficient service
Review: The engineer immediately identified the cause of my heating/hot water problem and installed the required replacement valve and tested everything. All done in under an hour and I'm very satisfied with the 247 service.

Review: Had boilers serviced at my rental properties the engineer did not clean out the boiler filter which I find quite amazing as the policy does not cover sludge entering the boiler surely this is part of a service I have only checked one I will now have to go and check the restWaste of time having service if they only do half a job

And when they do will I be told another pack of lies.

Title: Very poor service
Review: So far our experience with 24/7 Home Rescue has been very disappointing. Despite initially signing up to a contract that was very competitive, the service thus far has been far from satisfactory. Despite joining in December of last year, the first date available for the mandatory service was August of this year. This was then cancelled by the company due to “unforeseen circumstances” with 48h notice, with the first available rescheduled date being October. Today, after staying in all day and receiving a text that an engineer would arrive between 1pm and 6pm, we received a text saying that due to “unforeseen circumstances” the engineer could no longer attend🤬 If we were to cancel an appointment we could be hit with a £35 penalty. I doubt we will receive the same in return for their incompetence. Very poor service indeed. Our years contract will be up before we eventually get an engineer!

Ridiculous!

Title: Poor Service
Review: Been with 24/7homerescue for a few years. They installed a new boiler for me in July when the Engineer was leaving he handed me the thermostat controls and said he'd never used that model before and for me to log onto Youtube which I've done but it's difficult to follow. I'm 79.  Rang 24/7 to book a follow up service and for them to show me how to set the controls. Booked service on line for yesterday and got the confirmation email. Engineer didn't turn up. Rang them they said the booking hadn't gone through properly even though I'd got the confirmation email. Told me to book another service which wouldn't be until December! Wasn't happy with that but tried to book another service then but have been told "the relevant department will ring me so can't book another one" Going round in circles. Think I'm going to cancel the service contract. Had another call from 24/7 which I missed I rang them back and they asked me why I was ringing and  started to log a new claim and were going to charge me £75 excess fee!!!!!     They don't know what they're doing!! .   I'm going to cancel the policy.

Title: I've had the policy for many years and…
Review: I've had the policy for many years and two sucesful repais. Premium was very cheap but I'm now giving up on it.Ihave a flat where the pipes are behind walls or under floors.I had a leak in the bathroom which was showing up on the floor. To get to the leak the plumber would have needed to access the pipe through the wall. This is turned out was not covered in the policy. The leak must be visible for it to be repaired. The relevent clause says no investigation or access is inlucded. As far as I am concerend this makes the claim to cover plumbing worthless as in most cases the source of the leak is not visible as most pipes are behind walls (unless your home is the Pompidou Centre). Most plumbers do know how to access pipes behind walls in my experience.

Title: I informed the company (as requested by…
Review: I informed the company (as requested by them) and notified them that I didn't want to renew my insurance policy so it didn't auto renew. Staff member told me I'd paid my last direct debit, so I assumed I could cancel it my end, then I received a text and email to say that they had suspended my cover, but I'd already paid for the month, so left me without insurance for about 10 days before my current policy expires. I'm a manager, I have a very good job, to me this is very poor practice and a business which I feel isn't up to standard. Won't be using them again.

Title: Engineer was quick and efficient
Review: Engineer was quick and efficient. A nice quiet & polite person. (not your doing) Thank you

Title: SCAM SCAM please Don't waste your time and Money with this company not worth it.
Review: IT'S A SCAM, can't believe they are allowed to operate as an emergency service, I have their HOME CARE PLUS policy which is their premium policy and guess what, they provide heating and boiler breakdown and the rest,  I have contacted them regarding an issue I have with my radiators not getting warm , so the engineer came out and checked everything and told me he will be back and someone will contact regarding an appointment,  sure enough they did call me and asked me to pay £146 for the repair,  I believed that I had INSURANCE against this kind of cost,  they said we will cover the parts and labour but we can't drain the system,  now if anyone knows little bit about heating system that if you want to carry out any job regarding radiators or boiler you need to take water out which is draining the system that is basic,  guess what that part which is draining the system to carry out any jobs is NOT COVERED,  and they gave me the price of £146 odd to open one small bolt to let the water out it's a pure SCAM,  SAVE your self hassle and time,  do not go near them , they PRICE looks very attractive but you won't get anything in return,  DON'T waste your MONEY IT'S A SCAM.

Title: This scam& dodgy company has broken my…
Review: This scam& dodgy company has broken my healthy boiler and has very very poor serviceAvoid this dodgy company.Read my review carefully& I tell you how they play dirty&break your healthy boiler to be able to sell you a new boiler& steal your money.You pay them around £200-250 annually for their landlord care plan.Then you call them multiple times to arrange for a boiler annual service&landlord gas safety certificate.My tenants didn't have any issues with the boiler at all before the engineer's visit&it was working perfectly.The tenant took a day off work&stayed home between 8am-6pm.Their staff who are based in India and Pakistan call you 2-3 times on the same day before the engineer's visit&push you to sell you a new boiler&if you decline it then they try to sell you their company products like descaler, inhibitors etc.When you decline their products again then engineer won't turn up for the appointment on the day&waste your time&money.Then you arrange another appointment&engineer attend the 2nd appointment after weeks if you are lucky then he told us the boiler is faulty &needs to be repaired but he tells you " IT IS NOT COVERED BY YOUR POLICY" & you have to pay extra in spite of having no issues with the boiler at all! I made a huge mistake& trusted them and I paid £210&the engineer falsely claims he fixed the boiler but no Landlord Safety Certificate or no other repair report was given to me by the engineer or by 24/7.Then, my tenants experienced issues with the hot water the day after the repair.Then hot water stopped completely a week after repair!!! I complained to them straight away then they ask me to pay £95 to book an engineer appointment to fix their fault. They are an absolute joke and very dodgy. My tenants took a day off again&stayed home again 8am-6pm but engineer didn't turn up again for 2nd time in 2 wks.My tenants&I are very disappointed&very frustrated with this fake and scam company. My tenants took 2 days off work but the engineers didn't show up twice and wasted my tenants time and money. I complained to them&cancelled my all policies immediately&they offered me only £25 which is an absolute joke!While they took around £500 from me&created a fake job&didn't do anything and broke my healthy boiler.I have spoken to different staffs multiple times who are based mainly in India&Pakistan&Eastern Europe& requested full refund of £210 as there was no issues with boiler before the engineer's visit.The engineer are unprofessional, incompetent& useless &they took advantage of our trust&made up a fake job&damaged the healthy boiler. My tenants lost money and time because they stayed home twice but the engineer didn't turn up twice.It's very unprofessional company with very poor service which only takes money every month but when you desperately need them, they don't care about you at all. Don't get fooled with their reviews, I don't believe it at all. If customers miss the appointment then customers have to pay £30 penalty each time, however the engineer failed to attend twice while my tenants stayed home the whole day and they didn't offer us any money. Their customer service is absolutely rubbish and you have to call them many times and chase them and they keep you waiting for over 15 min with no luck to solve your problem. Now, I have called 2 different boiler engineers from different companies and they checked the boiler and they informed me the previous engineer has broken the boiler and it cost around £1000 to fix it or better to buy a new boiler. The tenant didn't have any issues at all with the boiler before the visit by 24/7 engineer and he deliberately has broken the healthy boiler and I am absolutely disgusted. So, please be aware of this scam company with incompetent and fake engineers. I cancelled my other policies with them and I advise you to cancel your policies straight away and save you time and money. But if you decide to keep the policy, make sure, you stand next to the engineer when he visit your boiler. And if he tells you the boiler is faulty or at risk etc, don't believe him and don't trust him at all and get a second opinion from a different engineer from a different company. Because 24/7 is a SCAM and dodgy company!

Title: 5 stars for Sam and 2 stars for 24/7
Review: Sam, the engineer was fab. Professional, polite and offered helpful advice.However 24/7's policy of not giving a time slot, other than 8am to 6pm, is not helpful at all. The price has also increased considerably in the last couple of years. They also call you to sell you overpriced extras. Plus, if there's a fault on your boiler, you're probably not covered. My father's boiler had a fault on it and 24/7 wouldn't repair it. They stuck a sticker on the boiler and said he was not advised to use it as it was dangerous but, as it was still working, it wasn't broken and so they didn't have to fix it! They wanted £170 for parts and labour fir a cheap part £15 or so and a 15 minute job. I will shop around next year.

Title: Upon the call to arms
Review: Upon the call to arms, our home faced a chill which knew no mercy, and in this darkest hour, the boiler fell into silence. But fear not, for our salvation arrived in the form of an intrepid engineer, a paragon of expertise and resolve. From the moment he crossed the threshold, his demeanor was one of calm assurance and unwavering focus. With tools in hand and knowledge abundant, he embarked on his noble mission to restore warmth to the hearth. Methodical and precise, he inspected and toiled, undeterred by the complexities that lay before him.His work was not merely a repair but an exhibition of mastery. Each turn of the wrench, each measured adjustment, was executed with a grace that bespoke years of experience. Patiently, he explained the process, ensuring that we, the grateful recipients of his toil, understood the care being taken.In less time than it takes to recount, the boiler roared back to life, an anthem of victory over cold and discomfort. We stand warmed not only by the heat of our radiator but by the knowledge that such stewards of craft exist. For those in need of a guiding hand through the battlefield of broken boilers, our engineer stands ready—undaunted and ever steadfast. Truly, this was a service rendered with fortitude worthy of high praise.
