Title: SCAMERS, AVOID AT ALL COST
Review: I have signed up contract with 247 for my Gas boiler cover and after 7 months of paying, I have logged my first call to fix my boiler, on the call they increase my access saying boiler is 19 years old hence access will be £75, I said ok but I clearly asked is their any thing else I need to know before I pay, (asked 3 times) and answer was no sir we book engineer and your boiler will fixed, engineer was onsite investigate the issues and requested the parts that needs replacing.Now problem starts, First I got a call from 247 and they said boiler repair cost higher then the boiler value so trying to sell me new boiler for £2100 , really!!!, I said NOafter 20 mins received 2nd call saying we not fixing your boiler because cost is higher then boiler value and you have to pay £345 if you want to repair boiler,Seriously, I am paying from last 7 months, they have boiler model number when contract was signed, why they issued a contact if they already know boiler is too old and also charge me access as well.called many times so I can speak to complaints department but customer service team wont transfer my call to complaints teams and not even to manager.(call center in Pakistan and call quality is very bad)WORSE part is they still want to take monthly cost from my bank even they don't want to fix the boiler .SCAMERS, AVOID AT ALL COST,

Title: 247 are proactive in arranging for your…
Review: 247 are proactive in arranging for your annual boiler inspection. They contact you when a gas service engineer is in the area, so no 'jumping through hoops' etc as you would have to with some of the major companies when you want them to provide what you pay for. So far, this has meant that my boiler has been serviced at more frequent than every 12 months, which is a positive and a bonus indeed. Thomas, the service appliance engineer who attended, lives locally and is very friendly and gave positive reassurances about the condition of my boiler, instilling me with confidence about it's reliability over the coming winter months. Their monthly charges are also only about half of what I would pay with the likes of British Gas. Well worth it when you consider that prior to taking out cover I had to pay £400 for a emergency plumber to attend for a failed boiler about two years ago during winter.

Title: Like dealing with a company from the 80's. Dreadful
Review: Having received questionable communication since joining, such as a call out of the blue to state that there was an engineer round the corner and he could come round and service my boiler now. On stating that I wasn't in and could I reschedule I was told yes and then they put the phone down 😂.Received an email stating that my cover was increasing from £13.99 to £22.99. Website is useless and to cancel you need to speak to I think an Indian call centre which is haphazard too say the least. On calling them to cancel I was put on hold then miraculously informed they could now do it for £15.99. Advised I wasn't interested. Then told I had one payment left scheduled for 15th October. I clarified that as this was the 20th it had been paid. Then received an email stating last payment 02 Nov, which is actually the end date of the policy. Next day received a voicemail and email stating they could now do it for £14.99!!! Emailed back that I did not wish to proceed nor do i wish to be contacted anymore. Today I have received yet another voicemail from India. DO NOT TOUCH THIS LOT!!!!

I had gone to the trouble of clearing the utility room out on both occasions so the engineer had plenty of room. This was a waste of time for me on both occasions.If I am not there for the appointment it costs me £30 each time, however when 24/7 don’t turn up will I get compensation? I doubt it. Title: Appalling service for vulnerable customer
Review: My mother is 81 and very vulnerable - she pays a monthly subscription to 247 in case of issues with her heating/ hot water/ boiler - not the cheapest but they imply they cover all week round. Well not if you're in an area that they don't cover and they sub contract to... they don't do weekends. Appalling. Also they don't tell you this when you take the cover out. And you have to pay the up front £45 callout charge before they then tell you noone available until Monday .... and they still don't confirm a callout! We made a claim at 8.30am on a Saturday morning. After paying the £45 excess they offer Monday. I ask for a refund .. then I'm told they will try their hardest to get a callout before then (elderly lady living on her own with no hot water nor heating) ... so I think ok I'll give them a chance. Then called back late on sat afternoon saying nothing till Monday. Unhelpful customer service from an Indian call centre. They like to take your money then not deliver a service. Would not recommend.

Title: Disgraceful company
Review: I was with 247 home rescue for the last 4 years, I recently had an issue with my boiler (no hot water, no heating) I contacted 247 home rescue regarding this, after completing several checks I was told I needed to pay £95 excess for a claim, I paid this, they then told me it would be 5 days before an engineer could arrive, this is how they treat emergencies 😳I get a call from the engineer and he tries to help me through a video call to get the boiler working, he can't believe that 247 home rescue are leaving me with no heating or hot water for 5 days (I have a young family)The boiler did not respond to any attempts to get it working, over the phone the plumber tells me the boiler fan is needing replaced, he will let 247 know this.The next I know, 247 call me and tell me that my boiler is BER (beyond economical repair) I have either to pay for full repair or pay for replacement boiler... I'm like "what on earth am I paying insurance for? 😳They then send quotes for replacing boiler for £3000. The next email I get from 247 home rescue is them informing me they have cancelled my insurance policy with them, stating that the boiler is too old and BER (they knew the age of it yet happily took the monthly premium prior to this for years) as they had cancelled the insurance policy, I contacted my bank and cancelled the direct debit, that was on the 28/10/24Two days later, I receive an email and text message from them regarding me cancelling the direct debit, the message states "to avoid cancellation fee being charged, we have reinstated your direct debit and policy" WTF! Seems a nice earner, take the monthly payments for insurance, when policy holder puts in a claim 247 home rescue just pull the rug and don't pay out, they knew the age of the boiler but at no time was any advice given, so as well as the monthly premiums + the £95 excess I paid to be told, "I'm no longer insured" I paid £260 out of my own pocket to get boiler repaired and was told by the engineer that my boiler could work away for years to come.Do not use this company! 😡

Title: Complaint - Home Rescue 247 - 1st Nov 2024 (Policy MS681161)
Review: Complaint - Home Rescue 247 - 1st Nov 2024  Please forward this complaint to the CEO of Home Rescue 247. My wife and I are both in their 70s, with a severely bed-bound disabled daughter, whom we care for.  For our peace of mind, we took out a Home Rescue Plus 247 plan to receive the highest level of cover for our Worcester Bosch – Greenstar – 440CDi Boiler and any Plumbing issues. I am a new customer of Home Rescue 247 I had to call an engineer out to deal with our central heating system and a water leak on the central heating pipe. The engineer arrived late on Friday afternoon on the 1st Nov. He stated that we don’t cover Worcester Bosch – Greenstar – 440CDi Boiler and as such I can’t touch the system. Furthermore, I cannot repair the water leak as it would involve him opening up floorboards on the landing and he is not allowed to do this. I said I find this strange as where would one expect the pipework to be located in the house other than some running beneath the floorboards? He said to take it up with the company. It came across to me that the engineer did not want to do the work as it was late Friday afternoon. I became frustrated and extremely disappointed but did not wish to argue with him. He has left us in the lurch without any consideration for our predicament. I have found Home Rescue to be dishonest in offering the cover they promised, and as such I strongly advise and recommend that people look for an alternative trustworthy supplier.  I am an extremely disheartened customer. Nobody from Home Rescue 247 has got back to me to discuss the matter.I hope to receive an appropriate compensation.Thank you.M I Essa (Retired Magistrate)Bolton

Title: Avoid this company at all costs!
Review: This company uses very dubious hard sell techniques. When their engineer arrived to do my annual service he immediately told me I needed a new boiler and showed me a few small nodules on the heat exchanger saying that’s about to go and you need a new boiler. This set alarm bells going so I took pictures and sent them to gas fitter friend. His assessment was that there was no imminent danger of the boiler breaking down. But if there was a problem with the heat exchanger Worcester Bosh would replace it if the boiler was under ten years old and charge only for labour. If 247 were reputable they should have known this and advised me accordingly. Within half an hour of the engineer leaving I received a call from the 247 salesman offering to quote me for a new boiler which I declined.Because the 247 engineer had worried me I contacted the manufacturer Worcester Bosh who sent their own engineer a few days later.On taking the cover off the boiler the Worcester Bosh engineer described what I had been told by the 247 engineer as “Nonsense”He declined to change the heat exchanger as it didn’t need replacing. He carried out a full service and pointed out several parts of the service which had not been done by  247. When I mentioned this to 247 they replied that they only do a visual check. Does this actually constitute a service??So cutting the story short , 247 said they had acted correctly and  it was my decision to accept their advice or not.  I believe it was just a blatant attempt to sell me a boiler I didn’t need. I ended up reluctantly paying a fee to cancel my contract because I certainly didn’t want 247 back at my house again!

Title: Have not refunded even after 2 months
Review: My partner and I needed someone to unblock our drains, and 24/7 Home Repairs sent a plumber without the equipment needed to sort out the problem. The booking cost £120.00 and the plumber cost £120.00. This is back in August 19th 2024. I was upset that we were charged £240.00 with no benefits - just a booking but no work was done on the actual property /drains at all. I asked for a refund and 24/7 Home Repairs agreed they would refund £120.00. They have not done this and it’s now November. Every time I call, I get many apologies and them asking me again for my details like card number, account number etc … But they just will not refund me. They are given me lots of apologies with no action despite them telling me they’ll sort it by the close of day and write credit notes etc. This is why I have now reported them to trading standards.

Review: I have tried to get an inhibitor installed since 2023 and that was missed by 24/7 as they subcontracted the task, hence we agreed over the phone that the service would be done in 2024.Now in 2024 the boiler service was done again without the inhibitor installed. Hence I have been calling them from overseas multiple times, requesting the inhibitor to be installed. This has been promised to me on multiple occasions, however after more than 3 moth, still nothing done and not even a call received.So it just makes sense to request a cancellation, however they also want a cancellation fee.Regards, TinIm looking forward to your reply , from pass experience  i wouldnt get any more update.

Title: I had paid 24/7 for C/H cover, what a disgrace!
Review: I paid 24/7 for C/H boiler cover for a year then had an intermittent fault. I had to pay £75 call out charge upfront. The so called engineer came next day Friday, spent 15min blowing down pipes and 10 typing on his tablet, cleaned an electrode and said it was fixed. (25min total). Broke down the next day same fault. I called 24/7 again, didnt get back to me all weekend, left me freezing no heating or hot water. They said the PCB was faulty and wrote it off, would cost £750 and I had to pay to get it fixed. I got an independent CH engineer who did a full diagnostic check and fixed it for £75. You have been warned! I'm in dispute with them for breach of contract. They phoned me this morning 4/11/24, so they do have my details. This is a stock deniability reply to all complaints.

Title: This company does not even deserve 1…
Review: This company does not even deserve 1 star. I only give it to get my review published. I signed up with them over a  year ago- my so-called cover included a boiler servivce . Engineer came, did nothing, & left saying boiler controls looked ok. I have  had oroper boiler service- engineer always checks oresdure at top of boiler- pumps it up with a bicycke type pump & measures, then ckeans the brushes then does  several physical checks including gas emissions- , all integral part of any service.Not 24/7 engineer- did nothing. Did not even take the front off the boiler to see inside. I called this compsny- who passed me from ine department to snother- all of who only wanted  to convince me to extend my policy. It was a big fight to disconnect from them. Eventually- it took a stressfull 1/2 hour insisting I want to leave them  - just to stop them sucking my money every  month - - for nothing. I was happily boiker insured by Homecare for years- great service & helpfull office staff- never any problems & certainly no stress - unlike this 24/7 outfit. I have learned my lesson- dont change companies if the one youve been with was good. -& warn as many people as possible about the waste of money nightmare called 24/7 home care. All they care about is getting your money every month. Hortible company with rude hassling workers--horrid exoerience!!    BEWARE to AVOID !!! First he tried couple of obvious methods to fix the issue which didn't work but he shown true professionalism by not giving up. Finally he fixed the issue despite the challenges. His outfit was soiled, he kept calm and carried on his job. He left the place cleaned. I truly appreciate this gentlemen. All those who attended my previous claims are also great, sorry I don't remember the names of those engineers. Keep up the good work.

Title: 24/7 Home Rescue - TERRIBLE SERVICE!!
Review: I had my  combi boiler serviced on the 27th August this year. I had paid £39.99 for the rust inhibitor to be replaced. The gas engineer was not instructed to replace the inhibitor so this was not done. I was told two parts needed replacing but heard nothing from 24/7 Home Rescue. After several emails I was asked to provide a report! Eventually, several months later, I was told the expansion vessel and pressure release valve needed replacing. I was quoted over £300 for the repair and another quote for a new boiler. After being  quoted for the repair I received a telephone call today to say the the ‘boiler was deemed to be beyond repair’ and my cover had been cancelled. So I paid my monthly direct debit for September and October with no action being taken on the replacement of parts for my boiler. I want a refund please 24/7 Home Rescue!

Title: Poor customer service
Review: I had two heating cover policies with this company. I had to cancel one due to selling the property, and as I had not had a claim or a service carried out I expected no fee upon cancellation as per the T&Cs. However I was told there would be a £30 admin fee. I contested this and was sent a different version of their T&Cs as evidence. Given that these were never shown to me before, and I was never advised of a change to the T&Cs they were not valid, and I was able to get the fee waived in this instance.The second policy I did have a service carried out. The engineer was good, arrived promptly and carried out the service. However I was never sent the certificate. Furthermore they called on the morning of the appointment to upsell an inhibitor topup. I understand that's a regular maintenance job to do, and the price offered was reasonable - however by calling so soon before the appointment they create a sense of urgency and may panic people into just agreeing on the spot. It should be advised and offered well in advance of the appointment in my opinion. An inhibitor topup was not required in this case, however I had to contact them twice after the appointment to get the refund issued.

Review: Very disappointed with the service and engineer that visited my property yesterday. Firstly he was very moody as soon he came in. It was just after 8.30am. If your not a morning person then DONT do any jobs in the morning. He was rude and frankley no help at all. This is the first time I have rang them for help and appalled with the negative response. Very bad experience.

Title: Be careful with 24*7 Home Rescue.
Review: Be careful with 24*7 Home Rescue.The engineer walked away 2 minutes from the boiler service and said that the flue was installed in a horizontal position instead of a vertical direction. I noticed my flues were fitted horizontally, and the engineer behaved non-professionally. I discussed this matter with an alternative gas engineer and mentioned it is safe and legally acceptable as the flue is clamped and has a specific distance from the walls. I'm sure 24*7 want to make unnecessary money from the customers.With an alternative incident, an electrical engineer from 24*7 visited my property and terminated my bedroom power supply to avoid central power drifting. I resolved it with a local electrician, who noted that the wire terminated by 24*7 was not placed safely and, luckily, did not cause a fire. Also, please read the terms & conditions carefully - They won't cover full electrical works & boiler repairs.Overall, they are the UK's top cheating company.

Title: The most honest review I can write;
Review: The most honest review I can write;247 arranged for an engineer to service the boiler and I was at work, so left a key for the service to take place.When I returned and tried to shower my boiler was faulting.I contacted their emergency helpline and a different engineer was sent to my house. The engineer came and genuinely seemed to have zero clue about boilers. I was absolutely sure that the fault must have occurred when the service took place, but the engineer (by the use of Google) decided the fault was due to the main circuit board and left, leaving me with no heating or hot water.I was then contacted by their call centre to inform me that ‘my boiler was uneconomical to repair, but they’d offer me £200 off a boiler replacement’I asked to escalate the issue as I had a fully operational boiler before their engineer came and I had a boiler that had been deemed unrepairable’I was called by a ‘supervisor’ who was from an off shore call centre and genuinely seemed completely disinterested in the fact that 247 had broken my boiler.I was advised by 247 that if I wasn’t happy with their response I should organise my own plumber, which I did.Long story short, the 247 engineer had increased the pressure too high. The local plumber came, reduced the pressure and it cost me £20.How on earth this company can treat people like this is beyond me. To break my boiler and the condemn it to get me to buy a new boiler should be criminal.Interesting that when you call their new customer department you get their UK based call centre. When you’re trying to discuss a complaint they’re happy for you to discuss with someone who’s second language is English and has absolutely no influence or interest in customer service or satisfaction.I can’t be the only person who’s had this? No idea which algorithm is pumping their ratings. Absolutely disgraceful

Title: I am utterly disgusted with this home…
Review: I am utterly disgusted with this home emergency cover with so called 24/7 Home Rescue i called with an gushing water flooding at the house at 17:39, the Rep told me they have no one available today it will have to be tomorrow,In the following morning i called they said no one is available today it will have to be tomorrow.A severe water flooding by the water mains pressure and they leave me a disabled person with my young family in a such a condition without water and they call them self 24/7 home rescue??I requested to speak with the manager but was declined by the Representative.I had to arrange my own plumber even though I had a full house gas Electric water drain and pest cover a full emergency cover yet left me and my family in a devastating situation without help.

Title: Absolutely awful experience
Review: Absolutely awful experience, terrible customer care.I requested a landlord’s gas safety check.  At the third attempt at booking the appointment the engineer finally arrived: my boiler needed some repair.I paid for this - the engineer turned up, but then found his parts were faulty.  So we needed to arrange another appointment.The work is now fixed, but 3 weeks on and I’m still waiting for my gas safety certificate.  No evidence is provided to say the work is complete, despite umpteen phone calls, usually 30min+, being pushed from department to department.I strongly advise to stay very, very far away.13.11 update - 247 immediately replied to this TrustPilot review saying that they would be in touch - but they haven’t done so. Today I called them myself.  They still refuse to issue evidence of work completed, that I have paid for.  I’m told that I need to book another Gas Safety Check appointment.  So I’m attempting to arrange this.

Title: Arrived at expected time
Review: Arrived at expected time. Issue was resolved quickly and easily.

Title: You pay £95 call-out charge after the monthly payments
Review: They have collected my money for over one year without a call for their help.  When they sent someone for an annual maintenance, the person just came to check and see if everything is working as the boiler is only 3 yrs old, and he spent 3 minutes and left.The first time I called for assistance, they wanted me to pay them £95 when they didn’t even know what is wrong with it. That is absolute nonsense because if there was an excess to pay, it has to be when they have to buy parts because I have been paying them every month, and when they renewed this month without my consent, it’s gone up from £14 to 18 a month, so why should I pay £95 as if I’m calling some random person to come to my home???. I know I should have read this but I didn’t because I took the  policy on the phone and the person took over 40 minutes to explain BUT NEVER MENTIONED ANY EXCESS OF £95. He only told me the good side; up to £1000 on parts when I call for assistance. That is when someone should pay an excess towards the parts. If they don’t need to buy parts but just restarting, or something that I can’t do, WHY SHOULD I PAY AN EXCESS AS IF THEY DONT COLLECT MONEY EVERY MONTH FROM ME? I have cancelled the direct debit and when they called me, I have asked them to cancel it. I got a cheaper one from my bank, which customers pay the rest of the money when the parts they have to order is more than £300 because of the monthly payments of £18.99, and that includes mobile phones repairs, car roadside assistance and travel insurance.  As if they own my bank account, they have sent me an email this morning that they will reinstate my direct debit otherwise they will charge me a cancellation fee, but they renewed the policy without informing me only this month, and I will go to the financial ombudsman if they try to frustrate me after collecting my money for over a year without doing anything for me.I called a random person who charged me £75 and brought the pressure up, and even taught me how to do it by myself next time. This is what they wanted me to pay £95 although they didn’t know what was wrong with the boiler.The sensible thing 24/7 could do is to charge that £95 when they have to order parts because it could be a low pressure, which I couldn’t bring it up,  or something that doesn’t need parts. I would not recommend using their services.

Title: Terrible service overall
Review: Terrible service overall, I have an issue with my central heating/boiler which has only occurred after my annual service. The call centre didn’t understand my issue and sent out a plumber (who which I may add was great and very apologetic when he arrived and discovered he couldn’t do a job). I’ve tried calling to get an issue resolved and still no further forward. This is all after they have doubled my renewal policy after the first year. I’ve looked at my claims on the app (which is terrible) and they have marked all my claims as completed even though nothing has been done. *Update MS626364Update 14/11/24To no surprise I’ve still had zero contact from this company about my issue, this is after speaking to the head engineer on the phone and emailing videos with my issue which has been ignored even after emailing to ensure he had received the emails. The only thing I have heard is a reply to this review apologising for the experience. This neither helps me or fixes the issue.

Title: Fantastic service!!
Review: I have been really impressed with the ease of service afforded to me. I was in a desperate situation with my boiler and was able to sign up for their repair and care cover and get an engineer the same day! There was a repair fee of £99, but the ongoing cost thereafter of £24 pm, made this very good value for money. The best part is that there is no 30 day exclusion period, with this particular policy, which is brilliant. The engineer who attended, was super friendly and manged to temporarily get me back up and running and requested authorisation for replacement parts, which was granted the following day. Title: Dreadful service. No heating or hot water for 5 days. Still not fixed.
Review: I have had no heating or hot water for a week. I raised a claim with 247 and booked an engineer visit the next day detailing the issue. The engineer called beforehand and tried to cancel, then he came and said he didnt have the right qualifications but said we needed a new part. The next day 247 called and asked for £100 to drain the system and would send someone out in 2 days when the qualified engineer was back from holiday. Today they have called saying the qualified engineer isn't available?!! We are cold and frustrated. 247 this is not a good example of customer service and needs fixing urgently. I would not recommend this company.

Title: AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!
Review: AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!The good first - the response time is great!The Negative, and there is a lot - I've previously insured my Boiler for around 5 Years with Domestic and General and Homeserve (who are fantastic) so I am not naive in relation to expectations.I booked my Free Boiler Service with 24/7 - they failed to show for an all day appointment twice - after much negotiation I was given £25 as compensation for two wasted days.My first repair (£95 Call Out) - My (New) Washing Machine was situated below my Boiler, the Engineer who visited scratched all the front with his tools in his Work Trousers - I reported it immediately, but they denied any liabilty and shut me down.Now the important stuff - My second repair, PCB Fault - part ordered by Engineer and a call from them within an hour, if your Boiler is of any age then this policy is useless. The reason for the prompt call becomes apparant - they stated the Boiler was beyond economical repair. Because my Boiler was 9 Years old they added depreciation so valued it at £350, the cost of the repair was £390.  I asked if I could pay the extra £40, they refused.  They then offered me a new Boiler at £2900 but they would contribute £400 - I declined and asked for the £400 or at least the write off value (£350) they declined.This is all in your Terms and Conditions, I should have read them, granted, but surely when I took out the Policy this should have been highlighted as you won't get many repairs for under £400 in the current climate.Never again - awful Company, use D&G or Homeserve - they are Fantastic!

After contacting them to cancel my entire plan they were throwing all sorts of charges at me 1. To cancel my plan £30 2. They wanted a month's money for a service plan which was nonsense, they offered to reduce my monthly payments and for go the £79 excess, the part that was required didn't cost that much, they eventually cancelled making sure I was aware I had to pay a month's plan and £30.  Everything sounds good on paper but they have so many hidden costs it's unreal be very careful with them..

Title: This is the worse ever rescue company…
Review: This is the worse ever rescue company coming from British Gas who were pretty good. I had unfortunate dealings with them on multiple occasions and my summary of the company is- BARELY ANYTHING is covered in the terms. Like for plumbing, draining the system is not covered. Most central heating jobs require a draining system which means we have to pay £135, for toilets replacing some part would mean moving the toilet for which they charge £145 (and no they won't agree to us using the builders to move the toilet)- They use engineers who don't know much about what they are doing. Multiple occasions their engineers conflicted the previous one.- Customer service doesn't follow instructions- to resolve something would require many many calls as teams don't talk and engineer don't follow up.- engineers due to lack of knowledge will make things worse and then blame it on you.- engineers will find a way to make sure it's not covered. They fixed one thing but messed another and blame my system.- engineer would blame previous engineer from the same company for wrong quote and for ordering wrong partsMy boiler had a pressure issue which meant changing expansion vessel. I got that changed by paying for draining which wasn't covered. The engineer did something that my boiler keeps cutting off. Another different engineer came and said that I need a complete boiler strip off which is ridiculous as everything was fine before the engineer did the works.Overall disappointed with them and will not renew my contract.AVOID

Title: Absolutely disgraceful
Review: Absolutely disgraceful. We had a boiler serviced done, but after the visit, we miraculously got a leak in our pipes; can't blame him, but it's a weird coincidence.I asked for another technician to come out the next morning, but it was the evening after (on Friday) only 20 mins before his finish time. He found the leak but said he needed access, so couldn't do the job.We waited until Monday for a joiner to create access, I took photos, sent them via email as instructed and was told it would be 24 hours for them to review, which is ridiculous in itself. It should be close to immediate, for a "24/7 company"My parents are elderly, have Parkinson's and recovering from cancer. It's been 4 days of waiting, it's just snowed, and still no one is coming out. I rang up, and the technical team said it would take up until this afternoon. I'm going to ring later this morning, as I was originally told 24 hours, but it's already been 25.There is nothing 24/7 about this business.Staff themselves are ok to talk to on the phone. This complaint is about the business itself.I'm now looking around for a better place for my parents and am urging everyone I know to not go with this sham of a company.I shall edit this if we get immediate help from them.

I fee like 247 Home Rescue went above and beyond to provide a service. So more than happy to recommend.

Title: Absolutely terrible service
Review: Absolutely terrible service. I have held a policy since 2023 on a new boiler. A condition of the boilers warranty is that it is serviced annually, to this end I had the boiler serviced by 24/7 on 09/02/2023. In turn the next annual service needed to be completed February 2024, however every time I made an attempt to book a service via the app I received a message to tell me that 'Your service is due February 2025, we will contact you nearer the time'. Clearly this was an erroneous message as this would mean that my boiler had not been serviced in February 2024, a service for which I have paid as part of my 24/7 policy. Despite repeated phone calls to 24/7 to enquire as to why my boiler was not services in February 2024 my boiler has still not been serviced. I have again chased 24/7 today, and have been told that the earliest that they are able to service my boiler is 23/01/2025. In essence this will be a 2 year interval between boiler service, which in turn will invalidate the warranty on my new boiler. To say I am annoyed would be an understatement. I have been charged for a service which hasn't been provided, and due to the lack of service by 24/7 the warranty on my new boiler has been invalidated. I will be contacting the Financial Ombudsman Service to raise a complaint, this is not the way to run a business, absolute shambles!

Title: Service is beyond disgusting
Review: As you can see, I initially gave this company a five-star review, as many customers likely do. They are very clever at promising everything a customer wants to hear during the first contact, particularly in an emergency. This makes it easy for people to leave positive reviews right after their initial experience. However, they never ask for feedback on the actual repair work or its outcome, which is where the real problems arise.I recently had two claims—one for a boiler issue and one for a plumbing problem—and the experience has been shocking.Boiler Claim:When the engineer visited, they claimed that my recently installed boiler was eight years old (it is only four years old) and marked it as “at risk.” This designation meant that any repairs would be entirely my responsibility, and the company refused to do anything under the policy. Furthermore, they demanded a full strip service, which I would also have to pay for. Essentially, they offered no service or support but still labeled the boiler as “at risk.”What’s worse is that the boiler was still under warranty, yet the engineer made no effort to check. Instead, they simply declared it “at risk” to push me into paying £2,800 for a replacement boiler. It was clear the engineer’s main goal was to exploit any opportunity to force me to pay thousands of pounds for the company’s profit. The complaints department later justified this by saying the engineer had done nothing wrong, claiming that treating a lie about four-year-old boiler as eight years old was “acceptable.” This reasoning is not only misleading but also insulting.Plumbing Claim:The plumbing issue was handled no better. They sent a plumber who plunged the toilet without resolving the blockage. When I reported that the issue seemed to be more serious and likely required further investigation, I was told their plumbing service only covers basic plunging and does not include any investigation or deeper repairs. As a result, the toilet remained blocked, and they refused to send anyone back.Conclusion:Labeling equipment “at risk” is just a tactic to shift all costs onto the customer while the company takes no responsibility. The boiler replacement and full strip service which not being covered are purely profit-driven schemes, and the engineers seem focused only on finding ways to pressure customers into expensive payments. The fact that they make no effort to honor service or resolve genuine issues is beyond disgusting.I want to warn others to be cautious about trusting this company, as they only interested in making money rather than honour the serviceHere’s the revised version:Subject: Follow-Up on ComplaintI’m following up regarding the company’s delayed response. They finally called me back today, three days later than they were supposed to, the manager claiming the delay was because “my number on their system was incorrect.” This is clearly a lie—if the number was wrong, how were they able to call me now? Such an excuse is both insulting and unprofessional.What’s even worse is that, despite the delay, they stated they wouldn’t be able to do anything to resolve the issue anyway. According to their complaints department who contacted me again to claim again that  the engineer falsely claiming that my four-year-old boiler was eight years old is somehow deemed “acceptable.” If I am dissatisfied with it, I may refer my complaint to the Financial Ombudsman Service.  This response is nothing short of a joke, and it’s clear they have no intention of taking accountability for their actions.I strongly recommend avoiding this company if you can. Their practices are deceptive, their service unreliable, and their excuses nothing but lies!

Title: Worst of the worst service
Review: Worst of the worst service, if there was any negative star I would have give - 5 star. The boiler break down on Monday last week, they don't have any availability till Wednesday. The Engineer H Rashid come to fix the boiler and also did the boiler service and provided the CP12 cert with no defect or advisory. The same night the boiler breakdown again and it started leaking water, called the 247 and they mentioned that they will send the engineer again but there is no sign of engineer until Friday afternoon. Upon checking which seen like may be his faulty which may have leak the boiler he started blaming the boiler installation which was done 6 years ago and boiler was working without any leak until he touched the boiler. When requesting what is the fix he just trying to defend himself blaming the installation and saying I am just a remote engineer and this will be looked by the office and may take a week where he know that it will be ice cold weather next week. there is no call or update, requested a local gas engineer to visit and check the fault and he said its a issue with condenser leak (how we dont know, why after 247 engineer visit ), as got 2 children in the property out which one child under 2 we decided to replace the boiler to avoid ice cold weather. The only thing now 247 will blame the installation as to show themselves innocent. We were covered for last 2 year, why your engineer visiting previously and issuing cert did not point it out and provided the cert with no defective or advisory even this engineer provided the cert. And this is not the first time, last year (Dec) after yearly boiler services the boiler started loosing the pressure and as tenants were on holiday they did not realise until they back and it was over 7 days and we have to pay again to get the engineer to go and look into the issue. the policy WS579912 first Claim id: 1350325 leading into Claim id 1352287

But when I have claim to get it fixed after 10 months, they told that because of age, there is £250 limit. I have already paid  £132 (insurance)+ £75 excess, and in this case there insurance only cover extra £35. Request them to fix hot immersion so that I have at least some hot water but  no reply and if called , wait for a return call which never happened.    There engineers are useless and contradict each other. One did not detect gas leakage during service. Second one broke other thing while fixing gas leakage and third enginner, because of above breakage, did not fix the boiler and call it as  BER and  told my BER limit is £250 and never mentioned this limit before....  Such a fraud company from start to end including complaints department

Title: Great experience being with 24/7
Review: Great experience! The engineer was friendly, considerate, professional, well prepared and looking smart. Even a slight delay on getting the engineer was not so disappointing because of how well allocated engineer Wayne has managed the job on hand. Prior Wayne’s arrival the leaking boiler left us with water coming through the ceiling resulting in required total shut down which took away our ability to use heating and we had no hot water for few days. Wayne has identified the leak and repaired it all in no time leaving us very pleased with how focused he was to get the job done quickly at the top standard, giving us back full access to hot water/ heating and We are Very great full for his help. Big thank you to Wayne!!! Much appreciated.

Title: Scammers - Do Not Use these guys
Review: Absolutely shocking experience with 24/7. I had a slow running sink which suggested an issue was present. Given I had yearly cover with 24/7, I called to have someone come down to take a look. I was sent an engineer 3days later, the engineer suggested a drainage issue but mentioned he wasn’t a drainage engineer and that he would create a report for 24/7 to send out an engineer. I followed up with 24/7 that same day, however they refused to send out a drainage engineer claiming that the job would require a drainage camera to locate the cause of the issue and they don’t cover that despite the fact that I took out the full cover with them and my drains were covered under that plan.  Absolute scammers.

Title: Will do anything to sell a boiler!
Review: Check their reviews on Yelp first! Sales person wasn't transparent about call-out fees when I was sold a boiler and how that impacts my current policy. 247 Staywarm, who are a sister company of 247 Home Rescue, have told me that I don't need to pay for call-out charges, but this is not true! He wasn't clear about the difference between the warranty and the plan I'm paying for. I can't escalate to the Financial ombudsman service since 247 Staywarm who sold me the boiler isn't regulated by them.

Title: Ms M Conteh
Review: Ms M Conteh Very bad experience. My boiler break down last week on 20th/11/24 when it was really cold. I reported the problem to 24/7 Home Rescue. An engineer came on the 22nd who diagnosed the problem. He told me, he is going to the sales department to get the part but the office will contact me for options either to repair or get a new boiler. After an hour the office didn't not call, I called them. To my surprise, I was told my boiler is written off and that they will offer me a boiler on finance interest free because to repair the boiler will cost £486.I was paying breakdown cover for 1 year £17,99 a month and when my boiler breakdown 24/7 home rescue DID NOT FIX it.I was so disappointed with their service. I suffered with my family,with 2 grand kid for 3 days, l have to call private engineer to fix my boiler.The boiler that was written off is working perfectly.24/7 home rescue is NO good.I will never commend to anyone

Title: Great switch, great service, great price

Title: My old boiler was due a service
Review: My old boiler was due a service. The day before it developed a fault so 247 changed the service to a fault callout which would take place 2 days later. They told me that service engineers cannot do a repair and repair engineers cannot do a service. This is untrue as an engineer confirmed they do both. Unable to repair my boiler 247 cancelled my contract. Despite that they have now taken 2 months payments since the cancellation. Avoid

Title: ref ms614466
Review: ref ms614466i took out boiler cover with this company in October 2023, giving them the benefit of the doubt having had a problem with them in 2018.i have been waiting for a boiler service since September, i did cancel my first scheduled appointment due to illness.  They cancelled my next one due to snow,  nobody called to reschedule so a week later i have had to call them, no appointments were available, and that someone would call me, they did but not until 2 days later to offer me a service in Feb 2025. But in the mean time my payments have increased nearly 2 fold and ive not even had a service with the company yet.  I called to speak to retentions to discuss this, guess what, noone available to speak to me, i would stay away from this company at all costs, and in my opinion ive had such a shoddy service i want to cancel my cover straight away and want a full refund for payments taken.

Title: Hopeless company with double standards…
Review: Hopeless company with double standards and different views by different engineers. A 24/7 Home Rescue engineer turned up today for the annual service and says that the boiler is inaccessible in an outdoor shed. This is after another 24/7 engineer came one year ago and serviced the same boiler and said it was fine. How can this be when Vaillant themselves installed it? What is happening here? The guy had to wait 10 mins whilst I had popped out after taking whole day off work with no time slot the night before. What a hopelessly, useless company this is!! I have cancelled and going with someone else now.

Title: I was with Home Rescue for a couple of…
Review: I was with Home Rescue for a couple of years and finally I am rid of them. They did not honour their contract with me. They changed it mid term when I had to make a claim, as my boiler was 10 years old but mid term went over 11 years old. They increased the excess even though the contract quoted a lower excess. The office in Bangladesh have no empathy with contracts and just quote their policy of age etc. They downgraded the policy because the boiler was over 11 years, so I left them, but couldn’t leave because of cancellation fees. They took a further higher payment due to a supposed error, never compensated. They just took a final lower payment and offered a service I never took, no compensation, no refund for the month I had to pay for and an excess in breach of contract. They quote their policy and their contract but your contract with them is ignored. Avoid, Avoid Avoid. They don’t refer to managers, so forget about complaining. I had further contact since my complaints and leaving and was given an apology, an explanation, which I didn’t agree with, but they offered a small goodwill gesture of a last payment refund now paid 6/12/4 so I have upgraded the stars to 3 for effort.

Title: Do not trust this company
Review: Rubbish company. They breach contract. They offer no compensation even though they apologise from their overseas offices. The contract only works if they have to replace parts, the engineers are decent enough, but the truth is, they are told to make temporary fixes, keep it going and eventually you might get the part you needed 2 years ago. Leaks return if parts are not replaced. Do not use this company. Don’t bother to complain, you won’t be listened to. Just platitudes, no care, no compensation policy for genuine grievances. I want to warn you. Hope you avoid in time and are not reading after a problem.

Amending to 1 star

Title: Worst company ever

Title: The service is shocking! And a JOKE!
Review: The service is shocking!I had my annual boiler service booked for 4th December 2024 this was booked and confirmed with 247 on 8th October 2024 that is 8 weeks in advance. I received a text from 247 today at 16:30 to tell me that the appointment for tomorrow has been cancelled, due to unforeseen circumstances and I must book another date. The next available date is 19/02/2025, 11 weeks later, not acceptable, what a joke! Because I had booked this boiler service well in advance I arranged to take a day of work for the day of the service. I now have wasted day tomorrow because of the late notice. Not good enough and wished I had never accepted the renewal of the policy in January. I will be sure not to accept the renewal again. I will be paying for a better service from another provider. After I complained they managed to arrange an engineer to complete my service on Wednesday 11th December, amazingly. The engineer turned up and spent less than 20 minutes completing the thorough service and add the addictive that I paid an additional £39.99 apparently. I say apparently because he left no paperwork at all to explain what he had apparently done within the 20 minute visit. It is more than Shocking service its a JOKE.

Title: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!
Review: The engineer came out and tried to repair the heat exchanger but ended up snapping a screw on one of the electrodes which meant we needed a new one.  The Company "247 Home Rescue" then decided it was not cost effective to fit a new one as the bill for parts and labour would be around £600.  They calculated that my boiler was 8 years old and they would not do any repair costing more than £250! (Beware of this loophole). They terminated my contract and sent me a quote for a new boiler.I then contacted British Gas and explained the situation.  I took a Homecare agreement out with them for a similar monthly payment, they arrived the next day, fit a new heat exchanger and its been fine ever since. My problem with this Company is that their engineer snapped the screw which caused the problem and then the Company refused to repair the boiler because the work was going to cost more than £250.  My yearly premium was more than £250!   This same engineer has been coming to the property for 4 years and had been the only person to have ever worked on the boiler.  He did the annual service every year, the last one being 3 weeks before this incident.

Title: Mixed
Review: I had boiler service and cover.Positives - boiler engineer for the service was very good and helpful.I did not have to use the 24/7 callout so I don't know if it is any good.Negatives - in order to book the service, they call you and start asking for personal details to confirm who you are. I was then offered a service at short notice. It feels exactly like the start of a scam and is very disconcerting. Why can't you book online? Why can you only choose the next day or no day at all? Also, my renewal price is almost double, which is fine, but when I wanted to cancel (ie turn off autorenew) this cannot be done online and has to be done on the phone. Why? This is unacceptable. Judging from other comments I'm sceptical as to whether the autorenewal will actually be switched off... So I will also cancel the direct debit to be on the safe side, and follow up my cancellation with an email.

Title: Raheed got my radiators to work

Rasheed was very friendly and he took his time to get both radiators in my living room working again and he checked all the other radiators too. Thank you so so much Rasheed I'm really grateful God Bless.

Title: Difficult Service Experience
Review: I was with 247 Home Rescue for about 2 years. When the time came to get a boiler service booked the engineer did not show. In the first year I was able to rectify this by chasing them to get another engineer to attend. However, in the second year I couldn't book an engineer on their online booking form and when I then had to contact someone via email or phone the engineer did not show up at the property again. To be honest I couldn't be bothered to chase them again to get another engineer booked in, it is in their service agreement that they should get an engineer to provide a service for my boiler and I shouldn't have to chase them for this each year. So I decided to leave and go to a different company.Secondly, when it came to renewing my cover I decided to cancel this renewal. I received a phone call from the company, even though I had specified in my cancellation email to them I did not want them to call me, just to cancel the renewal. When I spoke to the employee on the phone they went through the usual process of trying to offer me a better deal, but after some consideration my decision didn't change. The customer service advisor then kept offering me the same prices and repeating themselves to which I said no I just want to cancel. I kept saying I do not want to renew because I want to go with someone else, you're prices don't make enough different. This went on maybe one or two more times. I then said look I just want to cancel the renewal, I then get asked 'why?' in a reasonably annoyed tone. Making it sound like my reasons were not justified or relevant. I responded to this last question by saying I don't have to give you a reason, I don't want to renew the policy please cancel it. The advisor then tried to offer me the same prices AGAIN to which I said look just cancel the policy I don't want to go through this again. Their tone changed again, like as if I had made it a personal choice on them, they then finally cancelled the renewal.I understand some people may be passionate about what they do and the company they work for, but when I've said 3 times I want to cancel, explained why then get asked why again it is just frustrating. I don't have to give a reason, if I don't want your product then I don't want it, just cancel the renewal. It made me feel as though I was going to be forced into continuing the following year. I don't love being called either just randomly by companies, I'd rather email or do this online for this exact reason, and arguing with me for why I want to leave is not going to change my mind, but confirm my opinion. In reality I should really be refunded for the lack of their boiler service as well! I do not feel that I was rude or disrespectful but I felt the advisor was to me. I probably wouldn't use them again unless their prices were significantly better than everyone else's.

Title: Extremely disappointing experience with 247
Review: We had an incredibly frustrating experience with 247 when we had a water leak from our boiler that we couldn’t stop. We contacted 247 for emergency assistance, only to be told they couldn’t send a plumber out for 48 hours or we could opt to be placed on a cancellation list. With no time to wait, we called our own plumber to fix the issue.To make matters worse, 247 then informed us that we were not covered because we had contacted a plumber directly, even though they were unable to provide service themselves in a timely manner. This lack of support and clarity has completely eroded our confidence in the company.We’ve since cancelled our policy, and based on this experience, I would strongly advise against using 247. The lack of service, communication, and flexibility is simply unacceptable.

Title: Not worth carrying on with this…
Review: Not worth carrying on with this company. They will find fault to sell a new boiler. Contract no  :MS478810Scaremongering saying things like your boiler wont last very long just pray carbon monoxide alarm does is not triggered. Anyways for me i never had great experience with 247 Home rescue but becuase my boiler has been fine i have been with them for the past few years. Never stopped disappointing me sending me sub contractors who do not know where the water filler pipe were. They eventually send me their company engineer. Well well opened the machine a little throughly then previous ones but then he had to find something and slapped a danger note on the boiler. Very much scaring me to consider a new boiler. Cheap and affordable if your boiler is not breaking down. Please read small prints with this company.

Title: This is one of the worst companies
Review: This is one of the worst companies, I have ever seen.  I do NOT normally write up good or bad reviews....but this company has infuriated me twice in 9 months, regarding a bolier, c/h repair:  Multiple visits, multiple calls, multiple parts and 2 respective complaints for both claims.  The engineers seem to be incompetent, around the Harrow area. They take too long in between engineer visits, even through when customer is old/vulnerable and been without heating or hot water for neatly 3 weeks as at 9th Dec 2024.  I will be not be renewing any of my 3 family household contracts.  I suggest you avoid and pay British Gas the extra money and have peace of mind with qualified and professional people.

Title: Most unethical and unreliable
Review: Most unethical and unreliable service company, that I had to deal with. I think this could be marked as fraudulent and listed in FCA Warning List. Took the boiler cover last year in 2023, and was promised 1 free service and full cover for heating. When claimed for some intermittent boiler issues, they never did any repairs, however said that the boiler cannot be covered under their service agreement by their service engineer and wanted to sell a new boiler. They said, they would cover the boiler only if we did the repairs. I do not understand their cover, if I need do the repairs or buy new boiler from them? Had several complaints and later referred to the financial ombudsmen for getting our complaints looked into. It took over and year for the ombudsmen to reward a compensation for their mistakes. However still, they never attended to the claim. Refused to consider the claim and again took the direct debit for second year renewal. Their explanations in return is very rude and threatening. Stated that, I did only request DD return and not cancellation??Worst customer service ! I think these insurance companies are just here to scam people and provide no actual service in reality. People should go for the local tradesmen and get their boiler repaired from them instead of relying on these insurance companies who never delivery any service when needed. Please Avoid them at any cost !!

Title: Scott
Review: Scott, our engineer is always polite and cheerful. He explains everything we need to know and never makes a mess. Thanks Scott

Title: Update: they got worse after the last mess they made
Review: Update:I would give a minus score if I could. Since the issues below, they did come to fix the door but didn't bother to sign the boiler off with its required checks during the appointment, a 5 minute job. Instead they rushed off and forgot. So we contacted them immediately and they asked for a new appointment. Tenant took more time off. Engineer came out again, arrived with a terrible temper. The boiler has a small decorative ledge on the front to stop the children putting their hands on it. It's one screw to take off. He said he won't remove it. The tenant cried this time because of his attitude and rudeness. Then he left. Job still not complete. I will be cancelling my contract today. This has been the most ridiculous process.  Original review in Sep:Pretty terrible experience since I've been with them. I hired them to install a new boiler and cover the heating system. They installed it, a year later when they serviced it they told me the last engineer had broken parts on it so they needed to fix it. They took ages to fix it and were barely reachable when organising dates/times.The year after another engineer came for a service, he shared that the last engineer had broken the boiler cover and it must be replaced. So again it has been a mess getting hold of the right team to get the cover replaced. Their call centre has no idea what they're doing or what team handles what issue. They tried to pin the cost back onto me when their own engineers admitted it being a problem on their end. They admitted it was their fault on the phone but said they wanted to charge me anyway! Finally, they relented. Insane!

Title: Happy customer
Review: Joined on line and then received a telephone call a few minutes later saving money on the premium. The staff that I dealt with were courteous, knowledgeable and very polite. A credit to the company.

Title: 24/7 an absolute rip off
Review: 24/7 an absolute rip off. I kept paying monthly direct debit and paid excess fee £95 twice for one event when I had a drainage blocked last month. They send out engineers(cowboys) whom more likely to view and write reports only rather than to complete the task and finally I was told those blocks are not included in the policy. I had to call out plumbers from Checkatrade and job is done after 10 days of 24/7 saga. Surprisingly, this 24/7 is leading all the major comparison sites for boiler and drainage cover, not sure how. Please stay away from 24/7, hassle is not worthy!!!!! A pure SCAM !!!!!!!!!

Title: Easy to sign up
Review: Easy to sign up, and they rang me back and went through options for appliance cover, even gave a further discount.  Operative was very helpful.

Title: I wouldn’t recommend.
Review: I called 24/7 Home Rescue as my kitchen had flooded from a pipe under the sink. After much pressing, someone was sent the same day to fix the pipe. The following day the kitchen was flooded again, I called back and was told the engineer would come out again. Half way through the day the engineer called to say there wasn't much point in the visit, as I had mentioned I was having a plumber come to check the pipes in 4 days and that he couldn’t do anything further. I complained and asked for my £95 excess back as the leak was not stopped and did not get resolved and I was refused. They then said I dismissed the engineer and would arrange my own plumber which doesn’t make sense and isn’t true. I’ve been a customer for many years but when my policy expires I will be going elsewhere. If you have an emergency, I wouldn’t call this company.

Title: Shocking service and gets worse
Review: Shocking service, started with a fault with hot water not being hot enough.Engineer visited and removed the heat exchange plate, did not refit it correctly. Contacted customer service daily with concerns of a substantial leak from the boiler. Absolutely awful They are trying to get the manufacturer to fix it under warranty for a fault the engineer has caused. 8th day with out heating and hot water. Waiting for a call back from a manager which could take 24hrs, but they have said if I buy heaters they will reimburse me upto £30 with a receipt. 9th day without heating/hot water, manager called me 23 hours in to their 24 hour time frame to get back to the customer.Still no resolution. Another cold night.10th day with out heating and hot water. Veissman engineer came out today, questioned if the engineer was even competent, in his words " the worst job he's seen in 25 years" Hundreds of pounds worth of damage caused to the boiler components. Ordered parts but if one part isn't in stock it will have to be ordered from Germany if this is the case the boiler won't be fixed until after Christmas.I will also have to pay for the parts because the warranty will be invalid due to 24/7 not servicing to the manufacturers instructions. All the factory seals are still in place internally proving the correct servicing procedure has not been followed.On a plus side I can spend £50 on heaters now. In for another cold one.Day 13, still no heating or hotwater, I've managed to arrange for the manufacturer to repair the boiler on Wednesday, cost me £366 due to the the damage being caused by a 3rd party (24/7 home rescue engineer) and the services,(had 2 off 24/7) not being carried out to the manufacturers instructions.15 days after 24/7 damaged the boiler finally got it repaired by Veissman, cost me £366.Now the pantomime of dealing with the complaints department, Absolutely awful. Started with an offer of £30 compensation for 15 days with out hot water or heating, to date they've upped it 3 times now we're hitting £100.Refused and have asked for it to be referred to the financial ombudsman.

Title: Scam helpless
Review: Scam, they said they will cover your boiler breakdown,  but they don't,  as the small print says if scam, please check out the small print with them. IF Your boiler has been declared beyond economic repair (BER),they don't cover. they don't tell you this when you sign up with them.Please be aware,  don't pay them like a fool. Check the small print.  Don't let them take your money and assuming your boiler is protected. Aa I have been with them for the last 3 years, paying£17.99 a month for boiler abd heating system cover. Call out £45 each time you claim. When I made an claim,  they use the excuse of beyond economics repair BER, and refused to repair my boiler. Left me and family in the cold. Really Awful company 247. They voided my policy and cancelled my boiler and heating cover, and put me to basic home cover for £8.99 a month,  what's the point to have cover from them.

Title: Brilliant
Review: We had an boiler engineer come out and repair our boiler. I think he's name was Daniel Moore he was brilliant he had to go of and get a part came back and fitted it. It's working great kids are glad to as they don't have to put more layers on . Highly recommend them 👌. Have a great Christmas and new year.

Title: Been with this company for 2 years last…
Review: Been with this company for 2 years last year paid for a rust inhibitor which was not put in this year booked my service and they tell me that the boiler is within 300 mil of the window however this was not picked up last year or previous 6 years with British gas They We're coming out again to check the measurement of the flu to the window and again do service  but failed  to turn up so wasted all day waiting although I did get a text message at 3:30 to say he was on his way he still didn't turn up After putting a complaint in they agreed to come out 2 days later to do the work which they turned up the flu adaptor kit was wrong for the boiler and during the service they topped up the inhibitor in the heating system which was supposed to have been done last year but wasn't however now I have a water leak from the radiator they drained having called them back again I have now got to wait 4 days for them to come and sort out the problem My advice is to avoid this company as the advertising gives you the impression that they operate 24 hours a day however the only thing that operates 24 hours a day is a call line to log an issue then you have to wait 24 to 48 hours for a call back and in my case another 2 days for a booking My complaint is ongoing they did offer me a £29 refund   but was not accepted as I sat in all day waiting  and will update with outcome but may well be going to the ombudsman regarding the issues I've had if outcome is not satisfactory

Title: Lack of support for cold tenants
Review: A manager from 247 Home Rescue finally got in touch, but was very belligerent & told us in no uncertain terms we weren't covered. I said I had previously asked for a quote if we weren't covered (although we pay them a monthly fee for the boiler & heating). We didn't get this. I asked who the engineer was & she said she couldn't say as they aren't employed by 247, but work is sub-contracted out to independent engineers. The manager said she had phoned me numerous times, but I have no record of this & no emails from her. She promised another engineer would go out, but no word when this is going to happen as yet.

Title: Wrecked a perfectly good boiler.
Review: I had a free boiler service with them due to another policy I had with them. My boiler was working fine, I called them, heard nothing so assumed my boiler was fine. Came home and turned it on and it was dead with no signs that it would ever work. I had it looked over by a proper engineer who could get nothing out of it. Not long after, I got calls coming in asking about me having a new boiler, saying how quickly they could install it, etc. I was astounded, not believing what I could hear. I tackled them about why it stopped working and they said it was old. Yes it was but it was working fine. I felt they purposely wrecked it. What was annoying was that they never phoned me to say it wasn't working.

Title: STAY AWAY FROM 247 home rescue
Review: STAY AWAY FROM 247Please, stay way from 247 they not professional and just want to sale their products.I had a boiler cover with them and I took the cover for the boiler for more than 10 years old but when I had problems with not hot water almost 2 weeks ago, I was told my boiler was too old and I’m not cover and I have to pay to get it fixed.The engineer sent over told me it can be fixed temporarily but someone will contact me to offer me a new boiler with good price.The next day I was pushing to take new boiler and be told it cannot be repaired in their cost so I have to pay for the repair and said that I have to take a new boiler for a good price.Staff no well trained for customer service and would listen to customer but just putting their points down.I immediately cancel my insurance and now got British Gas and they are really good service.PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM 247 THEY ARE NOT GOOD AT ALL.GC680788

Title: Scam
Review: I feel cheated after taking their premium home care service. My annual boiler service was canceled twice—first due to "unforeseen circumstances" and the second time after I waited the entire day (engineer was meant to come between 1-6pm), only to be told at 5:30 PM that the engineer had faulty equipment. Half an hour before the first service, I got a call from the sales department asking me to pay £40 for an additional optional service to increase the boiler's longevity. I feel this might be the reason behind the cancellation as they want to prioritise those who are willing to pay extra on top of the premium costs. The next available appointment was over three months away. Because of 24/7's poor service, I've lost my boiler warranty. They seem more interested in taking money than actually serving their customers. In my opinion, this feels like a scam. I would not recommend them to anyone. I previously used Homeserve, whose service was far superior—at least 10 times better. The only reason I switched was because Homeserve raised their premium, but clearly, that was a mistake.

Title: Shame I can’t give this company 0…
Review: Shame I can’t give this company 0 stars. Moved into new property in August. Took out whole home cover. Boiler started leaking last week. Engineer came 4 days later after paying £95 and said he needed to order a part but stopped the leak and said we wouldn’t have any hot water until it was fixed. Received a call later that day saying I wasn’t covered as it was beyond economical repair as the boiler was too old. Details they had been provided with when I signed up. The part would have been covered but after adding 3 hours labour charge it wasn’t.  They could of course install a new boiler this week at only £40 a month for 10 years. I asked for a manager to call me back but by the time they attempted to call I had resolved my issue with someone more reputable. I have now received thinly vailed threatening messages that I am going to incur further costs for cancelling my direct debit. Companies like this should be avoided at all cost!

Title: The worst service, avoid!
Review: Anyone looking to get home Emergency cover with 247 - DON’T. I have been without heating since the 3/12. Have had 5 engineers and 1 no-show. In the process my hot water stopped working due to something one of the engineers did. The last engineer told me it was my hive receiver and they don’t cover it and I need to replace it. I did (at my own expense) and I still have NO HEATING. They keep saying they will refer to this team and that (deployment, authorisation) and call me back but they NEVER call back. I’ve even been ‘lucky’ to get check ins from a technical manager but he calls not knowing the latest status, and promising to call back without actually phoning back when he says he will. This is the worst service I have ever received!!!

Title: Review
Review: The man that came out was amazing he was so polite and spent a lot of time fixing and checking everything the other man that came first was also brilliant everybody that I have spoken too from your company have been brilliant and someone came out so quickly to help me as I had no hot water and heating. I will recommend your company to everyone I know and I thank you from the bottom of my heart for all your help.

Title: What a load of rip off merchants
Review: What a load of rip off merchants , I was only with them 3 months and I'm down £314 ..and a condemned boiler, no heating and hot water till january 2nd. They came to do a first service and straight away tried to sell me a new boiler saying  mine was beyond economical repair..I said I'd been with British gas for years and regularly had it serviced and not once had they mentioned the boiler was on its last legs or unserviceable .I told the girl if I got another gas safe engineer would they say the same and she became very defensive ..against my better judgement I paid £268 for them to replace parts on boiler only for the work man to turn up and disconnect the boiler . They then quoted £2685 to replace the boiler ...I cancelled the policy then and there and have gone with Boxt who are installing a new boiler for £1995.. avoid 24/7 terrible service ......PC690330 23/12/24  There on the phone first thing trying to sell me a new boiler , I asked why they had withheld £100 of the £268 I had paid for yhe replacement parts that were never used in the end and were refunding , they guy on the phone said "oh was that not explained " no I said , oh ill get someone to contact you about it , so as your boilers been B,E,R. Could I go through some quotes fir replacements ...  No I told them BOXT are fitting g a new boiler for me . He then ended the call.. I was only with 24/7 3 month and I was constantly asked to renew my boiler.

Title: waste of money
Review: My boiler started leaking water in December 24 which meant shutting down the heating system to prevent damage to the room below.  It took 72 hours for the emergency engineer to attend despite the extreme low temperatures at the time. There was no offer of alternative heating and my request to have a manager prioritise a visit was ignored. The engineer's visit led to a demand for £191 for a repair (on top of the £45 call out charge/excess already taken).  I refused as I could see nothing in the policy I bought that suggested I was responsible for paying for the part and repair - that was why I paid £129 for the policy initially to cover these circs.  I eventually had the work done for free under my Aviva home contents and property insurance. They were so much more helpful. I bought this 24/7 policy expecting an urgent repair service - it was a complete waste of money - all they seem keen on is getting more and more from you. Look carefully at their cancellation charges before you sign up, and expect them to claim they cannot list every exclusion in their policy as it would take too much space.

Title: Arrived when scheduled and fixed the…
Review: Arrived when scheduled and fixed the problem quickly

Title: Persistent contact when you decide to leave at the end of your policy
Review: It is now January 13th and I am still getting reminders about renewing my policy. Now they are going straight to my junk inbox. They are probably still sending texts but as I have blocked them I no longer see them.So I have deleted my long review because I appreciate it was probably too long and that would mean the message I am trying to present is lost. So only buy a policy if you are prepared to keep getting reminders months after you decided to buy a cheaper policy with another company. Make sure if you do not renew with them to cancel your direct debit as soon as possible because it seems each reminder is sent because a failed attempt has been made by 24/7 to take payment. They are now taking the piss! I will never consider using them again because they do not seem to understand that people shop around and buy cheaper when they can especially considering there is no difference in cover. They have no intention of looking at this practise because they are still sending the reminders. My initial review was 3 stars because when I was covered by them I had no issues. Avoid avoid avoid!!!!!!!!!!!!

Title: Scandalous charge
Review: To be correct ….. the technician was wonderful and sorted out the problem BUT to charge over £230 per hour is absolutely scandalous. We clearly stated that this was not an emergency and even if it was most plumbers will charge up to £70 call out charge and then £60-100 per hour. They charged me for 4 hours work £925…. with together with the call out charge would have been nearly £1000. Absolutely disgraceful. They initially came out …. as an emergency call on the Friday but the guy couldn’t do the job but I was still charged, then they sent John out the next day ( who was great ) on the Saturday but I was charged more because it was at the weekend. I was also told I would get a price for the job beforehand ….. never happened and I could kick myself for not asking. Just be careful with this company, great job done but scandalous charge. I refused to pay the £925 and was given a discount, now paying £800 which I still think is very expensive.

Title: Do not expect to be covered
Review: Do not expect to be covered for repairs. I have home care plus cover and when I called to have a leaking boiler condensate pipe replaced a technician was sent to tell me something I already knew and time was wasted checking if I was covered, which I wasn't because it wasn't considered a "breakdown". Over £200 (not including monthly insurance charge) and a week later the boiler was repaired. I also read a review about "beyond economical repair" and when I asked to see guidance to see if my 12yo boiler was in that category I got nothing. Do not trust!

Title: Avoid
Review: It would be impossible to list all the issues I have had with 247 Home Rescue over boiler 'cover.' In brief: 1) The boiler was neither serviced nor fixed within 13 months, despite the monthly fee; 2) When a fault was discovered, the cause of the fault was mis-diagnosed by the 247HR engineer (an independent engineer showed me that there was no fault in the named parts - the sump and the manifold); 3) I was initially charged for a chemical that was never used (as no work had been done) and received only a refund of this and my exit fee (not the year's fees charged beforehand);4) I had to fight for both refunds;5) Their communication leaves much to be desired.What this company lacks in service it makes up for with the crude tick-box and rapid stone-walling of its complaints' process. No matter how clearly you document your facts and provide evidence, you will get little recompense, as they are unregulated by the financial ombudsman and they know it. They returned fees that they should never have charged in the first place (by their own admission), but not the year's fees for zero service.

Title: 247 HOME RESCUE (real name: EVOLUTION INSURANCE COMPANY LIMITED)
Review: I HAVE REPORTED 247 HOME RESCUE TO THE OMBUDSMAN SERVICE SO AWAITING THEIR RESPONSE. MY BOILER EXPANSION TANK ON AN UNVENTED SYSTEM WAS PASSING SO THEY SENT OUT AN ENGINEER UNCERTIFIED FOR MY SYSTEM WHO GAVE THEM THE WRONG INFORMATION THAT MY SYSTEM WAS INCORRECT? ABSOLUTELY CLUELESS CUSTOMER SERVICE STAFF WHO HAVE REFUSED TO SEND OUT A QUALIFIED ENGINEER FOR A SECOND OPINION AND THIS IS HAVING BEEN INSURED FOR 3 PREVIOUS YEARS... I WILL NEVER USE THESE AMATEURS AGAIN!  REMEMBER THEY ARE ONLY INTERESTED IF YOUR SYSTEM IS OPERATING CORRECTLY NOT IF IT EVER FAILS AND NEEDS REPAIRED!!

Title: Only giving a 1 star review as I cannot give a Zero.
Review: Had an issue where my hot water wasn’t getting hot and my heating was stuck on all the time, and wouldn’t turn off no matter what I did.Contacted 247 on Boxing Day (This happened on Christmas Eve, but being nice I didn’t want to have to call an engineer out on Christmas Day) Turns out the earliest an engineer could attend anyway was 30th December. He quickly identified a fault in a switch which would need to be replaced. He said he would contact 247 to get approval to go ahead and would either return that day or on 31st.In preparation for doing the work, he turned off the heating to drain the system.He didn’t return on 30th and by lunchtime on 31st I called 247 back for an update, only to be told they were still awaiting the engineers report and quotation before they could authorise the repair. They were not interested that I live with my elderly mother who they have left with no heating for 2 days and said they should have the report by the end of today or possibly tomorrow and would call me back then.I asked to speak to a manager but was told there is a 24 hour wait for a managers call back.So now we have another day in a freezing cold house, with no heating or hot water.I doubt I will get a call back from a manager having read some other reviews, but I do hope I am proved wrong.This was my first ever time of having to call them out for an issue, and I am not impressed with their Customer Service, the agent was the most disinterested she could possibly be.Definitely avoid this company, I certainly won’t be renewing with them next year.UPDATEA manager did call me and was apologetic, said they had now received the information from the engineer and had agreed to the fix, but it required a drain down of the system, which I’m not covered for (even though I have the top level of cover) so another £108 spent (discounted from £145 due to the inconvenience) and now 1 day later and still no sign of the engineer, so another day/night sat in a freezing cold house with no heating or hot water.

Title: Cowboy company
Review: I was advised and then emailed to get an independent second opinion about the boiler at my new build home. The first engineer was shifty and in a hurry to finish the Friday late afternoon job. I ended up not getting reimbursed, and surprisingly, after this independent opinion was received, a second engineer could be organised. I have been scammed.
